Job Description:
Kick-start your career in the online gaming world and experience the very latest in technology and innovation.

Do you see yourself as one of those “out-of-the-box thinkers”, “Technical masterminds”, “Outstanding creatives”, or “Mind-boggling number crunchers”? If so, we want to welcome you to the Betway family and celebrate what makes you unique!

Our global customer base is exploding and we need your skills to support us on this exciting journey! Don’t look back and submit your application before the opportunity passes you by..

Reporting to: Security Operations Team Lead

Department: IT Operations/Technology

Team: IT Security Operations

Within the Technology Department we are the eager problem solvers of the business. It is our job to implement efficient and scalable solutions, whilst focussing on simplicity and elegance. For us it’s not a job – it’s what we love. Try and test. Learn and adapt. That’s how we do things. We’re on a mission of continuous improvement, always striving to keep our products and systems secure and at the forefront of the industry.

We’ve built software that allows our customers to bet on over 125,000 sports fixtures, catering to over 300,000 users placing over 15.5 million bets. Whether it’s product development, delivery processes, or reporting systems – we never stop learning and innovating and always ensure we have the best tool for the job. Efficiency is how we define success – and the average response time of our sites is just 100 milliseconds.

We’re a team of knowledge sharers and collaborators, working in an agile and fast-paced environment. A 24/7 operation specialising in cutting edge technologies, where the possibilities for expansion are limitless. We encourage and support learning, growth and innovation. From global conferences and courses to weekly idea sharing get-togethers (otherwise known as Ted Talks for Betway), we love to talk about and try new things.

Purpose of the role:

The Junior IT Security Engineer will be expected to support the Sec Operations Team’s vision of protecting the business’s digital assets, the maintenance of our systems\\controls and the expansion of our security architecture.

The ideal candidate will be able to adapt to a fast-paced, ever-changing environment, as well as maintain a professional, security-focused approach to all tasks and also ensure they keep up-to-date with current threat trends and use that to the benefit of the business and its goals.

You will be responsible for:
Assist in developing and maintaining the security posture of the business.
Act as an initial point of contact for security issues raised via the Service Desk.
Assist the Security Analysts with monitoring daily/weekly alerts and the investigation thereof.
Assist various teams with prioritizing patches and security fixes.
Assist in the management and investigation of suspected cyber-attacks and/or incidents.
Act as a security evangelist\\business enabler.
Help manage the development and implementation of security policy, standards, guidelines and procedures to ensure ongoing improvement and maintenance of security posture.
Assist the team with required independent security reviews and compliance audits conducted by external vendors.
This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of responsibilities. The job holder may be required to complete any other reasonable duties in order to achieve business objectives.

You will have:
Working experience with the Microsoft Tech Stack (Office 365, Windows, Server)
Strong time management and troubleshooting skills.
Basic knowledge of vulnerabilities, threats, attack methods, and infection vectors.
Good understanding of and working experience with multiple operating systems.
Windows, Linux, MAC OS
Basic experience with security architecture, engineering and operations.
Good understanding of networking fundamentals
OSI Model, Ports, Protocols
Demonstrable analytical abilities.
It would be a bonus if you also had:
Knowledge of or experience within the gambling industry.
CompTIA Security+ or equivalent or at least working towards a security certification.
An understanding of DLP/IDS/IPS technologies and the ability to investigate and provide detailed reports on findings.
Working experience with SIEM technologies as well as the development, implementation and maintenance of custom playbooks.
Working experience with the Microsoft Threat Protection stack and Azure Security.
Person Specification:
Strong interpersonal skills
A self-starter
Takes initiative
You should be passionate about your chosen technology field
Attention to detail
Perseverance and the ability to drive projects to completion
Patient and calm under pressure
Enjoy working with a team
Building working relationships
Our Perks:
Flexible working
Competitive package
Great social and charity events
Health and well being weeks
Free fruit and a heavily discounted Barista
Tickets to events via sponsorships etc
Season Ticket Loan
Win Technologies (UK) Limited provides support services to Betway and is a proud member of the Betway Group

Should you not hear from us within 2 weeks, please assume your application has not been successful.

#LI-POST

ABOUT US

Welcome to SITA. We are the world's leading air transport IT and communications specialist. Around the world, nearly every passenger flight relies on SITA technology and we work with almost every airport and airline to ensure their operations run smoothly.

Our vision for easy air travel every step of the way, has never been more important. The whole experience of flying is transforming to ensure the safety of passengers in a post-COVID-19 world: from the ability to manage your journey from your mobile phone to ensuring social distancing and automating health checks, we foresee radical changes taking place in airports globally.

Purpose:

Examine SITA infrastructure and products to proactively identify information security weaknesses and provide comprehensive, actionable remediation strategies. Conduct authorized penetration testing exercises and communicate findings in clear and concise ways to both highly technical audiences (e.g. product development teams, IT, etc.) and to business management and leadership.
Key Responsibilities:
Conduct authorized assessment of infrastructure and applications to proactively identify security weaknesses.
Verify weaknesses by leveraging attacker techniques to evaluate the difficulty and effectiveness of potential attack from various threat actors.
Provide comprehensive and actionable recommendations to counter the threat posed by identified security weaknesses, given the applicable threat landscape.
Bring an offensive mindset to the design of internal solutions and provide input to the selection of countermeasures and security controls through technical risk assessment.
Report findings to technical audiences, and to business management and leadership, indicating the impact to the business of verified weaknesses found.
Research and develop testing tools, techniques and processes.
Assist incident response and security threat surveillance functions to advise on current attacker tools, techniques and procedures.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of security processes, tools and techniques to counter threats faced by SITA and our customers.
Requirements:

3-5 years' experience in at least three of the following fields:
Network penetration testing and manipulation of network infrastructure
Mobile and/or web application assessments
Shell scripting or automation of simple tasks using Perl, Python, or Ruby
Developing, extending, or modifying exploits, shellcode or exploit tools
Mastery of Unix/Linux/Mac/Windows operating systems, including bash and Powershell
Developing applications in C#, ASP, .NET, ObjectiveC, or Java (J2EE)
Reverse engineering malware, data obfuscators, or ciphers
We would like it if you have the below qualifications and knowledge:
Excellent ability to think laterally and solve problems in unique ways.
Strong knowledge of attacker tools, techniques and procedures.
Strong understanding of network technologies such as TCP/IP, routing, switching, NAT, Wireless/WiFi, etc.
Strong ability to research and maintain currency with the latest approaches to penetration testing, including learning new tools and utilities.
Good understanding of security compliance frameworks (e.g. ISO/IEC 27001, PCI DSS, etc.)
Good understanding of common business applications (e.g. content management systems, application servers, databases, etc.) and how to leverage them in an assessment.
Good understanding of web technologies and how they are commonly subverted (e.g. OWASP Top 10).
Ability to relate work to the business, understanding the impact to business processes, not just technical impact.
Ability to remain calm and methodical under pressure.
Degree in a technical discipline (e.g. Information Security, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.) or enough work experience to demonstrate proficiency at this level.
Professional security designation such as CISSP, CISA, GIAC, etc.
Penetration Testing certification (e.g. GPEN, C|EH, OSCP) considered a strong advantage.

An expert in cyber security solutions – Including but not limited to:
SIEM and incident response services.
Cloud Security.

Relevant standards such as ISO27001, SSAE/ ISAE 3402 SOC
An expert in security solutions and the customer transformation journey to Modern security architectures.

A collaborative and open approach to working with different members within the Market Development team and with wider stakeholders within the business including the Technology & Security Office.
Maintain a high degree of and thorough knowledge of all Colt products, services capabilities.
Maintain a high degree of and thorough knowledge of the Security Eco-system.
Develop a strategy to evolve the application and joint partner opportunities of the Security offerings within Colt.
Monitor competitor and market activity/trends and provide feedback in to Colt’s strategy and innovation business teams.
Critically evaluate 3rd Party partners and all Colt concerned departments to ensure solutions are relevant and within Colts ability to deliver.
Support contract construction and predict / overcome client concerns.
Meet and work closely with the partners and analysts to understand business objectives, needs, requirements and compelling criteria and best market practice.
Support the CCO organization including sales engineering teams to guide the release of new technology and solutions to the sales force.
Identify and quantify the associated gaps and risks within the strategy in conjunction with the Partner managers, and other supporting entities whenever appropriate.
Active involvement with external analysts and forums to extend and develop contacts with existing and potential partners and vendors and to share these contacts with relevant teams across the business.
Adherence to Colt governance processes, tools and sales methodology.
What you will need to succeed
Experience in solution consultancy and product co-creation.
Proven track record of leading and operating within multi-partner teams.
A thought leader and subject matter expert – Cybersecurity & competitive landscape.
Exceptional negotiation and influencing ability of digital transformation, security and data architectural design.
Accustomed to engaging and presenting to influence at all levels.

About the role
Here at Babcock International we are looking to recruit a Cyber Threat Intelligence Analyst to work as part of our Cyber Resilience and Information Assurance Function. The successful candidate will lead in evolving our preventative infrastructure to keep ahead of threats through intelligence collection, detection and monitoring of threats and vulnerabilities. The role will involve prioritising risk mitigation by understanding the relevant threats to Babcock, maintaining security baselines and roadmaps relevant to our risk profile and mapping threats to the baseline, working with various resolver groups to minimise vulnerabilities, and working alongside Operations teams to ensure evergreen plans are achieved.


You will perform open source intelligence (OSINT) collection and analysis, identifying indications of cyber threats, malicious code, malicious websites, and vulnerabilities. You will also report any system security loopholes, infringements and vulnerabilities in a timely manner;


Other responsibilities will include:
Evaluating intelligence regarding new threats, or vulnerabilities, to the Babcock estate, and analyse and correlate incident data, to ensure that root cause is determined and that operational controls are updated to mitigate against and, security tool detections are implemented to detect new attacks
Providing presentations and reports for internal stakeholders to assist in proactively addressing threats
Evaluate threats and run continuous monitoring to check system vulnerabilities and recommend remedial actions to be taken by resolver groups, and work to ensure actions are completed
Work with third parties developing shared intelligence including government, law enforcement, and industry peers
Identify credible, new intelligence, and subject matter resources relative to current and emerging threats
Work with the wider SOC team to create and maintain a threat catalogue, as well as assist with incidents and investigations as necessary
Work with the Security Architect to maintain the Babcock security baseline and ensure it is reviewed and maintained on a regular basis
Compare the Babcock security baseline with OWASP, NIST, SANS publications, identify gaps, and make adjustments as needed
Ensure vulnerability scanning is carried as is necessary to ensure compliance with the security baseline, and work with other teams to fix the gaps
Attend Application Review, Project, Technical Design Authority, Change and Transition Boards to provide advice and guidance on ensuring the security baseline is maintained
Work with the Head of Cyber Security Operations and Resilience to build a roadmap and plans for a Babcock Evergreen estate
Provide system security advice to system management, system staff and users


What do I need to do the role?
Experience as a technical Cyber Security specialist preferably in an operations environment
Demonstrable experience of security related incidents and work requests
Knowledge of network security architecture concepts, including topology, protocols, components, and principles
In depth knowledge of system and application vulnerabilities
Ability to keep abreast with latest threats, attacking techniques and mitigating strategies
Experience of SOC/industry security toolsets
Operating systems and system administration skills
Advanced understanding of networking principles


What else do I need to know?
The successful candidate must be able to achieve the appropriate security clearance level for this role.

CCleaner@Avast is the worlds most popular optimization tool, with over 2.5 billion downloads across 195 countries. Available on PC, Mac and Android, were on a mission to make devices run faster and last longer, while protecting our users privacy and security. CCleaner is one of several smaller businesses acquired by Avast in 2017.

We are looking for an ambitious eCommerce Executive to run our online store, execute campaigns and drive continuous improvement in our web and in-app carts.

You will be reporting to the Head of Monetization (Chase Richards), and working within the eCommerce team, a small but versatile group responsible for growing CCleaners consumer sales and hitting ambitious targets. The team has delivered consistent mid-double-digit growth for several years and has a large pool of tools and resources to draw on.

Youll need a good understanding of eCommerce, preferably within the subscription software industry or similar, a keen eye for detail and a sense of what turns a visitor into a customer. Your job will be to put sales strategy and campaign plans into action by handling the web and in-app carts, product listings and pricing, and to suggest and test ways to improve the online checkout experience.

Responsibilities:
Creating and managing product listings in the eCommerce system (Cleverbridge)
Managing the relationship with Cleverbridge and guiding the work they do for us to improve our checkouts
Designing A/B tests in the cart, and finding ways to improve the performance of various different customer flows (initial purchase, renewals, upgrades, etc.)
Cooperation with UX team, graphic designers and web development team to implement improvements to the cart and website
Liaise with the Product team to help improve the in-app checkout and sales flows
Work closely with the web product manager and in-product messaging specialist to execute seasonal campaigns
Work with the data analysis team to ensure that cart tracking is kept up to date
Requirements:
1+ years experience working in a consumer-facing eCommerce environment, preferably managing a web store or cart
Experience designing, running and interpreting A/B tests
Basic understanding of UX design, conversion optimization and user interface design
Knowledge of subscription service purchasing behavior and customer drivers
Basic knowledge of HTML and the web development cycle (no coding is specifically required, but it always helps to know what youre looking at)
We would want to see these qualities too!
Highly organized, and able to turn a managers vague email into a detailed plan and execute it
Experience working collaboratively online, with little to no physical presence in an office
Ability to work towards a strict campaign schedule and work backwards from a launch date to make sure all the pieces are in place when they need to be
Ambitious to build a career in eCommerce and online sales
Appreciate that sometimes the business needs the less exciting work to be done as well and thus able to cope with repetitive work/tasks in certain cases
What we offer:
Our team is a vibrant and eclectic mix of technology geeks, foodies, cyclists, gamers, bee-keepers musicians and hatmakers, and we are all passionate about the work that we do. Were also passionate about having a good work-life balance, making the office a fun and energizing place to be, and growing ourselves along with the business.
Perks include: All Avast employees are currently working from home until at least January 2021, so in lieu of our awesome office-based perks the company will provide you with a comfortable home office and any IT equipment/furniture required. We also offer flexible working hours, extensive professional training and education options, and occasional spot giveaways of vouchers, etc.
Benefits include: Employee share matching scheme, competitive salary and bonus package, private healthcare plan, life assurance, bike-to-work scheme, professional development courses.
Sounds exciting? We look forward to hearing from you!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Description

For a career path that is both challenging and rewarding, join Sedgwick`s talented team of 27,000 colleagues around the globe. Sedgwick is a leading provider of technology-enabled risk, benefits and integrated business solutions, specialising in claims management and loss adjusting services.

Our people are as diverse as our products and services and as varied as our clients. We believe that individuals from different backgrounds encourage a challenging team environment, a creative approach to problem solving and an interesting working environment.

At Sedgwick we pride ourselves on our professionalism and expertise, delivering a first-class service which is highly rated by our clients. Don`t just take our word for it; as regular winners at the British Insurance Awards, we know what good looks like.

Our credentials depend on the strength and capability of our people and we take great care in making sure that our people are empowered and encouraged to fulfil their potential. Personal accountability, a strong customer ethos and a pride in what we do are at the heart of what we expect from our people. In return we offer great development, a friendly, caring environment and competitive remuneration package.

The role:

You will detect, monitor, provide analysis and resolution on security incidents across the organisation. You will also implement appropriate security measures to prevent security vulnerabilities.

Responsibilities include:
Analysing and resolving security incidents
Administering various IT security tools and applications
Performing analysis of suspected malicious code and other software or programs and providing written and/or verbal analysis to management
Assisting IT groups and business units as necessary in troubleshooting compatibility issues between security tools and business or productivity programs
Analysing client and customer needs as required
Working closely with management on assigned projects from inception through to implementation ensuring adequate internal communication and user involvement is maintained.
Assisting management in investigating IT or cyber-security events and developing resolutions
Providing feedback and suggestions to improve IT Security processes and procedures
Working closely with project managers to meet and complete project milestones accurately and on time
Supporting the organisation's quality programme
Travel as required.
You will have/will be:
Ideally degree educated (computer related field)
CompTIA Security+ certification, Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH), GIAC Certified Enterprise Defender (GCED), and/or Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) preferred
Experience of TCP/IP services or networks, various operating systems, and desktop productivity software
Experience with network topologies, security and access control tools, encryption technologies and algorithms preferred
Knowledge of artificial intelligence and machine learning
Knowledge of the confidentiality, integrity and availability (CIA) triad
Knowledge of Information technology security frameworks
Knowledge of carbon black protection, Symantec endpoint protection and security information and events management (SIEM) solutions preferred
Ability to work with networked computers and servers
Ability to work independently and solve problems as they arise
Ability to handle confidential and sensitive information with integrity
Ability to continuously learn new technologies
Self-motivated and possess the ability to work in fast-paced environment
Oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills
Applicants who are successful at interview will be, as part of pre-employment screening, subject to: ID document verification, credit check, address verification, employment verification, employment gap verification, UK DBS, UK financial regulator search, anti-money laundering search, directorship search and global watch list check.

Who are we?

Role

Our data is a crucial part to our success and of great importance to our clients, our partners and to our team. This is why we are currently looking for someone to help evolve the security function as Ravelin grows. To be successful in this role, you have to be a practical and pragmatic person with security sensibility who knows the difference between implementing an ineffective policy, and something difficult that is worth the additional friction.

Job title: Security Specialist
Location: High Wycombe, Head Office
Salary: £35,000 - £45,000
Hours: 37 hours per week, Monday to Friday
InHealth are embarking on an exciting digital transformation journey which will enable patients to interact with our services in a truly digitally enabled way, in the full knowledge that their data is properly secured and managed throughout our various systems and technology platforms.
We have therefore created an exciting new role of Security Specialist within our IT team to oversee security across all our technical services, ensuring that we are compliant with relevant legislation / guidance / standards (we are currently ISO27001 registered) and putting in place robust industry standard practices to ensure that we are operating safely and securely.
The role:
The newly created role of Security Specialist is absolutely focused on ensuring that InHealth’s technology platforms, application systems and associated services are secure, according to recognised industry best-practice standards. You are the focal point for all security matters within the team, and act as the subject matter expert when required, and you will help the organisation introduce and maintain the right kinds of software tools, monitoring systems, and process frameworks which ensure that security is properly managed across the organisation.
What you will do:
Ensure there are suitable security frameworks in place to build upon InHealth’s ISO27001 certifications, extending and deepening it where necessary and ensuring it is properly enacted across the enterprise
Monitor security alarms and alerts, check for patterns or suspicious activities, triage them appropriately and then respond to adverse incidents with effective actions / measures to prevent wider propagation
Provide expert security measures advice to technical colleagues on any projects they are undertaking, systems they are implementing, or changes that they are making to our infrastructure
Carry out periodic tests and checks on the security systems and measures in place and use third parties where needed for independent confirmation and verification of the suitability of our security measures
Routinely share and communicate security status updates to senior colleagues, both within IT services and across the business, to build confidence and trust in our security systems and processes
What you are responsible for:
Ensuring that we have a continuous picture of threats and vulnerabilities across our infrastructure, platforms, applications systems and associated technologies, and that measures are put in place to reduce those risks to acceptable levels
Maintaining our compliance with ISO27001 frameworks (and others that we agree need to be implemented to augment the ISO), working with colleagues across the department to ensure that they are implementing the appropriate measures within their sphere
Keeping on top of changes to systems and services where there are likely to be security implications and interpreting those changes, identifying the risks and guiding colleagues as necessary
Acting as the lead investigator and coordinator for any reported or suspected security incidents, responding rapidly to the situation and ensuring that it is quickly and properly controlled
What people see in you:
Someone that can be relied upon for advice and guidance on all matters relating to information security
An individual that instils confidence with everyone they work with by providing structured, impartial and objective advice when under pressure
A high attention to detail; nothing will be missed by you and you have your eye on detail all the time, spotting things that others may not necessarily see
Excellent communication and relationship building skills with an ability to collaborate with and educate colleagues across all areas of the business
We are looking for someone with:
3 years practical cyber security experience preferably backed up with qualifications such as: CISSP, GSEC, and/or Sec+ or equivalents
Solid experience in areas of cyber security operations, such as attack surface management, SOC operations, Intrusion Detection/Intrusion Prevention Systems (IDS/IPS), threats (including APT, insider, etc.), vulnerabilities, and exploits; incident response, investigations and remediation (exposure to SIEM would be advantageous)
A very strong understanding of IT infrastructure, networks, operating systems, and application systems, especially the security aspects of those technical products
Experience of implementing security frameworks such as ISO27001 or similar successfully in other organisations, and an excellent understanding and knowledge of related legislation such as GDPR
A sound understanding of the healthcare industry and the importance of patient confidentiality, and ideally experience of delivering projects within the NHS
The ability to present and relay information to senior management colleagues to support decision making or business case plans
What can InHealth offer you?
We offer a fantastic benefits package, which is available through a mobile-enabled rewards platform, called InJoy. This is your place to access thousands of offers and discounts on a wide range of products and services relating to: fashion, travel, eating out, technology, leisure and more!
In addition to this, we also offer:
· Private medical insurance
· 27 days annual leave (plus bank holidays)
· Company pension scheme
· Access to a 24/7 employee assistance programme
· Life assurance
· Enhanced parental leave
· and more!
Making sure our people are happy at work is one of our main priorities, which means giving them as many opportunities as we can to support their personal and professional growth. We also have an innovative approach to personal and professional development, helping you to be the best version of you and giving you a real career pathway.
InHealth is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all areas of the community.

Overview

Company Description:
Become an integral part of the Information Security team who lead the work that protects Anglo American’s information assets from internal and external threats of theft, breach, corruption or disruption, through risk management, policy, architecture and operational security means.

Looking to develop your skills? Join our extraordinary team.

With headquarters in London, UK, and operations located throughout the world, Anglo American is truly global. We employ more than 90,000 colleagues worldwide and run mining operations across southern Africa, North and South America and Australia. Guided by our purpose and our values, we enable both high performance and purposeful action as we aim to “re-imagine mining to improve people’s lives", delivering the metals and minerals that make modern life possible – from mobile phones to medicines.

This role sits within our Information Management (IM) Business Unit at a Band 7 level reporting to the IM Security Risk & Governance Specialist.

Job Description:
As part of this progressive and growing team your role as Information Security Risk Analyst will be an important one – it will see you supporting the Global IM Security team with monitoring compliance of Anglo American security policies and frameworks, investigating and registering exceptions, processing intelligence, vulnerability, and incident data to input to the risk register; collaborating in the production of reports, and assisting with the facilitation of the security risk governance processes.

you will also;
Articulate risks identified from various sources (IT service providers, third party, risk assessments, intelligence, pentests) in terms of business impact, and maintain the risk register up-to-date with all new risk information and changes
Provide support to security risk assessments across the organization
Engage with IT service providers, IM teams and other stakeholders to agree a mitigation plan, a remediation strategy and appropriate timelines for any issues found
Assist in the preparation of IM Security Risk reports
Support the creation and maintenance of new security standards, procedures and guidelines
Support vulnerability management efforts across the global estate in order to assist in the identification of threats to the global business

Qualifications:
Completed education up to A Levels or equivalent
A recognised Information Security, Risk or Audit qualification/certification(s) (e.g. CRISC, CISA, CISM, ISO27001 Lead Auditor), or demonstration of intent to achieve certification, would be desirable
Information systems and assurance experience that demonstrates an understanding of the required knowledge, skills, and abilities
Knowledge and understanding of risk management principles and best practices, keeping abreast of changes to industry standards, regulations and best practice
Experience working with information security standards and frameworks (ISF, Cyber Essentials, ISO, NIST, etc.)
Analytical, problem solving skills and understanding of the implications of business change. AND;
Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office products, to an advanced level for Excel
Ability to multi-task and prioritise workloads and excellent organizational skills

Additional information:
What we offer

When you join Anglo American, you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package. But more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programmes, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. We’re a large, successful multinational company – and we’re still growing all the time.

Who we are

We aim to lead the industry by pursuing ever safer and more responsible ways of working, demonstrating integrity and showing care and respect for people and the planet. That means we are constantly seeking new opportunities to mine and process our products sustainably, using less water, less energy and more precise extraction technologies. As the custodians of coal and other precious natural resources – diamonds (through De Beers), copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore and nickel – our extraordinary teams work safely and collaboratively, with the utmost consideration for local communities, our customers and the world at large.

How we are committed to your safety

Nothing is more important to us than ensuring you return home safely after a day’s work. To make that happen, we have the most rigorous safety standards in the industry. Not only that, we’re also continually investing in new technologies – from drones to data analytics – that are helping to make mining safer.

Inclusion and Diversity

Anglo American is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are and provide equality of opportunity so that everyone can fulfil their potential.

How to apply

To apply for this role, please complete our online application form. You will have the opportunity to upload your CV and other relevant documentation as part of the process

We are still hiring and onboarding new starters despite all of us working from home due to the UK lockdown. We will provide the equipment needed for any new starter who joins us whilst we are working remotely.

We are changing things. We are So Energy, a fast-growing 100% renewable energy supplier in the UK. We're the leading energy supplier for customer service. We've won a host of awards too; in each quarter since 2017 we've been recognised by Citizens Advice as a top ranked supplier out of a total of 50. We've also won the 2020 Moneyfacts Energy Provider of the Year award and been recognised as a Which? recommended energy supplier for 2020. Now we're looking for people to join our growing team and support our customer base which has tripled in the last 7 months.

Who we are looking for?

The Operations Specialist is a key member of the Operations Team supporting data management, client reporting, trade processes, and problem resolution. This person will work closely with Customer Operations to ensure integrity of the data systems. We’ll rely on you to listen to our customers and use your expertise, creativity, and passion to meet their needs — and remind them that behind our great products are amazing people, ensuring that we continue to deliver our 5* rated customer service.

An ideal candidate is someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, works well within a team and passionate about what they do. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills are key; both when interacting with our customers, as well as with fellow team members. We are looking for a person that will also have strong analytical skills, able to work with data.

At So Energy, our employees are just as important to us as our customers. We will provide training and support your development throughout your career. We want our Operation Specialists to be leading the teams in the future as we both grow together and is looking to take on a new challenge.

This role will be working from home two days a week. The other 3 days will be from our office in Chiswick. In order to successfully work from home, any candidate for this role will need to have:

(a) A safe, private and distraction free environment from which to work in the UK;

(b) A strong internet connection with a minimum download speed of 10mbps and an upload speed of 3 mbps;

(c) A smartphone

During Covid-19 restrictions, all our employees are able to work from home

Requirements

What you'll be doing
Effectively managing a workload of tickets that monitor the progress of problem resolution on specific customer accounts.
Effectively managing the relationship with our customer base, also by answering inbound contact within the previously defined SLA's.
Contributing to a “one contact resolution”, by reducing the need for customer contact through effective management of customer accounts.
Maintain systems by researching and resolving problems, maintaining system integrity and security.
Maintain quality service by establishing and enforcing organisation standards.
Prepare reports by collecting, analysing, and summarising information.
Participate to the team’s effort, by accomplishing related results as needed.
Actively engage with a Continuous Improvement framework to constantly seek improvement in working processes and practices.
Benefits

What's in it for you?
Competitive salary and performance related bonus
25 days holiday, plus bank holidays, and an extra day holiday for your birthday
Ongoing support and development
Free daily breakfast
Last Friday of each month nibbles and drinks in the office
Cycle to work scheme
Perkbox
Excellent transport links
Great reward and recognition
Exposure to all parts of a growing business

At So Energy, our employees are just as important to us as our customers. We will provide training and support your development throughout your career
So Energy care about helping the energy industry become a much more diverse and inclusive environment and we work hard to lead by example. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and building an inclusive environment for all

Job Title: IT Risk and IT General Controls Manager
Job Description:
Salary: Competitive Salary + Benefits
Reference: 667067
Background
The global insurance technology market is growing rapidly with increasing demand from insurers to replace legacy systems, bring new products to market quickly and capitalise on the potential of data and predictive analytics.
Charles Taylor InsureTech (CTI), part of Charles Taylor Group is well-established in the sector, providing specialist and bespoke technology solutions, along with systems development and implementation services to numerous insurance-related clients across the globe and to the Charles Taylor group.
Dating back to 1884, Charles Taylor now is currently in more than 120 locations spread across 30 countries in Europe, the Americas, Asia Pacific, the Middle East and Africa. Charles Taylor believes that it holds a distinctive position in its markets in that it is able to provide professional services and technology solutions in order to support every stage of the insurance lifecycle and every aspect of the insurance operating model. Charles Taylor serves a diversified blue-chip international customer base that includes national and international insurance companies, mutuals, captives, MGAs, Lloyd's syndicates and reinsurers, along with brokers, distributors and corporate insureds.
As such, our clients require a significant level of comfort regarding the quality and security of the solutions which we deliver and operate to ISO27001:2013.
The Role
As IT Risk and IT General Controls (ITGC) Manager you will be responsible for all IT risk and controls activities within CTI. The main areas of focus include building a global IT risk and ITGC framework, maintaining ISO27001 controls and the certification process, providing advice on IT risk and controls matters to colleagues across the business, overseeing client IT risk and control audits, external audits from clients and managing the relationship with internal IT audit.
The business operates in the UK and Latin America with ambitious plans to continue its expansion into other geographies through acquisition and partnerships.
Key Responsibilities
Build the global IT risk and ITGC framework
o Develop and implement the IT risk and controls strategy, framework, policies, processes and governance model
o Embed a CT compliance control framework across all parts of the CTI business, in all geographies
o Act as the lead and focal point within CTI for IT risk and ITGC matters
o Improve awareness and understanding of IT risk and ITGC
o Implement improvements to risk management and control audit process including evaluation of SOC2
Maintain ISO27001:2013 and the certification process for CTI
o Lead the ISO27001 certification process, including management of surveillance audits
o Accountable for the overall risk management framework for ISO27001
o Oversight of remediation projects and activities to fix non-compliance findings
o Implementation of ISO27001 controls and certification into new geographies, as required

Oversee ITGC audits
o Management and oversight of internal and external 3rd party audit activity including Group company year-end external audit of IT controls
o Client audits in relation to specific service contracts

Team management
o Support the development of colleagues working in the IT risk and ITGC team
o Build and manage a virtual team of IT risk and ITGC professionals
Management of penetration testing program (via external professional services firm).
Management and oversight of all due diligence activities, including client questionnaires and due diligence responses, and the implementation of a compliance library to facilitate an effective due diligence response framework.
Demonstrate and role model the Charles Taylor six Values by ensuring a Supportive Environment, upholding Excellence in People, focusing on Partnership with Clients, delivering High quality Work, promoting Group-wide Entrepreneurship and having an Appetite for Change.
Required Skills
The successful candidate will have experience with the following:
ISO27001 certification maintenance
SSAE-16 SOC2
IT General Controls
Responding to regulatory enquiries
Responding to client due diligence enquiries
Co-ordinating audit activity by internal and external audit teams
Exposure to the following is highly desirable
Management of penetration testing programs
Cyber Essentials
PCI-DSS certification
A background in a regulated business environment (preferably financial sector) is desirable but not essential.
The individual appointed to the role will work closely with colleagues in Latin America so Spanish language skills would be an advantage but not essential.

Why join Charles Taylor InsureTech?
The Charles Taylor InsureTech team blends hands-on insurance expertise with fresh thinking from the worlds of technology consulting, financial services, ecommerce and beyond.
As a newly established business which is part of Charles Taylor, we combine the agility of a start up with the security and scale of a corporate. The result is a pragmatic-yet-pioneering approach that we’ve used to help clients reimagine central market systems, launch self-service digital insurance products, automate regulatory reporting requirements and more.
We are very proud of the fact that nine out of ten of our people recommend Charles Taylor as a place to work. We pride ourselves on having a positive work environment where our people are empowered to make the best decisions and where learning is valued highly and shared across our business.
We are very committed to ensuring our people are given continuous learning and development. As well as structured induction programmes and job training, we provide study support for relevant professional qualifications and have a Core Learning & Development Curriculum.
Charles Taylor is a fun and inclusive place to work where people are truly valued and encouraged to enjoy a host of social and sporting activities available. Quiz nights, tennis tournaments, football matches and a range of other events take place throughout the year

Equal Opportunity Employer
Here at Charles Taylor we are proud to be an Inclusive Employer. We provide an environment of mutual respect with zero tolerance to discrimination of any kind regardless of age, disability, gender identity, marital/ family status, race, religion, sex or sexual orientation.
Our external partnerships and the dedicated work we do in promoting a transparent and fair recruitment and selection process all contribute to the successful, inclusive and diverse culture and environment which we are proud to be a part of at Charles Taylor.

Company Description

Become an integral part of the Information Security team who lead the work that protects Anglo American’s information assets from internal and external threats of theft, breach, corruption or disruption, through risk management, policy, architecture and operational security means.

Looking to develop your skills? Join our extraordinary team.

With headquarters in London, UK, and operations located throughout the world, Anglo American is truly global. We employ more than 90,000 colleagues worldwide and run mining operations across southern Africa, North and South America and Australia. Guided by our purpose and our values, we enable both high performance and purposeful action as we aim to “re-imagine mining to improve people’s lives", delivering the metals and minerals that make modern life possible – from mobile phones to medicines.

This role sits within our Information Management (IM) Business Unit at a Band 7 level reporting to the IM Security Risk & Governance Specialist.

Job Description

As part of this progressive and growing team your role as Information Security Risk Analyst will be an important one – it will see you supporting the Global IM Security team with monitoring compliance of Anglo American security policies and frameworks, investigating and registering exceptions, processing intelligence, vulnerability, and incident data to input to the risk register; collaborating in the production of reports, and assisting with the facilitation of the security risk governance processes.

you will also;
Articulate risks identified from various sources (IT service providers, third party, risk assessments, intelligence, pentests) in terms of business impact, and maintain the risk register up-to-date with all new risk information and changes
Provide support to security risk assessments across the organization
Engage with IT service providers, IM teams and other stakeholders to agree a mitigation plan, a remediation strategy and appropriate timelines for any issues found
Assist in the preparation of IM Security Risk reports
Support the creation and maintenance of new security standards, procedures and guidelines
Support vulnerability management efforts across the global estate in order to assist in the identification of threats to the global business
Qualifications
Completed education up to A Levels or equivalent
A recognised Information Security, Risk or Audit qualification/certification(s) (e.g. CRISC, CISA, CISM, ISO27001 Lead Auditor), or demonstration of intent to achieve certification, would be desirable
Information systems and assurance experience that demonstrates an understanding of the required knowledge, skills, and abilities
Knowledge and understanding of risk management principles and best practices, keeping abreast of changes to industry standards, regulations and best practice
Experience working with information security standards and frameworks (ISF, Cyber Essentials, ISO, NIST, etc.)
Analytical, problem solving skills and understanding of the implications of business change. AND;
Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office products, to an advanced level for Excel
Ability to multi-task and prioritise workloads and excellent organizational skills
Additional Information

What we offer

When you join Anglo American, you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package. But more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programmes, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. We’re a large, successful multinational company – and we’re still growing all the time.

Who we are

We aim to lead the industry by pursuing ever safer and more responsible ways of working, demonstrating integrity and showing care and respect for people and the planet. That means we are constantly seeking new opportunities to mine and process our products sustainably, using less water, less energy and more precise extraction technologies. As the custodians of coal and other precious natural resources – diamonds (through De Beers), copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore and nickel – our extraordinary teams work safely and collaboratively, with the utmost consideration for local communities, our customers and the world at large.

How we are committed to your safety

Nothing is more important to us than ensuring you return home safely after a day’s work. To make that happen, we have the most rigorous safety standards in the industry. Not only that, we’re also continually investing in new technologies – from drones to data analytics – that are helping to make mining safer.

Inclusion and Diversity

Anglo American is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are and provide equality of opportunity so that everyone can fulfil their potential.

How to apply

To apply for this role, please complete our online application form. You will have the opportunity to upload your CV and other relevant documentation as part of the process

We are seeking an experienced and highly-skilled Group IT Director to join our rapidly
expanding business. In this role, the successful candidate will be responsible for leading and
managing the entire Information Technology function and ensuring that our company’s
technology systems and applications are focussed on meeting the evolving needs of our
business and provide class leading support for all our stakeholders. We are looking for
someone who has successfully managed complex, multi-site change programmes and
delivered quantitative improvements to key business metrics. The role is an exciting one at
the heart of our drive to bring the best customer service we can to our clients by making sure
that all processes and systems serve the companies objectives in the most efficient
manner. You will also work closely with senior management to develop technology policies
to be administered throughout the company.

Duties and Responsibilities
IT Strategy
o Development of an IT strategy that deals with both the known
challenges today but also looks to the future opportunities to deploy
IT solutions that add value to the business and its stakeholders
o Ownership of a three-year plan for development of IT
o Responsibility for the delivery of all aspects of the IT strategy, budget,
resources, systems, third party management
o Development of user group across the business to gain quality
feedback and prioritise requirements, ensuring these are successfully
translated into application development
o Identification of inhibitors to both organic and acquisitive growth
within the IT arena and flexing the strategy to deal with these areas.
o Work closely with the management team to present technical
solutions and recommendations.
IT infrastructure
o Asking the difficult questions about why the legacy systems exist and
moving to an agile operating platform capable of supporting both the
current and the future operating states
o Maintaining an always available infrastructure for all users of our
business systems both internal and external
o Management of third-party providers of infrastructure to ensure
contracts, commercial arrangements and service delivery are aligned
to the same levels. Collaborate on professional service engagements
where required
o Best practice on system integrations and architecture
• IT security

o Responsible for all IT security across the business apart from
customer related items, identify and mitigate security risks
o Responsible for all Data Protection activities
o Take a proactive approach to securing data to best practice levels
supporting our cyber security businesses,
IT applications
o Responsible for the overall business systems roadmap under the IT
strategy
o Ensure that enhancements are business focussed and come with a
clear ROI and link through to the overall IT strategy
o Identify the delivery of the applications strategy through both internal
business analysts, developers as well as third party partners in the
most efficient manner for the business
o Work with the business on end to end business processes that are
fully supported by the seamless applications
o Drive continuous improvement, stability, performance and usability in
applications across the group
o Provide application roadmap and future capabilities
o Identify vulnerabilities and manage releases, upgrades and patches if
required
• Team management
o Management of a team to deliver across the business from IT service
desk, business analysts and infrastructure specialists
o Enhance the skill sets among the team to deliver the future state
operating platform
o Develop and motivate the IT team across the business
o Coach and mentor individual team members on an ongoing basis,
review performance, goals and objectives
o Balance the mix between external and internal delivery
Business focus
o Work with the other leaders and staff across the business to ensure
that IT is part of the overall business strategy
Reporting
o Develop a real time reporting framework for Key Business Metrics to
allow a dashboard approach to deliver information to the senior
management team and all stakeholders
o Monitor and main data quality and integrity across the group
applications, ensuring suitable data models and migration plans are
achievable.
Disaster recovery and business continuity plan
Required Competencies (Skills, Knowledge, Experience and Attitude)

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology or related field.
Significant experience in the technology field and leadership or management of an
entire IT setting.
Experience in digital and cloud transformations
Solid working knowledge of current security protocols and threats.
Excellent project management, communication and interpersonal skills.
High energy individual used to dealing with ambiguity
In depth experience of change management utilising IT, preferably with acquisition
and integration experience
Strong people management skills
To be successful in any role at CVD it requires someone who has a sense of urgency,
doesn’t take themselves too seriously, is passionate about what they do, happy to roll their
sleeves up and get stuck in, happy in an informal, hectic environment, who enjoys being
challenged by deadlines and has a high tolerance for ambiguity.

Information Security Specialist

Are you
able to manage the Security Accreditation of a programme at varying points in
the lifecycle? Can you ensure products meet Information Assurance
requirements and that Security Risks are reduced to an acceptable
level? Would you like to work with advanced technologies to minimise
the risk of both cyber threats and social attacks? We currently have
a vacancy for an Information Security Specialist at our site in New Malden.

As an
Information Security Specialist, you will be tasked with ensuring our products
across the Maritime Sector are secure by design, achieve security accreditation
and maintain security through-life.

This role
will provide you with the opportunity to liaise with stakeholders, influence
engineering design, produce evidence in support of accreditation, provide
advice and guidance to shape technical solutions and support embedding our
security culture across the business.

Your main
responsibilities as an Information Security Specialist will involve:

Designing
and shaping the technical security architecture of strategically important
products to ensure they are secure by design.

Liaising
with the system accreditor(s) and stakeholders to manage expectations, ensure
that security requirements are met and the security risk is reduced to
acceptable level.

Determining
security principles for the project solution to work within.

Producing
accreditation artefacts such as product security architecture and Risk
Management Accredited Document Set – (RMADS) in support of accreditation.
Collecting evidence for the security case.

Responding
to security questions within bid proposal documents, producing estimates, and
selecting security principles and frameworks.

Contributing
to the wider Product Security Department – delivering awareness material and
presentations and speaking at Special Interest Groups, improving processes.

Keeping
up to date on relevant security standards, process and technologies, developing
skills and capabilities to be able to provide more effective services.

Supporting
the product security Special Interest Group by sharing best practice.

Your
skills and qualifications as an Information Security Specialist:

Essential:

Experience
in ensuring security within complex networked systems.

Fundamental
understanding of ICT, OCT and ICS technologies, how they connect together,
different protocols, operating systems and applications.

A good
understanding of National Technical Authority suggested Security Frameworks and
Methodologies.

Good
technical understanding of systems and how their security aspects are applied
and affect performance.

Ability
to identify and investigate technology to understand security vulnerabilities
and how to mitigate them.

Desirable:



Solid
systems engineering experience and background.

Understanding
of Virtualised systems (Exposure to VMware products).

Exposure
to securing thin or zero client environments.

Good
knowledge and understanding of security risk assessments and RMADS (Risk
Management Accredited Document Set) and the accreditation process.

Familiarity
of Defence Standards/Security Regulations such as JSP440, JSP604 or, other
security standards such as ISO27000 and NIST.

What
we're looking for in you:

A
flexible and adaptive individual with excellent communication, high attention
to detail and strong influencing and interpersonal skills.

Location: New Malden / Various

Salary: Competitive

Benefits: Our employees receive an
excellent benefits package which includes a competitive pension scheme,
enhanced annual leave allowance and a Company contributed Share Incentive Plan.
We also offer a range of additional benefits such as flexible working, an
employee assistance programme, Cycle2work scheme and many local and national
employee discounts. Some employees may also be eligible for an annual
incentive.

BAE
Systems

BAE
Systems is one of the world’s leading global defence, security and aerospace
companies. We work at the cutting edge of technology, creating more than 100

BAE

a diverse range of people with the unique expertise to design, integrate and

We have
significant growth opportunities across our three dynamic businesses with

strengthening our competitive advantage and developing our business as an
employer of choice for our current and future employees.

We
recognise that an inclusive and diverse workplace – where all employees feel

important. Not only does it inspire creativity and collaboration, it’s good for

welcome applications from all suitably qualified people.

Job Title: Assistant Vice President, IT Security Project Delivery Specialist
Job Description:
We are MUFG. 360 years of heritage. A world-class set of businesses. And more than 180,000 employees in 50 markets. It’s no surprise that MUFG has grown to become one of the top five banks in the world. Our services include commercial banking, trust banking, securities, credit cards, consumer finance, asset management, and leasing. MUFG offers stability in an ever-changing market, providing services to high-profile clients worldwide.
Our vision? To become the world’s most trusted financial group. You’ll help us achieve it.
Overview of Department/Section
IT Risk, Security & Control department covers cyber security strategy maintenance and tactical planning and operations to provide IT Security protection, governance, risk management and reporting. This includes promoting Head Office Information Security Standards and Procedures (ISSP) requirements and local security requirements. The department supports and monitors security solutions such as virus protection, vulnerability management, compliance monitoring and threat/incident management activities to reduce risk.
Main Purpose of the role
The Cybersecurity Technical resource is responsible for management and delivery on large, strategic and complex cybersecurity projects. The role manages the execution of project/product cybersecurity elements across cross-portfolio programs and services. Executions include working with multiple security, IT and other leadership / stakeholders and a variety of security, IT and engineering technical resources to identify, plan and deliver cybersecurity initiatives. Deliverables include, but are not limited to:
To support the delivery of cyber projects within agreed scope, cost and timescale.
To implement technical solutions across the Cyber security platform.
To manage and work independently or as part of a team in delivering complex projects.
Key Responsibilities
For dual hat only (delete if applicable):
In this role, you will be responsible for xxx across MUFG’s banking arm and securities business under a dual-hat arrangement. Under this arrangement, you will act and make decisions on behalf of both the bank and the securities business, subject to the same remit and level of authority, and irrespective of the entity which employs you.
In this role, you will be responsible for cybersecurity technical project delivery across MUFG’s banking arm and securities business under a dual-hat arrangement. Under this arrangement, you will act and make decisions on behalf of both the bank and the securities business, subject to the same remit and level of authority, and irrespective of the entity which employs you. Key responsibilities include but, but not limited to:
Interprete cybersecurity relevant regulatory and other requirements or best practices and translate these to business aligned cybersecurity programme requirements.
Manage the delivery of cybersecurity projects within agreed scope, cost and timescale across Bank and Securities.
Support of the delivery of the cyber portion of allocated Cross Portfolio projects including implementation of cyber projects

The technical resource will be responsible for support and execution of the following deliverables as required: business requirements, technical design and architecture, engagement with other infrastructure teams
Work Experience
Essential
Experience in working on multiple projects with broad scope, ambiguity, and high degree of difficulty
Experience in technology projects such as implementation of Cyber infrastructure replacement etc.
Demonstrable proficiency in a wide range of information IT security technologies and embedded security; at the minimum knowledge must cover key cybersecurity domains such as Identity and Access Management, Incident Management Posessing high level of analytical ability where problems are typically unusual and difficult
Ability to maintain a working knowledge of cybersecurity principles and elements
Understand global program structure, launch plan and timing, and global program ownership
Demonstrable experience of senior stakeholder management and relevant management reporting.
Ability to coach team members through knowledge transfer and constructive feedback
Skills and Experience
Functional / Technical Competencies
Essential
Knowledge of IT security principles and controls
Proven understanding of current best practise approach to security assurance and the application of security frameworks
Operational knowledge of Windows; Linux; operating systems is required, including experience with Windows Active Directory and Unix/Linux system administration
Experience in project and development methodologies covering; architecture,design, project implementation and risk assessment.
Wide-ranging security knowledge of technologies and architectures across several of the following environments: Web,Email, Desktop, Server,Anti Virus /Malware
Excellent stakeholder relationship management skills
Planning and prioritising multiple project work streams in response to rapidly developing and changing portfolios.
Turning business problems into optimal technical security designs, aligning user needs with systems requirements and organisational goals.
Broad experience in computer and network systems, including IT security
Ability to handle ambiguity and make decisions and recommendations with limited data
Solid analytical/problem-solving skills with capability to identify solutions to unusual and complex problems
Education / Qualifications
Essential
Degree educated and / or equivalent experience.
Personal Requirements
You are a leader and an expert in delivery of cyberframeworks and associated key solutions
A demonstrable passion for cybersecurity
Excellent communication/leadership/interpersonal skills; results driven and with strong sense of accountability
You are experienced in engaging and persuading teams to accept and participate in best-in-class security architecture and operations
Data driven, ability to analyze data needed to effectively measure progress against the execution of objectives
You successfully convey technical information in an understandable way that generates results
A troubleshooter who proactively removes roadblocks and pursues solutions to problems that stand in the way
You value and develop trusted relationships at every operational level
The ability to operate with urgency and prioritise work accordingly
Strong decision making skills, the ability to demonstrate sound judgement
A structured and logical approach to work; Strong problem solving skills
A creative and innovative approach to work
Excellent presentation skills and excellent attention to detail and accuracy
The ability to manage large workloads and tight deadlines
A calm approach, with the ability to perform well in a pressurised environment
MUFG is committed to embracing diversity and building an inclusive culture where all employees are valued, respected and their opinions count. We support the principles of equality, diversity and inclusion in recruitment and employment, and oppose all forms of discrimination on the grounds of age, sex, gender, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy and maternity, race, gender reassignment, religion or belief and marriage or civil partnership.
We make our recruitment decisions in a non-discriminatory manner in accordance with our commitment to identifying the right skills for the right role and our obligations under the law.
We are open to considering flexible working requests in line with organisational requirements.

Frontier Developments are the AAA games studio behind Jurassic World Evolution, Planet Coaster, Planet Zoo and Elite Dangerous. We are Britain’s biggest independent publisher and developer of video games, based among the world-leading technology cluster in the historic city of Cambridge, England.
As we continue to grow and develop our business, we have created a new position for an Information Security Specialist to join our team. Reporting to the Operations Director, and working closely with the Head of IT and Head of Online, you will be tasked with defining and communicating our InfoSec policies, and undertake follow-up actions such as security audits, ensuring best practice is adhered to at all times.
We are looking for a hands-on InfoSec Specialist who is a subject matter expert in the field, to provide continuous sound advice across multiple business units. This is a great new opportunity with fantastic career development opportunities, working for an exciting and successful technology business here in Cambridge.
Key Responsibilities
Evaluate current policies and provide input for improving and delivering Cyber and Information Security strategy and plans
Lead risk & control assessments using defined processes
Carry out security audits and ensure compliance and best practice is adhered to, using external support as required
Work with the Head of IT and Head of Online and manage third parties to implement, develop and review the appropriate security infrastructure
Represent information security with internal stakeholders as a trusted advisor, reporting to Operations Director.
Provide appropriate specialist advice and interpretation of information security best practice at the appropriate level for the target audience
Respond to queries from staff and provide regular communications on information security to ensure effective risk management of information security
Manage, investigate and report information security breaches in accordance with defined incident management processes, ensuring impacts and risks are appropriately identified, assessed and mitigated
Ensure appropriate and timely reporting and escalation of areas of non-compliance and poor security
Interpret company objectives and their IT Security implications.
Key Skills & Experience
Degree educated in Computer Sciences/Engineering or a related discipline
Practical and demonstrable experience of information security (technical and non-technical aspects)
Previous experience in a similar roles in software development would be essential
Pragmatic in balancing risk and control requirements with commercial drivers
Able to influence decision making to surface and mitigate issues and risks across a wide range of stakeholders
Ideally CISSP, CISM, CISA, CCSP certified
Technical knowledge of networks, operating systems, databases, firewalls, anti-virus, and patch management on-premise and cloud
Good understanding of privileged access management and identity and access management.
Knowledge and experience of the security products available including intrusion detection, SIEM, vulnerability assessment, encryption tools and PAM/IAM toolsets.
Awareness of GDPR and the Governments Cyber Essentials programme
Understanding of quality standards such as ISO9001, ISO27001, NIST, BS7799.
What we can offer you
At Frontier we believe your work should be rewarding in every way. We offer the chance to work on blockbuster franchises and world-leading IP in a studio environment considered one of the best places to work in the UK.
We also offer a range of flexible benefits to our 550+ team, including life assurance, private family healthcare, pension, flexitime working hours, enhanced maternity/paternity package, in-house catering, support with relocation, a Cycle to Work scheme and free bike servicing, regular in-house wellbeing sessions, regular social events, and annual bonus and sharesave schemes for everyone to share in the studio’s success.
We welcome and encourage applications from qualified candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion or belief.

At Royal London we want to attract the best talent to help us achieve our vision of becoming the most trusted and recommended financial company in the UK. We are the largest mutual life, pensions and Investment Company in the UK.

Royal London Asset Management (RLAM) was established in 1988 and is a wholly owned and central part of the Royal London Group. Since our inception we have built a reputation as an innovative, high performing fund manager. Our track record and exceptional client service have been recognised with a number of awards. We are proud of the people we employ, the performance we have delivered and the wide-ranging group of clients we manage.

The Fund Accounting Oversight team play a crucial role in TPA fund accounting supervision, monitoring and sign off. It also acts as main point of contact for fund accounting technical queries and provides key input and support for fair value pricing, new fund launches, new instruments and other projects.

The role reports to Fund Accounting Oversight Manager and it is a specialist pricing role for someone who has deep technical knowledge of FI and Equity pricing. The role will provide senior day-to-day oversight of the delivery of equity and fixed income security pricing across all product types managed by RLAM and relevant RLAM companies. The role holder will also act as the first point of contact within RLAM for all security pricing queries. Whilst RLAM leverages third party expertise to provide pricing and valuation services the oversight and challenge of those activities is crucial. A key focus will be on complex securities such as those securities in default, those with missed coupon payments, stale or static prices, limited broker quotes and PIKs.

Key Accountabilities
Enhance the established oversight framework and ensure procedures and policies adhere to best practice and provide the right outcome for customers.
Oversee and challenge functions from Front Office to Third Parties but will need to manage reporting and escalations to the Valuation Oversight Committee (VOC). This requires exceptional attention to detail, strong MI reporting abilities and outstanding communication skills.
Develop and proactively manage stakeholder relationships within the business, in particular with Risk & Compliance, Investment Risk and Front Office.
Build and manage the relationships with the third party administrators’ Security Pricing Teams, who are responsible for providing the prices for RLAM products. This will involve technical oversight reviews using a risk based approach to provide assurance over the pricing and valuation services. This will also involve working with the Outsourcing Oversight team to discuss performance against SLAs and escalating issues regarding service when required
Proactive review and monitoring of all RLAM sourced pricing information to fund administrators, demonstrating ability to challenge where required
Production and/or enhancement of relevant procedures and policies in relation to difficult-to-price securities, and present at Committee meetings as required
Content owner of the Pricing Policy and Fair Value Pricing Policy
Participate in projects for the introduction of new instrument types and new fund launches
Ownership of the daily oversight of money market funds regulatory limits monitoring, coordinating actions following agreed procedures for any breach
Responsibility for oversight of swing pricing policy and processes
Act as the subject matter expert for security pricing queries or issues raised by group companies

Skills and Experience
Strong numerical skills
Strong communication skills, both oral and written.
Team player
Self-motivated and proactive; self-starter
Desire to achieve and self-develop
Can work under pressure to tight deadlines

Essential Criteria
Significant experience working within either asset management or a third party administrator, ideally including oversight experience
Strong, demonstrable knowledge of varying equity and fixed income (including money market) instrument types and the valuation of such instruments. Good knowledge of OTC derivatives and alternative investments preferable
You must be able to demonstrate excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, as well as a passion for working in the asset management industry
Relevant industry qualifications i.e. IMC, CFA, ACA (attained or working towards)

Desirable Criteria
Good organisational skills
