We're looking for an Information Security Analyst to join our team in London as part of our Technology function.
You will be working as part of a focused team to set and deliver the security strategy for the organisation and its core platforms, A key focus of the role will be cloud security and helping to ensure the correct controls and measures are in place to protect the cloud estate, whilst also addressing key operational aspects such as auditing, remediation, evaluating new technology, malware analysis, digital forensic work and End User Cyber Security Awareness . This will provide a fantastic opportunity to get further hands on experience with setting and managing Cloud Security standards, security auditing and ethical hacking tools, as well as providing scope to develop your own vulnerability assessment skills.
You must have demonstrable experience of setting, implementing, and managing security standards in cloud environments, be able to demonstrate some level of programming or scripting and be comfortable with both Linux and Windows operating systems. Experience with implementing and managing DLP, SIEM, and Vulnerability Management toolsets is desirable. You will also be expected to assist with internal forensic investigations including memory forensics, timeline creation, and malware analysis, along with assisting in any incidents. If these are not areas that you are already experienced in, then this is a great opportunity to learn. Travel to other Ascential offices may be required from time to time.
Key Responsibilities
Input to shape our Information Security strategy to stay abreast of the evolving threat landscape as relevant to Ascential
Help define and implement the Cloud Security standards across our product platforms working with our global Product teams
Support key strategic projects selecting and implementing tooling (for example SIEM tooling, DLP, Vulnerability Management). Supporting or running product evaluations to select new Information Security solutions
Research current threats from a variety of sources to highlight those that pose a risk to Ascential
Upskilling a motivated network of Security Champions in tools and processes used by the Information Security team, allowing them to provide effective 24-hour first response
Creating and delivering engaging cyber security awareness content
Running regular internal auditing activity to discover vulnerabilities, threats, and breach of company security policy
Learning, shaping, and executing our Cyber Incident Response process when necessary
Assisting with daily checks of monitoring and logging systems
Helping to ensure our Information Security policies and procedures remain up to date and relevant
Your Experience
Information Security related certifications such as (CISSP, SSCP or CCSP)
Excellent understanding of information security best practices.
Vulnerability Management
Understanding of securing Cloud platforms
Monitoring and identifying suspicious or harmful activities
Previous experience in Incident Response
Ideally minimum two years’ experience in an Information Security role
Experience of working in an Enterprise IT team or a managed hosting environment / ISP beneficial
Demonstrable Cloud (AWS is preferable) expertise both from a policy/standards/delivery perspective and threat analysis and compliance reporting
Experience of G Suite, Windows 10 and MacOS

Ascential is a specialist, global, information company that helps the world’s most ambitious businesses win in the digital economy.

IT Engineer | up to £33,500 | London

Jonothan Bosworth Recruitment Specialists are currently working with an iconic institution that celebrates art and culture, based in London. Through our clients’ digital platforms and collaborations with national and international partners they are looking for someone to help them deliver operations, systems development and information management services to over 800 stakeholders across multiple sites.

We have 2 roles ranging from £29,500 up to £33,500 (depending on experience).

As the IT Engineer, you will monitor the performance of our clients’ computers and network equipment, restoring service whenever IT systems fail, whilst analysing any deep-rooted problems.

THE BASICS:

If you can respond to and resolve incidents and service requests assigned to you and diagnose & resolve problems, including desktop equipment, servers and network cabling and data switches, whilst configuring and deploying new IT equipment we’d like to hear from you.

Monitoring the performance of the IT Infrastructure against the service levels in the IS service catalogue, whilst demonstrating responsibility for ensuring physical environments in which technology is housed onsite – data centres, data closets, workshops and store rooms – are clean and are kept in an orderly fashion is important.

Engineers with experience of providing IT technical support services within a large and dispersed organisation, with a good understanding of ITIL processes: Service Request Management and Incident Management, coupled with a methodical approach to problem solving will be sought after.

This is a fantastic job opportunity for an IT Engineer / 2nd Line Support / Senior Engineer / Technical Engineer / Infrastructure Engineer with a commitment to a high standard of customer service, coupled with excellent communication skills.

Please apply TODAY for immediate consideration.

Bellrock Property & Facilities Management Ltd provides specialist risk focussed workplace management and property management services to a wide range of complex and sophisticated clients throughout the UK. Operating in the corporate, healthcare, education, retail & leisure and local authority & central government sectors, we create and implement bespoke solutions to improve the performance and value derived from non-core activity.
The opportunity has arisen for a Security Officer to join our onsite team based at West Sussex. The main responsibility of the role is to provide a ‘best in class’ front of house security service in Main Reception Area in line with Bellrock and Southern Water security and customer service standards. Operate within the Alarm Monitoring Centre under the provisions of Security and Emergency Measures Direction (SEMD) which operates 24/7, 365 days a year
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
· Monitoring of all CCTV cameras in the AMC
· Interface and liaise with Resilience and Security employees co-located in the AMC
· Allocation and checking of radios, keys, badges, phones and miscellaneous items held in the control room / reception area and liaising with employees, tenants and visitors to the site.
· Rotate duties and cover between manned guarding at Reception Area and AMC and be
fully conversant with all procedures following appropriate training
· Monitoring the access control and alarm software
· Acknowledging and reporting site alarm activation
· Liaise with third party providers such as contractors and other enforcement agencies
· Be required to be competent in the use of IMEX alarm handling system and in-house
alarm system following receipt of specific training

· Liaise with and coordinate emergency services in response to alarms and incidents
· Briefings with the outgoing security officer, to include handover notes on hard-copy (updated every 12 hours)
· Investigate and / or reports hazards, unusual or suspicious circumstances to Security Manager for correction or follow-up actions
· Issuing of temporary badges to employees, contractors and visitors (mainly out of hours)
· Frequent internal patrols of building during working hours to include checking of badge readers, fire doors and lighting, including an awareness of any potential H&S issues which will require reporting and resolving
· External patrols to include car parks, bike racks and external damage to the building. May include coning off areas of the car park on an ad hoc basis
· Cover Reception Area which will include answering telephone calls to take messages, answer questions and provide information during breaks and holiday and out of core Reception hours
· Carry out additional duties will include but not limited to printer paper replenishment, meeting room equipment checks and preparation of rooms to required standards
· Gritting of pathways and ad hoc litter picking whilst on external patrols
· To maintain compliance with Health and Safety requirements of the business and current data legislation (GDPR)
· Maintain and be fully conversant with all departmental policies, procedures and standards
· To carry out any other reasonable tasks requested or required
· To undertake any specific training when required to do so and overall to have a responsibility towards self-development
· May be required to cover duties periodically at Falmer Site in Brighton
COMPETENCIES, CORE QUALITIES AND ATTRIBUTES
· To ensure that the Health & Welfare of staff and assets on site always remain safe
· Provide a warm and welcoming environment with a can-do ethos with a strong interpersonal skill (verbal & written)

· Team Player
· Experience of working under pressure to get results

Job Title: IT Risk Technical Specialist - Network Security
Job Description:
The position will be a key representative of the ITSSD ensuring the delivery of security services sitting in the EMEA region.
The Cyber Operations team is responsible for managing operational cybersecurity monitoring across Munich Re.
We are hiring an IT Security Risk Specialist to work in our growing Network Security segment.

The IT Security Risk Specialist will be part of this team responsible for the monitoring and management of devices and applications such as proxy, firewall change assurance, IPS/ IDS, and DDoS.

Monitor network security infrastructure health and activities

4+ years experience in security, networking or systems administration
Experience building, implementing and maintaining IT security devices
Experience with proxy, DDoS, IDS/IPS and Firewall ACL
Understanding of firewall policies and best practices
Familiarity with Tufin SecureTrack or similar tools is required.
Good understanding of networking and security concepts
Familiarity with Zscaler is a plus.
Professional experience working with networks and network architecture is a plus
CISSP and/or CISA Certifications preferred
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience
Experience with change management policies and procedures
Excellent verbal, interpersonal, and written communication skills
Excellent analytical, problem-solving and decision-making capabilities
Can effectively work across a geographically distributed team environment
A results oriented, high energy individual who takes pride in their work

Job title: Security Specialist
Location: High Wycombe, Head Office
Salary: £35,000 - £45,000
Hours: 37 hours per week, Monday to Friday
InHealth are embarking on an exciting digital transformation journey which will enable patients to interact with our services in a truly digitally enabled way, in the full knowledge that their data is properly secured and managed throughout our various systems and technology platforms.
We have therefore created an exciting new role of Security Specialist within our IT team to oversee security across all our technical services, ensuring that we are compliant with relevant legislation / guidance / standards (we are currently ISO27001 registered) and putting in place robust industry standard practices to ensure that we are operating safely and securely.
The role:
The newly created role of Security Specialist is absolutely focused on ensuring that InHealth’s technology platforms, application systems and associated services are secure, according to recognised industry best-practice standards. You are the focal point for all security matters within the team, and act as the subject matter expert when required, and you will help the organisation introduce and maintain the right kinds of software tools, monitoring systems, and process frameworks which ensure that security is properly managed across the organisation.
What you will do:
Ensure there are suitable security frameworks in place to build upon InHealth’s ISO27001 certifications, extending and deepening it where necessary and ensuring it is properly enacted across the enterprise
Monitor security alarms and alerts, check for patterns or suspicious activities, triage them appropriately and then respond to adverse incidents with effective actions / measures to prevent wider propagation
Provide expert security measures advice to technical colleagues on any projects they are undertaking, systems they are implementing, or changes that they are making to our infrastructure
Carry out periodic tests and checks on the security systems and measures in place and use third parties where needed for independent confirmation and verification of the suitability of our security measures
Routinely share and communicate security status updates to senior colleagues, both within IT services and across the business, to build confidence and trust in our security systems and processes
What you are responsible for:
Ensuring that we have a continuous picture of threats and vulnerabilities across our infrastructure, platforms, applications systems and associated technologies, and that measures are put in place to reduce those risks to acceptable levels
Maintaining our compliance with ISO27001 frameworks (and others that we agree need to be implemented to augment the ISO), working with colleagues across the department to ensure that they are implementing the appropriate measures within their sphere
Keeping on top of changes to systems and services where there are likely to be security implications and interpreting those changes, identifying the risks and guiding colleagues as necessary
Acting as the lead investigator and coordinator for any reported or suspected security incidents, responding rapidly to the situation and ensuring that it is quickly and properly controlled
What people see in you:
Someone that can be relied upon for advice and guidance on all matters relating to information security
An individual that instils confidence with everyone they work with by providing structured, impartial and objective advice when under pressure
A high attention to detail; nothing will be missed by you and you have your eye on detail all the time, spotting things that others may not necessarily see
Excellent communication and relationship building skills with an ability to collaborate with and educate colleagues across all areas of the business
We are looking for someone with:
3 years practical cyber security experience preferably backed up with qualifications such as: CISSP, GSEC, and/or Sec+ or equivalents
Solid experience in areas of cyber security operations, such as attack surface management, SOC operations, Intrusion Detection/Intrusion Prevention Systems (IDS/IPS), threats (including APT, insider, etc.), vulnerabilities, and exploits; incident response, investigations and remediation (exposure to SIEM would be advantageous)
A very strong understanding of IT infrastructure, networks, operating systems, and application systems, especially the security aspects of those technical products
Experience of implementing security frameworks such as ISO27001 or similar successfully in other organisations, and an excellent understanding and knowledge of related legislation such as GDPR
A sound understanding of the healthcare industry and the importance of patient confidentiality, and ideally experience of delivering projects within the NHS
The ability to present and relay information to senior management colleagues to support decision making or business case plans

Information Security Specialist
00074838
Information Security Specialist

Are you able to manage the Security Accreditation of a programme at varying points in the lifecycle? Can you ensure products meet Information Assurance requirements and that Security Risks are reduced to an acceptable level? Would you like to work with advanced technologies to minimise the risk of both cyber threats and social attacks? We currently have a vacancy for an Information Security Specialist at our site in New Malden.

As an Information Security Specialist, you will be tasked with ensuring our products across the Maritime Sector are secure by design, achieve security accreditation and maintain security through-life.

This role will provide you with the opportunity to liaise with stakeholders, influence engineering design, produce evidence in support of accreditation, provide advice and guidance to shape technical solutions and support embedding our security culture across the business.

Your main responsibilities as an Information Security Specialist will involve:

Designing and shaping the technical security architecture of strategically important products to ensure they are secure by design.

Liaising with the system accreditor(s) and stakeholders to manage expectations, ensure that security requirements are met and the security risk is reduced to acceptable level.

Determining security principles for the project solution to work within.

Producing accreditation artefacts such as product security architecture and Risk Management Accredited Document Set (RMADS) in support of accreditation. Collecting evidence for the security case.

Responding to security questions within bid proposal documents, producing estimates, and selecting security principles and frameworks.

Contributing to the wider Product Security Department delivering awareness material and presentations and speaking at Special Interest Groups, improving processes.

Keeping up to date on relevant security standards, process and technologies, developing skills and capabilities to be able to provide more effective services.

Supporting the product security Special Interest Group by sharing best practice.

Your skills and qualifications as an Information Security Specialist:

Essential:

Experience in ensuring security within complex networked systems.

Fundamental understanding of ICT, OCT and ICS technologies, how they connect together, different protocols, operating systems and applications.

A good understanding of National Technical Authority suggested Security Frameworks and Methodologies.

Good technical understanding of systems and how their security aspects are applied and affect performance.

Ability to identify and investigate technology to understand security vulnerabilities and how to mitigate them.

Desirable:

Solid systems engineering experience and background.

Understanding of Virtualised systems (Exposure to VMware products).

Exposure to securing thin or zero client environments.

Good knowledge and understanding of security risk assessments and RMADS (Risk Management Accredited Document Set) and the accreditation process.

Familiarity of Defence Standards/Security Regulations such as JSP440, JSP604 or, other security standards such as ISO27000 and NIST.

What we're looking for in you:

A flexible and adaptive individual with excellent communication, high attention to detail and strong influencing and interpersonal skills.

Location: New Malden / Various

Salary: Competitive

Benefits: Our employees receive an excellent benefits package which includes a competitive pension scheme, enhanced annual leave allowance and a Company contributed Share Incentive Plan. We also offer a range of additional benefits such as flexible working, an employee assistance programme, Cycle2work scheme and many local and national employee discounts. Some employees may also be eligible for an annual incentive.

BAE Systems

BAE Systems is one of the worlds leading global defence, security and aerospace companies. We work at the cutting edge of technology, creating more than 100 new inventions every year for customers in over 100 countries.

BAE Systems Maritime

Our Maritime Sector encompasses three lines of business; Submarines, Naval Ships and Maritime Services. We design and manufacture complex naval ships and submarines, as well as their state of the art combat systems and equipment. We also offer an array of associated services, including training solutions, maintenance and modernisation programmes to support ships and equipment in service around the world and the management of supporting infrastructure.

We employ a diverse range of people with the unique expertise to design, integrate and support platforms and systems; all focussed on understanding our customers evolving needs, meeting their expectations and delivering on commitments made to them, wherever they are in the world.

We have significant growth opportunities across our three dynamic businesses with exciting transformation programmes running right through the next decade; strengthening our competitive advantage and developing our business as an employer of choice for our current and future employees.

We recognise that an inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees feel respected, valued and able to achieve their full potential is vitally important. Not only does it inspire creativity and collaboration, its good for business. We celebrate our differences and believe our diverse skills, abilities and perspectives strengthen our culture and our overall performance.

We welcome applications from all suitably qualified people.

Please be aware that many roles working for BAE Systems will be subject to both security and export control restrictions. These restrictions mean that factors including your nationality, any previous nationalities you have held, and/or your place of birth may limit those roles that you can perform for the organisation.

Due to the volume of applications we receive, we sometimes close our vacancies early. It is therefore advisable to apply as early as possible if you would like to be considered for a role with BAE Systems.

The position will be a key representative of the ITSSD ensuring the delivery of security services sitting in the EMEA region.

The Email Security Lead will be part of this global team, focused on the 24x7 operation and maintenance of Munich Re’s Email Security product.
This role will report to the Head of Global Cyber Operations

Act as the service lead and ambassador for our global email security solution.
Actively engage with SIEM and Global Cyber Defense Center on potential issues and items to investigate.
Maintain operations, documentation and knowledge for the email security product.
Assist in troubleshooting and problem solving a wide variety of client email issues and issues affecting email security
Proactively anticipates service issues before they occur and able to make recommendations around resolution.
Implement analytics-based rules to enhance and maintain visibility for the Information Security team across email security
Implement and communicate best practice on Email and Enterprise Security products to both technical and non-technical personnel.
Develop and maintain content and reporting.
Take part in projects as a subject matter expert and service owner.

The role involves:

Attending daily/weekly/monthly team & service meetings where required
Monitoring all proxies (performance and availability) and respond to any potential issues in a timely manner
Working closely with global teams & markets, ensuring excellent stakeholder management

Customer-centric with superb communication skills
What will you get for this role?
A competitive salary depending on location, skills, experience and qualifications
Generous defined contribution pension scheme
Annual performance related bonus and pay review

Excellent range of flexible benefits to include a matching share save scheme
Working at Aviva


At Aviva, we’re people with a purpose. To be with you today, for a better tomorrow.

We bring this to life by ensuring managing risk is at the heart of the way we all work. We love people who do the right thing for our customers, and our colleagues. We want people who speak up, who take ownership, and who make good decisions.

The way we do this is important too. We always ‘Care More’. It’s our thing! We’re all about our people – that’s you – so we can be pretty flexible. If you want to work from home some of the time or change your hours so you can pick up your kids or care for someone in your family, we’re very open to that. In fact, we don’t advertise roles as either part or full time, because we know each person has different needs, just as each business area has different needs. So, it’s up to you to discuss working hours during your interview.

We care deeply about being inclusive and that means we encourage applications from people with diverse set of backgrounds and experiences. We want our employees to bring their whole self to work and that starts with you!

We interview every disabled applicant* that meets the minimum criteria for the job. Just send us an email once you’ve applied stating that you have a disclosed disability, and we’ll make sure we interview you.

We’d love it if you could submit your application online. If you require an alternative method of applying, please give Daniela Krol a call on 0121 234 7660 or send an email to daniela.krol@aviva.com

*As defined in The Equality Act 2010*. By ‘minimum criteria’ we mean you should provide us with evidence which demonstrates that you generally meet the level of competence required and have the qualifications, skills or experience defined as essential to perform the role.

McCarthy & Stone is the UK’s leading retirement housebuilder with a 70% share of the owner-occupied retirement housing market.

Since 1977, the company has sold more than 51,000 apartments in more than 1,100 different locations. We currently have over 100 developments under construction or for sale in the UK and are proud to be the only UK housebuilder, of any size or type, to have been awarded the NHBC’s Five Star rating for customer satisfaction for fifteen years running.

At the very heart of this success is our people's desire to enrich the lives of our customers. We have fantastic people who care about the work they do and are proud to work for McCarthy & Stone, and this is where you come in.

About the role

An unique opportunity has arisen for a Cyber Security Specialist (FULL TIME) to join our IT department at our Head Office, Bournemouth.

The Cyber Security Specialist role with involve working with our IT Teams and business functions to ensure the systems and data assets are routinely risk assessed with appropriate controls. You will lead on developing and putting mitigating actions in place to provide protection from disruption or compromise arising from failures of confidentiality, integrity, or availability. The jobholder will also be responsible for ensuring that the assurance process supports and enables our business objectives and strategic plans.

Key Responsibilities

Identify and assess cyber security risks and define appropriate mitigating controls
determine, adapt, and maintain corporate security procedures and policies
carry out security due diligence assessment of trusted third parties and contracted suppliers
maintain a cyber security risk register and assist with internal and external audits relating to cyber security
lead with the creation, maintenance and delivery of cyber security awareness training for colleagues
assist in developing and maintaining the ISMS (Information Security Management System) to ensure that good industry standard practice for information security is adhered to
take ownership of defining and delivering work packages that reduce cyber security risk exposure
recommend security enhancements and contribute towards security strategies
work closely with the Director IT operations; Director of Technology & the Head of Programmes on defining priorities and delivery
act as subject matter expert and provide BAU support for colleagues and teams on all matters relating to cyber security, including identity and access management, device and data protection, threat detection, and incident response

About you

Education and Qualifications

CISSP, CISM or an alternate relevant qualification.

Knowledge & Experience

track record of delivering successful cyber security initiatives and supporting services
solid and demonstrable understanding of information security standards, data protection and regulatory compliance (such as GDPR, ISO27001, ISO 22301, Cyber Essentials & PCI-DSS and NCSC guidance)
experience of developing and implementing cyber security policies and procedures
experience of running workshops and chairing meetings
ability to use logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses in the organisations security posture
an understanding of the cyber security risks associated with various technologies and ways to manage them
a good working knowledge of various security technologies, preventative controls and potential attack vectors

Personal Attributes

A conscientious team player with high level of self-motivation;
Deadline-orientated with the ability to multitask and problem solve;
High levels of accuracy, good numerical ability and reporting skills;
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to communicate at all levels;
Proven ability to thrive in a busy working environment;
Analytical, with a keen eye for detail and intuitive nature, demonstrating the ability to problem solve;
strong written communication skills, for example report writing
ability to communicate with a range of technical and non-technical team members and other relevant individuals

The job is office based but travel to Regional offices, developments and other locations is required from time to time. Occasional nights away from home may be necessary from time to time, to deliver a service to more distant sites.

About the rewards

In addition to an attractive salary and benefits package, we offer excellent training on McCarthy & Stone products as well as coaching to enable your own personal development.

Company Values - PRIDE - Passion / Responsibility / Innovation / Determination / Excellence

Key Accountabilities
First line response to ticketing matters, including appropriate activities to close out such tickets
First line response to enquiries and queries received by the department
Support of the department’s key technology solutions
Support of the departments key processes
Assisting the InfoSec management team with risk analysis work
Assisting with matters of an audit and compliance nature
Assisting the technology team with security subject matter expertise in all areas of InfoSec focus
Assisting with departmental efforts to maintain and continuously mature security state within Man
Part of the Cyber/Security incident handling and containment (Incident Response) function within the organisation
Produce and review system documentation of the security technologies and controls estate
Represent the InfoSec department at Change Control meetings where appropriate
Required Skills & Experience
10+ years’ experience working in an InfoSec specialist / consultant role
Experience within the financial sector will be a considerable benefit
Analytical judgment and decision-making skills

Job description
Our cybersecurity team

We build and run world-class public services for the digital age. The cybersecurity team works to protect those services and keep our users and data safe.

We work in small multidisciplinary agile teams and utilise a modern, forward-thinking approach to security. We deliver tangible security solutions and services for platforms as diverse as Amazon Web Services and Kubernetes (k8s) to Cloudfoundry and on-prem infrastructure.

We focus on intelligent and autonomous self-service tooling and tech-engineered solutions to solve today’s and tomorrow’s cybersecurity challenges.

Responsibilities
As a SOC Analyst you'll:

• improve our tooling, detection capabilities, and incident response
• proactively identify, analyse and investigate security alerts and manage security incidents
• work with technical teams to continuously improve the security of our services
• research new and evolving threat actors, threats and vulnerabilities
• be an ambassador for Cybersecurity; promoting good practices and our team’s tools and services across the organisation

We’re interested in people who:

• have an interest in cyber security
• possess a naturally inquisitive mind, having shown a proactive approach to investigating data in a work or educational environment
• can demonstrate the ability to analyse and interpret data
• are knowledgeable about common security vulnerabilities and remediation techniques
• have good familiarity of Linux, Mac or Windows platforms, along with Python, Powershell or Bash
• are excellent communicators at all levels, both written and verbal

Please note that this role also includes an out-of-hours on-call rota

Job Title: Assistant Vice President, IT Security Project Delivery Specialist
Job Description:
We are MUFG. 360 years of heritage. A world-class set of businesses. And more than 180,000 employees in 50 markets. It’s no surprise that MUFG has grown to become one of the top five banks in the world. Our services include commercial banking, trust banking, securities, credit cards, consumer finance, asset management, and leasing. MUFG offers stability in an ever-changing market, providing services to high-profile clients worldwide.

Our vision? To become the world’s most trusted financial group. You’ll help us achieve it.

Overview of Department/Section

IT Risk, Security & Control department covers cyber security strategy maintenance and tactical planning and operations to provide IT Security protection, governance, risk management and reporting. This includes promoting Head Office Information Security Standards and Procedures (ISSP) requirements and local security requirements. The department supports and monitors security solutions such as virus protection, vulnerability management, compliance monitoring and threat/incident management activities to reduce risk.



Main Purpose of the role

The Cybersecurity Technical resource is responsible for management and delivery on large, strategic and complex cybersecurity projects. The role manages the execution of project/product cybersecurity elements across cross-portfolio programs and services. Executions include working with multiple security, IT and other leadership / stakeholders and a variety of security, IT and engineering technical resources to identify, plan and deliver cybersecurity initiatives. Deliverables include, but are not limited to:
To support the delivery of cyber projects within agreed scope, cost and timescale.
To implement technical solutions across the Cyber security platform.
To manage and work independently or as part of a team in delivering complex projects.


Key Responsibilities

For dual hat only (delete if applicable):

In this role, you will be responsible for xxx across MUFG’s banking arm and securities business under a dual-hat arrangement. Under this arrangement, you will act and make decisions on behalf of both the bank and the securities business, subject to the same remit and level of authority, and irrespective of the entity which employs you.

In this role, you will be responsible for cybersecurity technical project delivery across MUFG’s banking arm and securities business under a dual-hat arrangement. Under this arrangement, you will act and make decisions on behalf of both the bank and the securities business, subject to the same remit and level of authority, and irrespective of the entity which employs you. Key responsibilities include but, but not limited to:
Interprete cybersecurity relevant regulatory and other requirements or best practices and translate these to business aligned cybersecurity programme requirements.
Manage the delivery of cybersecurity projects within agreed scope, cost and timescale across Bank and Securities.
Support of the delivery of the cyber portion of allocated Cross Portfolio projects including implementation of cyber projects
The technical resource will be responsible for support and execution of the following deliverables as required: business requirements, technical design and architecture, engagement with other infrastructure teams



Work Experience

Essential
Experience in working on multiple projects with broad scope, ambiguity, and high degree of difficulty
Experience in technology projects such as implementation of Cyber infrastructure replacement etc.
Demonstrable proficiency in a wide range of information IT security technologies and embedded security; at the minimum knowledge must cover key cybersecurity domains such as Identity and Access Management, Incident Management Posessing high level of analytical ability where problems are typically unusual and difficult
Ability to maintain a working knowledge of cybersecurity principles and elements
Understand global program structure, launch plan and timing, and global program ownership
Demonstrable experience of senior stakeholder management and relevant management reporting.
Ability to coach team members through knowledge transfer and constructive feedback


Skills and Experience

Functional / Technical Competencies

Essential
Knowledge of IT security principles and controls
Proven understanding of current best practise approach to security assurance and the application of security frameworks
Operational knowledge of Windows; Linux; operating systems is required, including experience with Windows Active Directory and Unix/Linux system administration
Experience in project and development methodologies covering; architecture,design, project implementation and risk assessment.
Wide-ranging security knowledge of technologies and architectures across several of the following environments: Web,Email, Desktop, Server,Anti Virus /Malware
Excellent stakeholder relationship management skills
Planning and prioritising multiple project work streams in response to rapidly developing and changing portfolios.
Turning business problems into optimal technical security designs, aligning user needs with systems requirements and organisational goals.
Broad experience in computer and network systems, including IT security
Ability to handle ambiguity and make decisions and recommendations with limited data
Solid analytical/problem-solving skills with capability to identify solutions to unusual and complex problems


Education / Qualifications

Essential
Degree educated and / or equivalent experience.


Personal Requirements

You are a leader and an expert in delivery of cyberframeworks and associated key solutions
A demonstrable passion for cybersecurity
Excellent communication/leadership/interpersonal skills; results driven and with strong sense of accountability
You are experienced in engaging and persuading teams to accept and participate in best-in-class security architecture and operations
Data driven, ability to analyze data needed to effectively measure progress against the execution of objectives
You successfully convey technical information in an understandable way that generates results
A troubleshooter who proactively removes roadblocks and pursues solutions to problems that stand in the way
You value and develop trusted relationships at every operational level
The ability to operate with urgency and prioritise work accordingly
Strong decision making skills, the ability to demonstrate sound judgement
A structured and logical approach to work; Strong problem solving skills
A creative and innovative approach to work
Excellent presentation skills and excellent attention to detail and accuracy
The ability to manage large workloads and tight deadlines
A calm approach, with the ability to perform well in a pressurised environment
MUFG is committed to embracing diversity and building an inclusive culture where all employees are valued, respected and their opinions count. We support the principles of equality, diversity and inclusion in recruitment and employment, and oppose all forms of discrimination on the grounds of age, sex, gender, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy and maternity, race, gender reassignment, religion or belief and marriage or civil partnership.

We make our recruitment decisions in a non-discriminatory manner in accordance with our commitment to identifying the right skills for the right role and our obligations under the law.

We areopen to considering flexible working requestsin line with organisational requirements.

Apply

Who You'll Work With

Customer Experience (CX) Customer Success Specialists (CSS) are a team of extraordinary technical guides whose #1 focus is to deliver exclusive customer experience. We help solve business challenges with network-centric solutions that accelerate customer and partner success and dedication. Our success is measured through customer happiness metrics, industry recognition, and employee happiness scores.

As a team we know that in engineering and customer success, you can only be successful together, so we emphasize a culture of helping each other, working together, winning together and having fun together. As a CSS team we help customers adopt and expand Cisco solutions by showing impact on the customer’s business goals. Maintaining an end-to-end lens, as CSSs we partner closely with Customer Success Executives, Success Programs Managers, sales accounts teams, delivery teams, partners and others.

What You‘ll Do

As the CSS you are a guide to the client on your aligned product or architecture. Your mission is to help the customer move to the next phase of the customer lifecycle and to visualize their future in the lifecycle. You will:
Deliver workshops and webinars (Accelerators and ATX - Ask-the-Expert) to a diverse set of customers that qualify, tailoring deliverables and driving business outcomes within scope and on-time engagement
Join the Customer Success team in customer engagements and events to improve customer adoption and address product concerns
Contribute to the customer community digital spaces and asset development of Success Tracks
Contribute to product and offer improvement by providing lifecycle feedback to CX Product Management and CX Success Programs Teams
Inspire customers to make tactical and strategic deployment decisions and track long term business outcomes
Collaborate with Account teams, Customer Success, and Partners to elevate customer adoption as well as address product concerns
Drive adoption and expansion of Cisco products by highlighting feature opportunities, winning use cases, and relevant strategies to customers and the Success team
Contribute to lifecycle asset development and maintenance through rotations, asset development sprints, and/or stretch assignments with the Lifecycle Success team


Who You Are

You are a technical expert across multiple technology specializations and you have hands on extensive technical expertise. You have industry recognized certifications and an ability to drive change through innovation. You are a proven leader driving team activities/task.
Customer Obsessed: You love customer interactions and understand customer needs and align architectural and vertical expertise to multi-functional teams.
Technical Guide: You are able to explain technical concepts, give clients guidance and vision about the solution. You have a thorough understanding of the technical fundamentals of aligned technology/specialization areas, including features and use cases. Suggested Certifications and products knowledge: CCNA / CCNP / CCDP/ CCIE, CX Automation X, MSX;
Business Aware: You can connect technology solutions to business outcomes.
Effective Communicator: You articulate the technical features into business impact, you can easily talk about technology to non-technical people. You are also an active listener.

Listen to our Customer Success Specialists and get first-hand experience on the role from them - Click Here.

Why Cisco
#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.

We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!

But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)

Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.

So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

#LI-JT

IT Security Engineer – London – Financial Services

A Major insurance business based in central London are currently looking for IT Security Engineers to join their growing team. Working within an Infrastructure team you will be working towards raising the bar on security. The aim is to achieve this by working and collaborating with cross-functional teams to provide guidance on security best practices.
Key Responsibilities:
Engineer, implement and monitor security measures for the protection of computer systems, networks and information.
Prepare and document standard operating procedures and protocols.
Proactively identify and reduce security risks.
Provide subject matter expertise on architecture, authentication, and system security.
Develop technical solutions and new security tools to help mitigate security vulnerabilities and automate repeatable tasks.
Consult with Developers and Product Managers to analyse and propose application security standards, methods, and architectures.
Identify security solutions and implement a multi-layered defence to protect the networks.
Key Skills:
Familiar with common security libraries, security controls, and common security flaws that apply to Microsoft and web-based applications.
Ability to discover and patch Windows, SQL, XSS, CSRF, SSRF, authentication and authorization flaws, and other web-based security vulnerabilities (OWASP Top 10 and beyond).
Hands on experience in security systems, including firewalls, intrusion detection systems, anti-virus software, authentication systems, log management, content filtering, etc.
Knowledge of common authentication technologies including OAuth, SAML, CAs, OTP/TOTP.
Immediate interview and start available, get in touch for more info
Job Information

About Us

At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world's largest networks that powers trillions of requests per month. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare have all web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was recognized by the World Economic Forum as a Technology Pioneer and named to Entrepreneur Magazine's Top Company Cultures list.

We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!

The Team

Security Compliance is a critical business function at Cloudflare. Compliance certifications allow our customers to be confident in the security of our products and guide Cloudflare's teams on how to incorporate security principles in the management of systems, the development of products, and the expansion of our business footprint. This is an opportunity to join a rapidly scaling and world class security organization within a billion dollar business.

You will join the Customer Compliance Team, which is focused on building trust with customers through sharing information about Cloudflare's security program and policies. As the first hire on this team in Singapore, London, or Austin, you will become the subject-matter expert on customer compliance questions within the region. You will also be responsible for training the Sales, Customer Success, and Customer Support representatives within your home office on basic security concepts at Cloudflare and how and when to work with the Security Team more generally.

We guarantee that you will be challenged and have room for growth on our team!

What you'll do
Become the subject matter expert on customer security and compliance topics within Austin/Singapore/London office
Develop and maintain answers to common customer questions about Cloudflare security, compliance certifications, and evolving privacy/security regulations
Respond to customer requests including contributing to RFPs, completing security questionnaires, and meeting with customers to answer their security questions
Streamline or automate current processes to deliver responses to customer questions more efficiently
Ensure continuity of security questionnaire answers by validating with teams across Cloudflare engineering and security
Contribute to public-facing documentation in the form of white papers, customer-facing policies, and other resources that can be shared with customers on SOC 2, PCI-DSS, ISO 27001, and other security/compliance topics
Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience
Ability to work cross-functionally with internal stakeholders across many teams including Sales, Legal, Product, and Engineering
Ability to work efficiently and independently in a fast-paced, high-volume environment.
Strong communication and writing skills
Comfort in working irregular hours to support global teams
Proficiency in German and/or French desired for candidates interested in London-based role
Demonstrated interest in Security is a must; Security Compliance background is preferred
Familiarity with Salesforce, Jira, and RFP/deal management tools is a plus
What Makes Cloudflare Special?

We're not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We're a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.

Project Galileo: We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare's enterprise customers--at no cost.

Athenian Project: We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.

Path Forward Partnership: Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.

1.1.1.1: We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here's the deal - we don't store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy policy and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.

Sound like something you'd like to be a part of? We'd love to hear from you!

Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.

Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at hr@cloudflare.com or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.

*UK based, flexible split between home and client sites*

Savanti is a practitioner-led consulting firm with unrivalled expertise when it comes to cyber security. We remove the fear, uncertainty and doubt associated with cyber risk allowing our clients to get on with what they do best.

Our clients range in size from innovative start-ups to the largest global organisations, with many household names across industries including banking, insurance, retail, energy, manufacturing, sport and education. They are predominantly UK based but we also have clients throughout Europe and as far away as Japan.
Help us push the boundaries of current security thinking and challenge the status quo.
We offer a competitive package and the opportunity to quickly grow your responsibilities with an accelerated career path.
We are an absolute meritocracy and will generously reward those who make a positive different to our business.
Key Accountabilities:

We are currently expanding our client facing teams to meet the demands of our growing client base and are looking recruit a Cloud Cyber Security Specialist. Working closely with client Information Security, IT and software teams you will assess cyber security risk, cloud controls, and recommend and implement security solutions in the cloud environment.

Experience:
Extensive hands on experience and in-depth knowledge of one or more of the GCP, AWS and Azure cloud platforms is essential
Proven cloud security architecture knowledge and expertise
Experience of reviewing and designing the security of complex application and technology architectures in the cloud as part of digital transformation and cloud migration projects
Strong knowledge of cloud identity and access management controls, tools and technologies
Experience of analysing cloud security risks and threats, performing cloud security audits and assessments and recommending cloud security controls
Experience of implementing cloud vendor security hardening practices
Exposure to cloud security monitoring including tooling, log collection and log analysis
Working knowledge of key cloud security standards such as NIST, CIS, NCSC and ISO
Clear, concise and articulate written and verbal communication, when presenting and explaining results and findings
Ability to manage stakeholder expectations including senior-level relationships
Able to work independently with minimal supervision and integrate well into teams
Demonstrate a strong ability to learn and share knowledge
Qualifications & Certifications:

Appropriate cloud and industry qualifications and certifications such as CCSP, CISSP, TOGAF, SABSA, Microsoft Certified Azure Solutions Architect Expert, AWS Certified Security Speciality, Google Professional Cloud Security Engineer, MSc InfoSec, CISM, CISA, etc.

Successful candidates for this position will be subject to a DBS check.

At Savanti, we source candidates directly and are not looking to engage with any agencies. We do not accept or pay fees for any unsolicited emails or speculative CVs that are submitted to our employees.

As the IT Senior Change & Program Manager, you will be responsible for both managing IT Service projects and change initiatives. You will be responsible for the overall quality of the Program (PM) and Change Management (CM) processes within the IT Service function.

The purpose of this new role is to improve the business experience of change rollouts and to advance our end-to-end project management capabilities across the full project lifecycle.

In this new position on the PM side, you will plan and designate project resources, prepare budgets and monitor progress. You will make sure the scope of the project is sound, report regularly on the progress of the project and ensure that it is staying on its approved schedule. You will also play a key role in establishing, updating and driving the ITS roadmap.

On the CM side, you will focus on the people-side of change, including changes to business processes, systems and technology, job roles and organizational structures. Your primary responsibility will be creating and implementing change-management strategies and plans that maximize employee adoption and usage and minimize resistance. You will work to drive faster adoption, higher utilization of and proficiency with the changes that impact employees. These outcomes will increase benefit realization, value creation and ROI.

As a member of the Change & Program Management CoE, you will work with a team of other IT Senior Change & Program Managers and directly report to the ITS Transformation Director.
YOU'RE GOOD AT
Change management:
Release and Deployment Management
Create and implement change strategies and plans that maximize employee adoption and minimize resistance
Ensure change initiatives meet objectives on time and on budget
Evaluate and ensure the readiness for change
Prepare forecasts, and evaluation of the actual impact of changes
Evaluate/Report how successfully a change was implemented
Cooperate with project teams and further managers involved in the change
Identify risks for resistance as well as the development of plans to address said risks
Support and manage the necessary communication activities related to the change
Program management:
Create and maintain project business case
Ensure projects meet objectives and deadlines on time and on budget
Determine and define project scope and objectives
Develop and manage project strategies and work plans, including stakeholder assessment, communications, leadership alignment
Provide project updates on a consistent basis to various stakeholders about strategy, adjustments, and progress
Oversee team execution in accordance with project plans, tools, and methods, and support resource planning and acquisition.
Facilitate change management activities with cross-functional team members and stakeholders to understand and ensure adoption
Discussing & defend the business case / project updates with various BCG governing bodies such as SteerCo, ITPSG etc.
YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
Education
B.Sc. or equivalent, preferably in computer science, IT or another technical subject area
Experience / Knowledge
12+ years of change management and related experience
A solid understanding of how people go through change and the change process
Experience and strong knowledge of change management principles, methodologies and tools
Proven ability to solve problems creatively
Experience seeing change and projects through the full life cycle
Experience of managing change across cultures and having good operational knowledge in the IT services space
Key competencies
Ability to effectively lead and work with project teams assembled from disparate locations and work virtually to achieve goals
Ability to clearly articulate messages to a variety of audiences
Ability to establish and maintain strong and effective working relationships
Ability to influence others and move toward a common vision or goal
Acute business acumen and understanding of organizational issues and challenges
Organized with a penchant for planning strategy and tactics
Solid communication skills, both written and verbal
Forward looking with a holistic approach
Planning
Process Improvement
Change Control
YOU'LL WORK WITH
BCG’s information technology group collaboratively delivers the latest digital technologies that enable our consultants to lead and our business to grow. For our IT jobs, we seek individuals with expertise in the areas of IT infrastructure, application development, business systems, collaborative and social technologies, information security, and project leadership.
CITY
London
COUNTRY
United Kingdom
YOU'LL BE TRAVELLING
Yes (10%)
YOUR EMPLOYEE TYPE IS
Regular

WHO WE ARE
BCG pioneered strategy consulting more than 50 years ago, and we continue to innovate and redefine the industry. We offer multiple career paths for the world’s best talent to have a real impact on business and society. As part of our team, you will benefit from the breadth and diversity of what we are doing today and where we are headed next. We count on your authenticity, exceptional work, and strong integrity. In return we are committed to supporting you in discovering the most fulfilling career journey possible—and unlocking your potential to advance the world.

Our team called Global Services (GS) provides corporate support to business areas such as Finance, Legal, HR, Marketing and IT. This diverse team of experts, operators and specialists represent all levels from Partner to entry level staff, operating across the globe in multiple countries. Global Services is in short, the backbone of BCG.

Job Title: Interim Microsoft Service Technical Specialist - IT
Job Description:
What's involved with this role:
Start date 4 January 2021. A Microsoft Service Technical Specialist is required to perform technical administration, technical implementation of infrastructure projects, low level design, maintenance functions and documentation creation for Marie Curie’s Microsoft infrastructure services. Core to the role is the design, administration and continual improvement of Marie Curie’s Microsoft services including, but not limited to; Azure, Active Directory, Office 365, Intune, Windows operating systems (server and desktop), Hyper-V, Microsoft Dynamics and System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM). The role will also contribute into the Continual Service Improvement of services, with support from the IT Infrastructure Services Manager. The Microsoft Services Technical Specialist will be responsible for enacting work to bring Marie Curie’s Microsoft infrastructure to a high level or resilience, flexibility and efficient operation, and then maintain that status. Key accountabilities:
Manage, administrate and continually improve the Microsoft infrastructure services including; Azure, Active Directory, Office 365, Intune, Windows operating systems, Hyper-V, Microsoft Dynamics and SCCM
Networking for the above services such as management and administration of ExpressRoute, Azure Networking/Routing, DMZ configuration and best practices, Windows Server networking roles and fundamentals of firewall management
Operation of infrastructure services to organisation security standards, maintaining personal security awareness and contributing to security improvement
Provide expert advice regarding the development and improvement of the Microsoft infrastructure services
Experience in the design, configuration and deployment of Microsoft Intune solutions including User Management, Service Administration, Application Creation and Deployment/Assignment, Conditional Access, Device/Profile Management and Mobile Application Management
Experience of managing mobile devices and distribution of applications (e.g. O365 connectors, Skype for Business, other sandbox applications) for both iOS and Android OS within Intune
With support from the IT Infrastructure Services Manager, enact governance of Marie Curie’s Microsoft IT infrastructure services – Includes implementing and overseeing the measurement of; activities, events and quality criteria (e.g. servers created to specified requirements)
Produce and maintain documentation pertaining to; configuration, processes and technical architectures of Marie Curie’s Microsoft infrastructure
Provide ‘hands on’ technical expertise.

Please quote the Job Title & Vacancy Reference No. in your application, or we will be unable to match your CV to the role being applied for.

“Essential Requirements” – Please check to ensure that your CV addresses the following items:
Our clients are generally seeking applicants who are reasonably local, so on that basis we would ideally like you to supply us with your address (or at least your post code) and a telephone number so that we can reach you during working hours.
Your recent UK working experience going back at least 5 years, or full employment history if you have been working for fewer years than this.
Your availability to work either immediately, or at short notice.
Qualifications:
MCSA: Windows Server (2012 or 2016) and evidence of practical application.
ITIL Foundation in IT Service Management and evidence of practical application.
Desirable: one of more of the following Microsoft certificates with evidence of practical application: MCSA: Cloud Platform; MCSA: Office 365; MCSE - Enterprise Devices and Apps; MCSA: Microsoft Dynamics 365; MCTS – Windows 7, Configuring or similar/equivalent; MCSA: Windows 10; MCSA in Microsoft SQL server (2008 or later); MCTS: Windows Server (2008 or later) Applications Infrastructure, Configuration.
Knowledge:
A high level of technical acumen - able to analyse and understand technical systems and issues.
A high degree of technical expertise in at least four of the following areas/technologies: Office 365; SCCM, Azure, Intune, Firewall/Network, Active Directory, Microsoft Dynamics, Hyper-V, Windows server operating systems.
Detailed knowledge of secure configurations of technologies listed above.
Overall awareness of information security challenges, trends and implications on infrastructure.
Technical solution design (Microsoft technologies) (desirable).
A degree of technical expertise the following areas/technologies: SharePoint, Windows desktop operating systems and MS SQL administration (desirable).
Skills:
Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to see the root causes of issues and problems, and resolve them, and map improvements.
Excellent IT infrastructure administration and support skills.
A strong customer focus with good interpersonal and verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
Technical analysis skills with the ability to quickly gain a detailed understanding of complex technical systems and how these systems support the organisation.
Able to appropriately manage own workloads to meet targets and timescales.
Able to present complex concepts in clear, concise and easily comprehensible manner, including through the use of diagrams, presentations and documentation.
Able to demonstrate leadership and management skills, including the ability to influence the work of others outside of the line management chain (desirable).
Experience:
Proven track record of administrating Microsoft environments to a high level of service and efficiency.
Experience of authoring and maintaining technical documentation for use by other technical specialists.
Can think creatively with regards to technical solution design and in the automation of operational activities.
Experience of managing and implementing services with appropriate security controls.
Worked with external parties to deliver technical infrastructure service (desirable).
Previous experience in administering Azure, Office 365, Intune including Azure networking, such as routing and firewall management (desirable).
Experience of performing day-to-day administration tasks to support the business needs and identifying improvements, development and maintenance of Microsoft Dynamics (desirable).
Other preferable/desirable details to include on your CV, if applicable:
Any local authority/public sector experience.
Any relevant qualifications held or being studied for.

Reporting to: Security Operations Team Lead

Department: IT Operations/Technology

Team: IT Security Operations

Within the Technology Department we are the eager problem solvers of the business. It is our job to implement efficient and scalable solutions, whilst focussing on simplicity and elegance. For us it’s not a job – it’s what we love. Try and test. Learn and adapt. That’s how we do things. We’re on a mission of continuous improvement, always striving to keep our products and systems secure and at the forefront of the industry.

We’ve built software that allows our customers to bet on over 125,000 sports fixtures, catering to over 300,000 users placing over 15.5 million bets. Whether it’s product development, delivery processes, or reporting systems – we never stop learning and innovating and always ensure we have the best tool for the job. Efficiency is how we define success – and the average response time of our sites is just 100 milliseconds.

We’re a team of knowledge sharers and collaborators, working in an agile and fast-paced environment. A 24/7 operation specialising in cutting edge technologies, where the possibilities for expansion are limitless. We encourage and support learning, growth and innovation. From global conferences and courses to weekly idea sharing get-togethers (otherwise known as Ted Talks for Betway), we love to talk about and try new things.

Purpose of the role:

The Junior IT Security Engineer will be expected to support the Sec Operations Team’s vision of protecting the business’s digital assets, the maintenance of our systems\\controls and the expansion of our security architecture.

The ideal candidate will be able to adapt to a fast-paced, ever-changing environment, as well as maintain a professional, security-focused approach to all tasks and also ensure they keep up-to-date with current threat trends and use that to the benefit of the business and its goals.

You will be responsible for:
Assist in developing and maintaining the security posture of the business.
Act as an initial point of contact for security issues raised via the Service Desk.
Assist the Security Analysts with monitoring daily/weekly alerts and the investigation thereof.
Assist various teams with prioritizing patches and security fixes.
Assist in the management and investigation of suspected cyber-attacks and/or incidents.
Act as a security evangelist\\business enabler.
Help manage the development and implementation of security policy, standards, guidelines and procedures to ensure ongoing improvement and maintenance of security posture.
Assist the team with required independent security reviews and compliance audits conducted by external vendors.
This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of responsibilities. The job holder may be required to complete any other reasonable duties in order to achieve business objectives.

You will have:
Working experience with the Microsoft Tech Stack (Office 365, Windows, Server)
Strong time management and troubleshooting skills.
Basic knowledge of vulnerabilities, threats, attack methods, and infection vectors.
Good understanding of and working experience with multiple operating systems.
Windows, Linux, MAC OS
Basic experience with security architecture, engineering and operations.
Good understanding of networking fundamentals
OSI Model, Ports, Protocols
Demonstrable analytical abilities.
It would be a bonus if you also had:
Knowledge of or experience within the gambling industry.
CompTIA Security+ or equivalent or at least working towards a security certification.
An understanding of DLP/IDS/IPS technologies and the ability to investigate and provide detailed reports on findings.
Working experience with SIEM technologies as well as the development, implementation and maintenance of custom playbooks.
Working experience with the Microsoft Threat Protection stack and Azure Security.
Person Specification:
Strong interpersonal skills
A self-starter
Takes initiative
You should be passionate about your chosen technology field
Attention to detail
Perseverance and the ability to drive projects to completion
Patient and calm under pressure
Enjoy working with a team
Building working relationships
Our Perks:
Flexible working
Competitive package
Great social and charity events
Health and well being weeks
Free fruit and a heavily discounted Barista
Tickets to events via sponsorships etc
Season Ticket Loan

G-Research is Europe’s leading quantitative finance research firm. We hire the brightest minds in the world to tackle some of the biggest questions in finance. We pair this expertise with machine learning, big data, and some of the most advanced technology available to predict movements in financial markets.

The role

This is an exciting opportunity for a student studying for a Computer Science, Computer Systems, Cyber Security or Networks-related degree to complete their year in industry placement by joining our Technical Support team.

Working across our Corporate IT division, you will spend the year as a crucial member of the Technical Support group, troubleshooting, advising and providing great customer service to a
range of stakeholders, including senior staff.

This is primarily a first line support/operations role where you will be working alongside a mentor and experienced members of the team who will provide continuous support and guidance, enabling you to learn rapidly and contribute effectively to the business.

The successful candidate will be a part of a team that deals with a large range of technologies in a fast paced environment spread across multiple sites, primary based in London, some of those technologies include:
Active Directory, machine access changes and other various authorisation controls
Mobile Device Management - Enrolling users on corporate mobile devices or BYOD profiles
Creating, using and updating scripts, in particular with PowerShell to automate daily tasks
Predominantly Windows, with some Linux systems and support
Windows administration
IT troubleshooting skills
Networking fundamentals - troubleshooting connectivity issues on workstations and servers
Enterprise architecture – Troubleshooting user mailboxes, setting up public folders, creating/updating distribution groups and security groups
This role will suit someone with a passion for customer service with a strong technical and methodical approach to any given task.

Who are we looking for?

This role will suit someone who has a real interest in IT and an aptitude for applying computing concepts and their skills to solve real problems.

The ideal student will have strong grades at either A-levels or BTEC, be studying a Computer Science, Computer Systems, Security or Networks related degree and be on track for a 1st or 2.1 Must be highly organised, motivated, willing to learn with a positive can do attitude and enjoys problem solving.

Comprehensive healthcare and life assurance
25 days holiday

The Global People Data & Analytics Specialist will help to deliver the Dentsu Aegis Network (DAN) people analytics strategy by driving insight for our business through analytics and report creation, supporting on key projects such as focused POCs and project manage our data warehouse solution (with our technology team).
This role will give you the opportunity to design and create the data environment that will be critical to the reporting and statistical analysis that will be done by you and the wider team. It will also allow you to work with senior people on some key business insight projects. The role reports into the Global Director People Data & Analytics and will be part of a team that look after global requirements, including the regional hubs which will also require support.
The role will require you to work collaboratively across the business and functions globally starting with your colleagues within the Global People Analytics team as well as different stakeholders such as IT, HR, Finance, Global Client, and the Data Protection Officer.

Global People Data Specialist

Manipulate and build models to support People analytics projects and insight generation

Helping to identify the latest trends and tools in data and analytics in the market to develop innovative and scalable solutions for DAN

Proven analytics and data manipulation skills

Experience using Tableau and/or Power BI
Willing to learn and challenge themselves
