Who are we?
We are Unum – one of the UK’s leading employee benefits providers.
We’ve been around for 50 years, currently protecting over 1.7 million people, providing security and peace of mind to individuals and their families.
With a Fortune 500, US parent company, we’re part of highly successful global organisation, sharing ideas and innovations across teams to create a collaborative work environment. We’re transforming our business, and we’re keen to increase our digital capabilities to evolve the way we work and optimise opportunities for growth.
The role
What will you be doing?
This role leads a functional area for Unum UK, aligned with the Enterprise Information Security Risk Management function for Unum Group. The role is responsible for partnering in the design, deployment and maintenance of a global information security program that addresses security needs and regulatory requirements for Unum Group and its partners.

This role works with their team to implement and deliver new solutions to enable, enhance or transform security capabilities or services. This leader is instrumental in the implementation part of the portfolio for their given function. Working with their manager, as well as business and IT partners to define delivery priorities in line with the technical, financial and people resources available. This leader also works across the enterprise to develop business partner relationships, effectively communicate, and successfully execute IT plans in support of the agreed goals and objectives
What will you bring?
Leading functional team(s) to successfully build, enhance, transform, or support security technology and/or secure business services by successfully delivering on outcomes.
Engaging in strategic planning with business and IT stakeholders, to provide direction, guidance or recommendations on technology, and architectural considerations.
Actively participating in the definition of a security portfolio of change and roadmaps. Engages and influences IT and business leaders to ensure the portfolio will deliver agreed business objectives.
Collaborates with IT leadership across various disciplines, provides guidance, direction or recommendations to address a wide range of business and technology needs, with emphasis on optimized, timely and successful delivery
Ensures compliance to information security policies and standards, including the use of third parties for relevant testing and works closely with Internal Audit, Risk and Compliance
Provides Supplier Security oversight, including initial security assessments, assessments throughout the relationship and incident management of any Information Security incidents should they occur
Contributes to client security assurance, including the provision of security accreditations, specialist summary materials and responses to questions not covered by those items
In partnership with practice leaders, drives application of the company’s technical and architectural roadmap objectives.
Understands patterns and trends that contribute to utilizing key performance indicators and critical success factors that will improve the performance of the organization.
Experience required:
A bachelor’s degree in computer science, or relevant technical experience/strong experience in an IT field, or equivalent relevant work experience.
Prior management experience is preferred as is the ability to empower and motivate others to be proactive and resourceful, whilst taking smart risks.
An ability to demonstrate leadership in executing IT plans successfully that enable technical or business capabilities and address technology or business priorities,
A strong understanding of Agile/Lean leadership principles
Able to apply broad business and technology understanding of internal and external trends and capabilities to ensure successful implementation of IT plans
Able to communicate a compelling vision and need for change that generates excitement, enthusiasm and commitment to the process
Demonstrates strategic and critical thinking capability and interacts with others, internally and externally, in a way that gives them confidence in their intentions and those of the organization
Technical Knowledge Required:
An in-depth knowledge of regulations, including, GLPA, HIPAA, GDPR, CCPA, and other cyber security regulatory compliance requirements and related programs
An in-depth knowledge of security and control frameworks such as NIST Cyber Security Framework; ISO 17799/27001, CobIT and ITIL
CISSP, CISM, CISA, SANS, and other security related certifications a plus
Why join us?
Our culture!
We aim to be the most inclusive, diverse and socially responsible company in the employee benefits market. With an agile and flexible way of working, we want to be a place where people aspire to work and where everyone can be themselves.
What will you get in return?
We are passionate about our employee health and wellbeing and providing work-life balance that suits you.
Our benefits include a discretionary bonus, 24/7 health support services (including a remote GP), income protection, health cash plan, 27 days annual leave, opportunity to participate in charitable events and more.
However you see your future career, we’ll support and challenge you to be your best with a wealth of learning and development opportunities.
If you need assistance and/or reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request to UKTalentDevelopment@Unum.co.uk
Company:
Unum UK

Location
Richmond upon Thames, London, TW9 4DU
About the job
Summary
In the Collections Expertise and Engagement (CEE) department, we are passionate about using our expert knowledge of our collections to inspire audiences in different ways and make them think differently about archives.

This is an exciting and challenging opportunity to put 18th century records at the heart of Archives for Everyone – our strategic vision setting ourselves the challenge of becoming the 21st Century national archive.

The focus of this role will be records of the long 18th century, with a particular emphasis on those relating to the transatlantic slave trade and the consequences of this for Britain and its colonies. Through deep engagement with these sources, you will develop innovative and interdisciplinary research in order promote understanding of and access to early modern records held by The National Archives. As part of the Early Modern records team, you will champion these records both internally and externally, and use them to surface diverse voices and histories from within the archive, for both academic and public audiences. This role will also form a vital link between the work of the Early Modern records team and that of the Legal and Modern records teams.

Your specialist work will include the development of and participation in external funding bids, academic engagement and collaborations, catalogue enhancement work, research and public engagement opportunities, as well as events and exhibition curation. You will be expected to engage with digital humanities research methods and developments in digital scholarship.

You will also work in our public advisory service, delivering advice on using records from our vast historical holdings onsite and online; you will share your knowledge and expertise internally and externally.

We particularly welcome applications from black and minority ethnic candidates.
Job description
A full job description is available to download at the bottom of this page under 'Attachments'.

Responsibilities
HOW TO APPLY:

To submit your application please click the 'Apply now' button on this page. You will be asked to provide a Statement of Suitability and to upload a CV. In your statement of suitability please explain how you meet each of the essential criteria below. You may draw on knowledge, skills, abilities, experience gained from paid work, domestic responsibilities, education, leisure interests and voluntary activities.

ESSENTIAL CRITERIA:

• A higher degree (or demonstrable equivalent experience) in a field relevant to the work of the Early Modern team at The National Archives.

• Demonstrable knowledge of the 18th century collections at The National Archives with requisite palaeography skills.

• Active research profile and demonstrable credibility in the academic and research sectors relating to early modern history.

• Experience of and demonstrable commitment to communicating research through a variety of public engagement activities such as exhibitions, public talks, outreach workshops and educational activities.

• Excellent interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills, and therefore able to interact well and build effective relationships and networks within organisation and externally.

• Ability to handle a varied and demanding workload, and to manage own priorities within a supportive team environment.

Overview

Core is a Microsoft Gold and fast track enabled partner that helps our clients improve the way they work through digital transformation. We put them back in control of their IT, and help them drive their business forward using IT.

Now in our 30th year, we are proud of our rich history of technical achievements, dating back to 2001, when we implemented the UK’s first Microsoft SharePoint system.

Role Summary

Manage, guide and develop the security needs of Cores Managed Service clients including maintenance of our internal security accreditations. Heavily focused on Microsoft Security products, the role includes zero-trust solution development, active monitoring and management, security incident handling, overall service improvement, growth planning for the security discipline and evolution of advanced capabilities using technologies such as machine learning.

Due to the clients we work with the successful candidate should be willing to undergo security vetting.

Objectives of the Roles

Provide a secure managed environment for Core and Cores customers
Provide pre-sale expertise around Security solutions.
Conduct client security assessments and workshops.
Develop High and Low Level Design documentation as follow up to the assessments
Hands-on participation in building secure client environments based on Microsoft E3 & E5 365 solutions including Azure Identity, Azure ATP, Azure Information Protection & Governance and Azure Sentinel

Duties and Responsibilities

Work closely with enterprise architects, other functional-area architects, engineering, and security specialists to ensure adequate security solutions and controls are in place throughout all IT systems and platforms to mitigate identified risks sufficiently, and to meet business objectives and regulatory requirements;
Assess and understand Core’s current security posture and future architecture, providing recommendations for improvement and risk reduction
Develop the business, information, and technical artefacts that constitute the enterprise information security architecture and solutions
Serve as a security expert in application development, database design, network and/or platform (operating system) efforts, helping project teams comply with enterprise and IT security policies, industry regulations, and best practices
Contribute to the alignment of security governance with ISO27001 and contribute to the development and maintenance of the information security strategy in accordance with the standard
Researches, designs, and advocates modern technologies, architectures, and security products that will support security requirements for the enterprise and its customers, business partners, and vendors
Analyses business impact and exposure, based on emerging security threats, vulnerabilities and risks
Communicates security risks and solutions to business partners and IT staff
Design security configuration guideline for information technology devices and systems, as well as mechanisms for assessing compliance with the guidelines
Design and build controls to address security risks and events as identified
Embrace a culture of continuous service improvement and service excellence
Stay up to date on security industry trends

Performance Criteria
A. The candidate as a senior member of the team will express role model behaviour exemplifying our CORE Values and should proactively look to assist and mentor cross-functional team members in achieving objectives to support Core’s development strategy.

B. Working with the development forum and through collaborate/technical adoption programmes you will provide insight into technical development and evolution of security related Microsoft technologies and how this can be translated into value-driven outcomes for clients and solutions. Specifically, this role will be cross-discipline, operating through all Microsoft offerings, from cradle to grave. You will be a confident speaker and able to articulate complex concepts to mixed audiences through the delivery of security workshops, presentations and similar customer-facing event activities.

C. Possess a comprehensive understanding, along with design and implementation proficiency of security artefacts within Microsoft cloud and on-premise related technologies. This would include Azure, Microsoft 365, Dynamics 365 and Azure DevOps.

D. Support the commercial teams through pre-sales engagements as the subject matter expert; working on creating tender responses, customer proposals including producing bill of materials, statement of works and HLD/LLD/DLD artefacts.

E. As a member of the professional services team, you will collaborate with peers and prospective clients on roadmap development, timely creation of workshop content materials, proof of concept deployments and pilot programmes for security related solutions ahead of full-scale deployments; in addition to supporting the delivery of client solution projects either individually or part of a wider team as needed.

F. Continual professional development is critical to this role and is supported by Core; as such you will be expected to acquire or upgrade Microsoft and industry certifications to current qualifications as required by Core or the applicable vendor/authority.

Skills/Experience

Required

5-10 years in the Information Security industry

Strong experience with security strategy, with a passion to make security realistic, achievable and interwoven with the business fabric

Strong experience with a broad range of Microsoft security technologies, including Defender, ATP, MCAS, DLP, EOP, NAC, IDS/ IPS, IDAM, PKI/Certificate Management, SIEM, Endpoint Protection & EDR, Anti-malware, vulnerability management;

Exposure to Microsoft 365 E3 & E5 security features such as;

Microsoft Intune
Azure Multi Factor Auth
Conditional Access Control
Self Service Password Reset configuration
Microsoft Cloud App Security
Azure ATP
Azure Sentinel
Azure Information Protection
Azure AD P1 & P2
E5 features
Advanced eDiscovery
Customer Lockbox
Advanced Data Governance
Service Encryption with Customer Key (BYOK/DKE)
Office 365 Privileged Access Management
PowerShell scripting skills

Strong oral, written, and presentation abilities -able to convey risk to all levels of the business, from C-level executives to operations and development teams
Strong experience in migrating enterprise companies from traditional data centre infrastructure, application and data designs to hybrid or fully-cloud enabled practices
Strong experience with cloud provider ecosystems, including Microsoft Office 365 E5 SKUs and Microsoft Azure.
Some experience with Unix/Linux and Windows system administration
Some experience with logging and alerting platforms, including SIEM integration
Some proven ability in security process and organizational design
Current understanding of Industry trends and emerging threats
Knowledge of incident response methodologies and technologies.
Well-rounded background in network, host, database, and application security;

Desirable

Formal training in and experience using an enterprise architecture and governance methodology (for example, the Zachman Framework, TOGAF, COBIT etc.);
Experience driving a culture of security awareness
Experience with the Data Protection Act 1998, GDPR and other regulatory frameworks.
Experience administering network devices, databases, and/or web application servers
Professional IT Accreditations in at least one of these (CISM, CSX-P, GISP, CCSA, CCSE, JNCIA, CCNA, CSSP, CISSP, CCIE Security).

Competencies and Behaviours
Customer orientated
Working within an international environment
Builds networks with customers, other team members and other relevant teams is essential
Keeps all relevant people appropriately informed
Very good communications, presentation and negotiations skills
Technically innovative
Able to express technical and non-technical concepts in clear verbal and written English
Very good written skills to document complex concepts in a comprehensive, yet readable manner
Considers a range of options that meet the needs of all stakeholders
Ability to use own initiative to solve technical problems
Delivery Focused
Takes responsibility for targets
Drive efficacy into all solutions delivered, demonstration clear and measurable results through the development of KPIs
Ambitious and competitive
Drive innovation and best practice
Strive for standardisation and simplification in all aspects of work
Always cost conscious balancing the needs of the business against the provision of the best solutions possible

Qualifications
The successful candidate will hold one or more of the following qualifications or be willing to complete an agreed subset as part of a managed probation process.

BSc 2:1 or better

We offer

Full-time position start as soon as possible. You will be based in our offices in Aldgate, London, however flexibility to work from home depending on requirements.
This role will involve occasional travel to customer sites for workshops.
Company pension scheme, Life assurance policy, Healthcare plan, interest free season ticket loan, cycle to work scheme and childcare vouchers.
Training courses, seminars and social events

Our Values and Culture

At Core we value curiosity, openness, collaboration, passion and action. We love to learn, share ideas and expertise across teams and make time for some fun.

Job Title: Snr IT Audit Manager Applications and Data
Job Description:
My client is a global fintech. They are currently recruiting for a Senior Audit Manager to oversee Application and Data audits from a Group perspective and working with the markets to provide specialist expertise.
The role will report to the Head of Audit for Applications and Data.
The role will assume oversight of Audit Managers within the team and of the IT Auditors aligned to the team.
Role purpose:
The role has considerable exposure and influence on decision makers in the organisation. Under the guidance of the Head of Audit, the role will help the Board and executive management to protect the assets, reputation and sustainability of my client by challenging the effectiveness of the framework of controls, which enable risk to be assessed and managed. You will be given the responsibility to make the team and Group audit better, by supporting the strategic direction of the team in terms of structure, balance of resource in terms of seniority and skills.
The ideal candidate will
Deliver audits in line with key milestones
Proactively identify and resolve blockers to prevent audit delays
Proactively address quality of working files to ensure that they meet with audit methodology standards
Proactively communicate emerging key issues with the Head of Audit to ensure alignment across all stakeholders
The Person:
Strong Audit experience including planning, business analysis, risk and control evaluation, testing and reporting (required).
Experience in auditing Data Risk, from implementing Data Strategies, through to operational data processes supporting customers, data risk management and data analytics (required)
Strong experience in Risk Management at 1st, 2nd or 3rd line of defence for Applications and Operational Resilience (required)
Experience in Risk Management at 1st, 2nd or 3rd line of defence for IT Infrastructure, Cloud Services, IT Governance, IT Service Management, Cybersecurity or Information Security (preferred)
Experience in audit firm or consulting firm in the financial services or technical insurance/asset management company or financial institution or regulation institution (preferred).
Experience of working within a regulatory environment (preferred).
Technical experience and background knowledge of life insurance (preferred).
Experience with leading complex projects/reviews, leading small-medium sized teams and negotiation situations (required).
Experience of managing senior level relationships and influencing their behaviour (required).
Professional Data Management qualification (CDMP or equivalent) or equivalent business experience (preferred).
Experience with Data Analytics (preferred).
Professional Technology Audit qualification (CISA, CISSP, CIA or equivalent) or equivalent business experience (preferred).
Experience with Technology Control frameworks (COBIT, NIST or equivalent) or equivalent experience (preferred)
Professional Technology qualification (ITIL or equivalent) or equivalent experience (preferred)
The Package
£75,000 - £90,000
Healthcare
Pension
Share options
Extensive benefits associated with a global fintech

We are MUFG. 360 years of heritage. A world-class set of businesses. And more than 180,000 employees in 50 markets. It’s no surprise that MUFG has grown to become one of the top five banks in the world. Our services include commercial banking, trust banking, securities, credit cards, consumer finance, asset management, and leasing. MUFG offers stability in an ever-changing market, providing services to high-profile clients worldwide.

Our vision? To become the world’s most trusted financial group. You’ll help us achieve it.

Overview of Department/Section

Currently there is an exciting opportunity for a hands-on experienced individual with detailed knowledge of the funcions associated with trade processing support. This role will support Fixed Income & Equity products traded in London with settlement in the APAC region.

Main Purpose of the role

Ensuring accurate and timely monitoring and settlement of all Fixed Income and Equity transactions in the Euroclear and the Domestic Market space. Products include, Corporates, Government Bonds, Repo, SBL, Cash Equity and Convertibles.



Key Responsibilities

In this role, you will be responsible for supporting the Settlement Pre-Matching across MUFG’s banking arm and securities business under a dual-hat arrangement. Under this arrangement, you will act and make decisions on behalf of both the bank and the securities business, subject to the same remit and level of authority, and irrespective of the entity which employs you. Others responsibilities include:
Resolving unmatched trades in Fixed Income and Equity products in the primary and secondary markets
The monitoring and resolution of unmatched trades related to bilateral Triparty Euroclear/Clearstream business.
Narration / investigation / resolution of cash and security breaks.
On-borarding of clients, understanding customer SSIs and required to ensure STP in the market.
Liaise with traders, legal and other support areas and counterparts.
Support the client business to process requests in a quick and efficient manner.
Minimisation of operational risk of the group, maintaining control over processes and challenging continuously.
Ensure desk procedures are kept up to date and improvements are made to improve efficiency.
Investigation and resolution of reconciliation breaks for all products supported by the Transaction Processing team covering all respective markets
Processing, Monitoring, reporting and resolution of all market borrow positions including any resulting mandatory recalls
Identification and process of pair off / partial opportunities with counterparties including the preparation of Payment/receipt instructions


Skills and Experience

5+ years financial markets experience predominantly based within top tier firms’ Fixed Income and Equity Settlements environments.
Detailed knowledge of the mechanics of Euroclear, Clearstream ,LCH and key global domestic markets is essential.
Understands the requirements linked to Triparty Repo/Security Lending.
Hi level of experience in the DTC markets
Hi Level of experience in Stock Borrow/lend business, predominantly in the US market
Understands the operational risk framework and is acutely aware of the Front Office environment at play and how the team’ function complements it.
Experience of Euclid and SWIFT, in addition Gloss and Intellimatch experience would be useful.
Product understanding of Repo, margin/collateral process, Asset Servicing, International Equities
Excel, Outlook, Word skills.


Personal Requirements

Excellent communication skills able to articulate the need for change verbally and in written form.
Team player, proactive and flexible
Attention to detail.
Excellent organisation skills and ability to prioritise.
Ability to work in a pressured environment and to meet strict deadlines.
Professional attitude.
Excellent team player.
Proactive and flexible.
Good communication skills.
Understanding and appreciation of client/trader focus.
Outgoing, energetic personality, able to command respect and inspire others to raise the bar and follow in their example

Commercial Procurement Specialist

Permanent position

Based in Central London

All Salaries Considered

Being the first commercial procurement contact, you will be key to ensuring that directorates are compliant to business governance process and policy and that the business is compliant with regulations and its statutory obligations whilst progressing at pace. Executive group and budget holders for sign-off on procurement activity
Third party vendors
Due to the volume of applications, we regret that we can only respond to those meeting our above requirements.

You will need to know your stuff when it comes to supporting and implementing Network and Security Solutions - this is a senior role hence the Specialist Title.

As our Checkpoint specialist the ideal candidate would possess or be working towards the following certs; Checkpoint CCSA/CCSE/CCSM (R80 preferred) and if youve got other skills like Aruba (Switching/Wireless), Juniper and Cisco (New Tech i.e. Firepower, ACI, or ISE etc), that would be really advantageous. You also need to be very competent with networking protocols such as BGP, OSPF, STP etc.

In fact, you know it so well that you can not only troubleshoot and implement, but you can design solutions to complex problems requirements.

You will be able to flex your technical muscles and show your flair and expertise with high-end Support and Projects. If you are bored and not being challenged where you are you will love this role. It is not easy, but you certainly will not be bored!

You will be working closely with customers and other groups/teams within Intercity to design, implement and support innovative technology solutions considering network and security elements.

Being techy is of course, incredibly important, but equally as desirable is your ability to communicate, empathize and successfully provide the highest level of support to your assigned customer.

Our strapline is People First technology and you will reflect that every day you are on the job. You will humanize tech and translate complicated concepts in a way your customer can easily digest.

You will be working with clients across the south of the country mainly so it is kind of important that you can drive and have access to a vehicle. As well as that, our Public Sector clients require a DBS check.

And what is in it for you I hear you say? Well, apart from challenging, exciting work, youll also get a great salary, death in service benefit (sorry to be morbid!), car allowance, pension, mobile phone, laptop, 23 days holiday (with an extra for your birthday and a day accrued for every years service up to five years… so 37 days including your bank holidays!). Salary is competitive.

Go on, give it a click, and apply and we can wing a job spec your way.

At Brown Brothers Harriman, we believe no job is too big or small for any of us to handle if it helps our clients. We value passionate, committed people who enjoy collaborating with others to find new solutions to complex business challenges. We are looking for the type of person who speaks their mind, truly listens and steps outside their role to add value wherever they can. Someone who is driven to get things done and views obstacles as an exciting challenge that demands a creative solution. Above all, we seek someone who takes great pride in their work and is inspired and motivated by their role in protecting and enhancing our client’s financial well-being.

The Sr. CA Product Development Specialist assists in the leadership of product development efforts across the Global foreign exchange business line. Full timeLondon

About Us

At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world's largest networks that powers trillions of requests per month. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare have all web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was recognized by the World Economic Forum as a Technology Pioneer and named to Entrepreneur Magazine's Top Company Cultures list.

We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!
About the department


Cloudflare's business requires a world class legal team to help the company deal with complex matters by anticipating complications and distractions, and guiding the company around those obstacles. We're looking for a new team member who can help foster our unique corporate philosophy and approach, in which the security and privacy of our customers are paramount. This role is ideal for someone who is a proactive self-starter and strategic thinker, who has a thirst for knowledge and continued growth, all while working as part of a great team.

What you'll do


We are looking for an exceptionally talented, energetic, and friendly trade compliance specialist to join our legal team based in Lisbon, Portugal, or London, UK. You will play a key role supporting the trade compliance team in ensuring that Cloudflare's transactions satisfy legal requirements to file complete and accurate export and import declarations with local customs and other government authorities for international shipments. This also includes developing processes, internal controls, and documentation in compliance with European Customs and other government agencies.

As part of the job, you will:
Develop, implement, and maintain corporate trade compliance procedures; driving company-wide compliance with global trade programs; and support various trade initiatives;
Interface with external vendors including customs brokers, importer/exporter of record, and other government agencies to ensure the smooth and compliant handling of all aspects of the company's shipments in the EMEA region;
Identify opportunities to streamline, harmonize and support roll-out of trade compliance best practices and implement them;
Support business development and other corporate projects such as Brexit and warehouse expansion, providing advice and solutions with respect to customs and indirect import taxes;
Proactively identify opportunities to reduce customs/import tax costs, mitigate risks and improve cash management strategies;
Act as the subject matter expert for the EMEA region on topics such as customs/import taxes to provide technical guidance and training to our team and others;
Monitor relevant trade compliance developments affecting the EMEA region and provide practical advice to the business;
Responsible for pre/post shipment audits of import filings including developing and managing critical KPIs to ensure the success of import/export compliance;
Assist in developing an appropriate audit plan regarding import controls and support internal and external audits and assessments;
Maintain and manage import and export books and records to ensure company compliance;
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as Data Center Operations, Hardware, Logistics, Finance, and Tax across multiple Cloudflare locations to resolve operational/transactional issues.
Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience
A degree in international business, or equivalent import/export compliance experience.
3+ years relevant experience working on EU and UK trade compliance and customs regulations.
Comprehensive knowledge of UK, EU, and US export controls and indirect taxes applicable to global supply chains.
Working knowledge of WTO, regional and local import tariff rules, classification practices, and sanctions.
Proven track record in leading and executing projects end-to-end.
Experience with trade compliance system automation projects.
Experience with analyzing and interpreting data, and driving process improvement.
Strong decision-making skills with exceptional organization and attention to detail.
Demonstrated ability to think strategically as well as working to support the business operationally.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Experience developing and presenting training to employees and managers a plus.
Embodies a high degree of integrity, confidentiality, and professionalism.
Detail oriented, well organized and technically-adept.
The ability to manage multiple matters / projects for multiple teams.
The ability to work in a team, with lawyers and non-lawyers, to establish effective solutions efficiently and in an amenable manner as well as independently.
Ability to draft documents, policies, messages and anything else in a very precise manner, while still being concise and digestible for the business.
An ambitious mindset that enables you to successfully work independently with little guidance, but also to use good judgment and call out issues when needed.
What Makes Cloudflare Special?

We're not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We're a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.

Project Galileo: We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare's enterprise customers--at no cost.

Athenian Project: We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.

Path Forward Partnership: Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.

1.1.1.1: We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here's the deal - we don't store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy policy and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.

Sound like something you'd like to be a part of? We'd love to hear from you!

Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.

Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at hr@cloudflare.com or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.

Job Title: Core Engineer – Digital API API Security/Microservices
Job Description:
Core Engineer – Digital API security – API Security/Microservices – SSDLC/Kubernetes/JAVA/Kotlin/Scala

Next Ventures seeks an experienced Core Engineer to join its London based team on a long term contract.

Introduction
Do you have a passion for security? Do you understand different approaches to securing microservices? The Digital Services team want you; we are looking for an experienced Senior Developer to help implement a new authorization framework within the bank.

The Digital Services Core Engineering team provides products and services that strive to improve the efficiency of HSBC and drive the ongoing Digital Transformation agenda. Our goal is to help HSBC teams deliver cost-effective journeys securely.
As Core Engineers, we help define and demonstrate engineering best practices.
Our attention to detail needs to be excellent as should our ability to assess ‘the bigger picture’.

Responsibilities
Understanding and implementing all aspects of SSDLC.
Contributing to authorisation discussions based on experience.
Reviewing solutions for alignment with Digital Services goals and objectives
Remaining cognizant of contemporary architectural and engineering approaches
Advocating for and meeting high professional standards of development
Approaching technical challenges with an open and collaborative mindset
Supporting initiatives to improve client developer experiences and their efficiency
Liaising with other lines of business and mainframe to deliver on common priorities
Being responsible for the lifecycle of work on our Simplification Initiatives programme
Developing solutions to facilitate the migration of our API estate to global Kubernetes strategic cloud platforms

Ideal / Desired Skillset
Good written and oral communications skills are essential
Proven ability to guide and mentor all members of a team
Must be able to apply SOLID and other architectural principles to designs and code
Must be able to articulate a clear understanding of event-driven architecture patterns
Experience implementing event-based solutions is desirable
A strong grasp of functional, non-blocking, asynchronous code or coroutines
Proficiency with one or more object-oriented languages – must have Java
Demonstrably polyglot; bonus if this is in JVM languages such as Kotlin or Scala
Experience securing APIs at scale would be beneficial
Experience using more than one approach to API security
Deep knowledge of distributed service-oriented architecture, relational databases, micro-services
Experience building high performance, highly available and scalable systems
Experience building complex software systems that have been successfully adopted by customers over extended time periods
Ability to deliver short term results while investing in long term strategic solutions
Ability to work at all levels of abstraction, from high level architecture, to design, down to low level details in specialist subject area(s).

Job Title: Consultant, Back End Developer (Deloitte Digital), Defence and Security, Consulting, C&M, London
Job Description:
Your opportunity
We love to code, and especially to create, so we’re hoping you’re going to join us and do just that. You will be the sort of person that knows that Agile and DevOps are engineering cultures, not methodologies and tasks for build engineers.
For us, developers are not people who are just fed specifications and sit quietly churning out code. As a senior member of our team, we need you to lead, guide, plan, explain, working alongside clients and other agency disciplines, cracking problems with a mix of technical expertise and innovative thinking. It's how we outclass the competition and create the best digital experiences.
We are proud of the impact we have with our Defence and Security clients, the strength of our relationships, and the depth and breadth of our skills that we bring to help them achieve their mission – we are privileged to be asked to work with them at the heart of their biggest and most ambitious technology programmes.

Our Defence and Security customers care deeply about thoughtfully constructed and secure systems that are designed to be fit for purpose. Working with our design and development experts you will find that good software engineering is at the heart of what we do. As part of our team you’ll be responsible for developing cutting-edge digital solutions. You'll work with some of the best developers, UX designers and strategists in the business, using digital to shape the future of how we live, work and play.

Deloitte Digital, Consulting
Part Business. Part Creative. Part Technology. One hundred per cent digital.

We’re a new type of creative digital consultancy that fuses strategy, tech and design to identify where businesses need to be, then get them there. Fast.
Through our studios spread across the globe, we help our clients imagine, deliver and run the future, through from customer research right through to implementation. And we love doing it.
As part of our team, you’ll work side by side with strategists, designers, researchers, engineers, writers, architects and product specialists – using your unique skills and perspective to help drive transformation from operational level to the C-suite, across a complete range of digital channels.
We believe in our people, which means giving them the support they need to get the best balance of work and life. Individuality, flexibility, diversity are things we’re passionate about. We wouldn’t be Deloitte Digital without it.
As part of our Consulting practice, your career with Deloitte Digital can take multiple paths. We will work closely with you on a career plan that fits your skills, talents and aspirations, and provide an open environment to discuss your development and progression with Deloitte.

Your Role
Work with outstanding talent across back and front-end developers, creatives and UX experts, integration teams and the client themselves. Help deliver features end to end. We don't throw our work "over the wall," everyone is expected to pull together to design new features and figure out bugs.Deliver cloud native and containerised applications using technologies including AWS Lambda, Spring Boot, NodeJS, PostgreSQL, MongoDB and ELK.Build solutions as part of a DevOps and Agile ecosystem supported by tooling including Atlassian, Jenkins, OWASP and AWS componentry.Ensure your solution works in a reliable and resilient way across thousands of users and multiple sites, and use Site Reliability Engineering methods to keep the solution working whatever is thrown at it.Help the client and end users to understand trade-offs when making product decisions, and explain why you would do things a certain way.Keep learning! We have a great community of architects and back-end developers who run workshops together, share the best articles they find on Slack, and contribute to the engineering culture.Going beyond standard duties and responsibilities to champion small details, spot opportunities and add extra value for our clients.Your work, your choice
At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk. We carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. Please speak to your recruiter about the working pattern that works best for you.

Location
Based in our airy and bustling offices in Clerkenwell, London, with its legendary coffee machine and model train track, you’ll also have a chance to work with clients throughout Europe and beyond.

Your professional experience
Overall, you’re an ideas person and problem solver as well as a hands-on doer – that’s important. And you know it takes a mix of people to do amazing work, so you love collaborating with and learning from people with different skills, backgrounds and perspectives. If you have an interesting or unusual mix of skills yourself, even better.
We’re expanding fast, so we’re looking for people who are, by which we mean natural initiative-takers who bring out the best in others, are brilliant listeners and can grow our business without compromising standards, integrity or culture.
A graduate degree (First or Second class) is a must and is most likely Computer Science or another STEM subject, along with British Citizenship and the right to live and work in the UK.

You’ll also have
Experience in software development and an evident passion for writing code.A clear understanding of the fundamentals of software development in Java, TypeScript, JavaScript and/or Python, along with good overall engineering patterns and practices. Be able to explain these clearly.Demonstrable experience and understanding of working in teams, particularly in agile methodologies such as Scrum & Kanban.About Deloitte
Our Purpose & Strategy
To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society - defines who we are and what we stand for. Our purpose provides the foundation for our strategy and our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services: this is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.
How will this role make an impact that matters with Deloitte?
Forecast and change the landscape of cyberspace, support clients to survive and prosper in this disruptive and ever increasingly digital age, while you support talented and more junior colleagues and impact the communities you operate within.

What do we do?
Deloitte offers Global integrated professional services that include Audit & Assurance, Risk Advisory, Tax, Consulting and Financial Advisory. Our approach combines intellectual leadership, industrial expertise, insight, consulting & problem-solving capabilities, technology revolutions and innovation from multiple disciplines to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.

What do we value?
At Deloitte we foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service. We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture, and we support agile working arrangements. Hear from some of our people already working at Deloitte in agile ways. We are proud to have received a Best for All Stages of Motherhood special award in 2016 as a Top Employer for Working Families

Deloitte LLP is a limited liability partnership registered in England and Wales with registered number OC303675 and its registered office at 1 New Street Square, London EC4A 3HQ, United Kingdom.Deloitte LLP is the United Kingdom affiliate of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee ("DTTL"). DTTL and each of its member firms are legally separate and independent entities. DTTL and Deloitte NSE LLP do not provide services to clients. Please see www.deloitte.com/about to learn more about our global network of member firms.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is currently seeking a Manager for a Team of Database Specialist Architects in EMEA, carrying out activities and supporting teams across all markets in the region.

In this role, you need to be technically capable and credible in your own right, as well as useful in shaping the customer and solutions-focused skills of your team. You must enjoy learning and introducing new technology to help colleagues and customers embrace and adopt new technology. Furthermore, establishing thought leadership by looking beyond the technology, considering the value technology creates for our customers, and helping to change technology perspectives is an essential aspect of the role. You will help team members ramp-up on AWS as well as develop speaking, writing, presentation, and executive interaction skills. You need to be adept at interacting, communicating and partnering with other departments within AWS such as our services teams, business development, marketing, and professional services, as well as representing your team to executive management.

You will also enjoy developing technical talent to achieve great things. You have a passion for educating, training and enabling Non-relational database experts for a diverse and challenging set of commercial customers. Ideally you would also have an understanding of non-relational databases, including Redis, Blockchain, and Ledger Database.

The ideal candidate has experience working as a Solutions Architect or similar role and leading a team of a Solutions Architects. You enjoy keeping your existing technical skills honed and developing new ones so that you can make substantial contributions to in-depth architecture discussions.

Roles and Responsibilities:

· Engage with customers and critical AWS business partners such as sales, business development, services teams, professional services, partners, and support.
· Hire, onboard, train, and develop new database Specialist Solutions Architects from internal and external sources
· Educate commercial customers on the value proposition of AWS, and participate in architectural discussions to design purpose-built database solutions for successful deployment in the cloud
· Build and coach the team on the skills needed to conduct one-to-few and one-to-many training sessions so they can transfer deep technical skills to customers who are considering or using AWS
· Capture, share and scale best-practice knowledge amongst customers, and the AWS solutions architect community
· Build deep relationships with decision makers within customer accounts to enable them to be "Cloud advocates."
· Act as a conduit and liaison between customers and service engineering teams and shape service offerings.


This is an EMEA-Wide role, therefore we can hire in any of our major EMEA Hubs including; the Nordics, Benelux, France, DACH and Iberia.



Basic Qualifications

· Proven design and implementation experience with Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle Database, MySQL and IBM DB2
· Experience in design/implementation/consulting experience of distributed applications
· Demonstrated experienced in sales, technical pre-sales, product development, or customer facing resources
· Knowledge of the underlying infrastructure requirements such as Networking, Storage, and Hardware Optimization.
· Business fluent English is required for customer interactions, internal communication, and collaboration with the worldwide teams.

Preferred Qualifications

· · Academic background Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent professional experience
· NoSQL technologies such as MongoDB, Cassandra, Hadoop (HBase, Redis) and on different stages of the lifecycle (Data model design, Query Tuning and Optimization, operational management and troubleshooting)
· · Experience communicating and working with Developers, IT, Chief Data/Technology/Product Officers to articulate database strategies and plans.
· · Experience of data migration techniques and process planning including transaction processing, security, logging and monitoring. Experience of advanced deployment architectures such as availability, resiliency and fault tolerance.
· · Deep understanding of AWS services related to databases highly desirable, particularly Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon DocumentDB, Amazon Elasticsearch, Amazon Aurora, AWS Lambda, Amazon EC2 Container Service.
· · Demonstrated effectiveness working across multiple business units to achieve results
· · Experience managing technical teams

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employee Minority/Female/Disability/Vet

Description
We have an opportunity for a Systems Support Specialist to join our IT team in Redhill. At AXA Partners UK the primarily job purpose for this role is to act as a point of incident & request resolution for the System and Maintenance, IT Security, Solutions and the Service Desk teams. Using your expert and gained IT Industry experience to resolve difficult problems. Assisting other members of the Support team as required, ensuring a coherent and standard approach is maintained to supporting the infrastructure. Ensuring documentation for systems and services are maintained in line with platform updates and group compliance and security standards. Adherence and adoption of the documented maintenance procedures. Complete platform upgrades following the infrastructure upgrade schedule. Assist with documentation handover to the service desk and solutions teams.
The role and team provide IT as a shared service to AXA Travel Insurance as well as AXA Assistance UK. The two companies provide a range of Medical, Vehicle, Property, Lifestyle and Health Assistance as well as Travel Claims services to corporate clients and their employees and/or policyholders and members. This business is currently provided from a main site in Redhill and a near shore call centre in Athlone in Southern Ireland.
Various systems are in use by different parts of the business in the UK and Ireland and this needs to be maintained for use 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. Increasingly, these systems are AXA Assistance Group systems which are accessed remotely.
The server room hosts around 100 live servers, which are mainly in a virtualised environment. An Avaya CM6 telephone switch is used to manage the calls. Remote access is provided through MPLS links using Citrix and via VPN connections over the Internet. Security and compliance issues are critical.
Maintain all company IT Systems, including problem resolution, incident management and implementing new solutions.
Provide a supporting role to the other IT System and Maintenance, IT Service Desk, IT Solutions, IT Security and IT Development teams.
Reporting to the IT Systems Support Manager.
Qualifications
Perform upgrades to key infrastructure platforms on a regular basis in line with maintenance schedule
Incident resolution associated with any maintenance activity
Ensure communications are sent to the business regarding all scheduled maintenance
Follow change management process required for all scheduled maintenance

Job Title: Privacy and Data Protection Specialist – London, Warsaw, Amsterdam
Job Description:
The Privacy and Data Protection Specialist will provide support to the Global Data Privacy Team.
Responsibilities
Handling and supporting privacy matters under supervision;
Supporting the Firm's General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) Programme and the various work streams as required;
Monitoring, advising, drafting and negotiating data protection agreements/clauses including revision for GDPR, transfer mechanisms/Schrems II, and Brexit;.
Assisting with DPIAs Privacy Impact Assessments and providing support to cross-functional teams on privacy compliance activities in all regions.
Drafting and advising on complex data protection-related documentation such as data privacy policies and assisting in drafting of other DP related internal policies, procedures and manuals and their implementation;
Ensuring appropriate records are maintained across privacy processes.
Support the DP related 3rd party vendor management process, including maintenance of database, contact with vendors and internal business owners, contract reviews, vendor questionnaires and risk assessments;
Providing support with the management and reporting of data breach notifications, including prepare security incident/data breach investigation reports: collect relevant information from individual reporting the breach, involve relevant stakeholders and manage internal breach log;
Responding to queries from individuals, including assisting with the searches and collation of data, the review and preparation of responses to DSARs, and other DP related requests from individuals when needed, database management
Assist with responding to requests coming into privacy team – log and manage query list;
Draft answers to requests and panels queries/questionnaires;
Manage team's database(s) (Dentons Direct, Microsoft Teams)
Prepare monthly team stats and updates (i.e. queries handled per region, number of breaches, DSARs, etc.);
Training/onboarding of new joiners to the team on systems and tasks, specially from database management side and when I was away;
OneTrust (OT): implementation, ongoing management and reporting including definition and review of processes surrounding the use of OT, creation of user guidelines to facilitate understanding of OneTrust and its usage etc;
Database(s) quality control - audit and identification of gaps, errors or other discrepancies with e.g. vendor names, documents and/or agreements which need to be corrected;
Interim point of contact for OT users – giving access, adding vendors training the team on how to use OT;
Operational management of the global Data Subjects' Rights log (Access Requests, Deletion, Rectification, etc.). This would involve working with stakeholders in different regions and leveraging resources across the company.
The role will involve suggesting or devising ways to improve and streamline the team's processes, adapting to regulatory, operational and/or institutional changes as needed.
Carrying out legal Data Privacy research
Assisting with preparations for training on data privacy
Experience/Skills/Knowledge
Knowledge and understanding of data protection compliance that can be evidenced through work experience in a similar environment.
Strong knowledge of the GDPR and other data protection laws and regulations, practices and legislation – knowledge of global privacy laws and regulations or exposure to them preferable.
Proven involvement/experience in the provision of data protection advice, guidance and data protection compliance processes.
Detailed understanding of the rights of data subjects under privacy legislation (particularly GDPR).
Relevant data protection certifications, e.g. CIPP/E, specialist accredited qualifications such as GDPR, DPA 2018 or IAPP qualifications preferable.
Ability to find practical, pragmatic and creative solutions to data privacy issues.
Good working knowledge of privacy compliance tools (e.g. OneTrust) preferable.
Good working knowledge and understanding of programme/project risk management preferable.
Possesses the confidence to deal effectively with professionals across the firm
Strong influencing, negotiating, planning, organizing and analysis skills
Experience in corporate or legal environment an advantage
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal
Able to prioritize and multi-task particularly when working under pressure and to tight deadlines
Able to interact positively at all levels and a good team player
Methodical approach to work with a strong focus on accuracy
Hardworking and enthusiastic approach to work; professional in outlook, attitude and appearance
Self-motivated
Exceptional proof-reader

KPMG Cyber

KPMG has been acknowledged by Forrester as a leader in the provision of cyber security consultancy. We are investing to building out our financial services cyber consulting team to meet a growing demand and provide a comprehensive range of services to many of the largest financial services companies in the world.

We help out clients protect, detect and respond to high end cyber threats; helping them understand the cyber threat landscape, make sensible decisions on investment priorities, and build out the specialist capabilities they need to counter financial crime and other threats.

We believe that cyber security is about helping our clients to harness business opportunities safely and securely. For us, cyber security isn’t just a technical issue, it is one which engages the whole business and focusses on a holistic approach to understanding and mitigating the risk.

Our team works closely with KPMG’s broader advisory practice to link cyber security to financial crime/fraud and risk management, operational resilience and IT transformation.

The Role

You will be an Assistant Manager within the Security Transformation team of the Financial Services Cyber practice, using security architecture in defining security transformation and helping deliver high quality advice to clients.

You should expect to be involved in a wide range of challenging engagements helping our clients to understand how to harness digital opportunities in a safe and secure manner. You will be part of a team advising clients on managing security risks in cloud environments; assessing and advising on security architectures; delivering automation of security controls and cyber risk reporting; implementing and integrating technical security into digital customer journeys.

Our clients are under regulatory scrutiny, but are also continually battling to match a rapidly changing cyber threat landscape while harnessing the opportunities offered by digital services. As an Assistant Manager in our team, we expect you to already have an initial understanding of the world of our clients, the complexities of modern technologies and the challenges these present.

If you are able to help our clients seize the opportunity offered by the digital world, and do so in a secure way, then you are the type of person we are looking for.

Responsibilities

Delivery of client engagements in a way that ensures quality and value to our clients by:
• Understanding their business challenges and the threats they face
• Advising on digital and technical aspects of cyber security in cloud as well as traditional hosting environments
• Helping them optimise their approach to digital and technical cyber security controls and risk management
• Using security architecture in defining security transformation
• Linking cyber security to other consultancy offerings on risk management, resilience and IT transformation to provide holistic support to our clients
• Delivering small-/medium-sized engagements as part of a team
• Developing an understanding of KPMG’s broader offerings to enable identification of business opportunities
• Supporting the team with presales and business development activities
• Building and maintaining your technical security skillset
• Upholding KPMG’s values by acting with integrity

The Person

• Proven knowledge and experience in one or more of the following areas: security architecture (infrastructure or application architecture), cloud security (security controls, assessments, privacy and regulatory risks, security frameworks), Security Operations, Infrastructure Security, Application Security, DevSecOps (essential)
• Proven experience of delivering security in one or more of the following cloud service provider environments: Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud Platform (GCP) (essential)
• Experience in defining and/or implementing security controls across multiple layers of the IT architecture stack
• Proven experience of successfully delivering high quality cyber security services in a commercial environment
• Proven ability to analyse problems
• Proven ability to work as part of a team

Qualifications and Skills:
• Degree level qualified
• Cloud certifications
• Recognised cyber security qualifications (e.g. CISSP, CISM, M. Inst IISP, etc.), or comparable experience (desirable)
• Recognised architecture qualifications (e.g. SABSA, TOGAF, etc.) (desirable)
• Excellent communication skills (both written and oral)
• Ability to work as part of a team

£75,000 - £85,000 basic + Management Position + opportunity to build team - London based.
Unique opportunity sought by Cyber Security firm based out of London Central (SE), this organisation is seeking to build upon their nationwide business presence with an incredibly bespoke business model, delivering their services into those operating within their market.
You will be joining a team of professionals and specialists that live and breathe Cyber Risk, including yet not refined to; Risk Management, Security Testing and GRC. This Cyber organisation pride themselves upon problem solving, taking the given client's problem, and making it their own until a solution is provided, highlighting the importance of a strong customer service ethic. There is huge scope when becoming the Senior Security Testing Lead to not only build and manage a team but also think innovatively, facilitate and embrace change and utilise their own vision and instil this into this security risk management organisation.
The role will consist of performing and supporting the core components of the organisation's security testing services. As such, your primary function is to provide security testing, research, analysis, findings documentation, presentation, and remediation support to assist the list of customers and clients the business works with. You will be based out of the London office with the occasional visits to customer UK locations.
Responsibilities and Required Skills
Manage security testing team whilst regularly perform web application, infrastructure, IoT, cloud, API, wireless and mobile application penetration tests.
Perform Red Team and social engineering testing as required
Report writing and client presentation of test findings
Client consulting on required remedial actions
Assisting with the development of junior members of the team.
Contribute to the evolution of the penetration testing methodology and processes.
Ability to perform black box, grey box, and white box tests dependent on client needs. Ability to translate technical detail into language board level executives can understand.
Ability to write deliverables to a high standard
Experience with Attack and Threat Modelling
Red Team testing and Social engineering attack methodologies
Extensive knowledge of the OWASP Testing Methodology
Knowledge of networking protocols and the OSI Model
Extensive experience using Nmap, Burpsuite, Nessus, Qualys, Metasploit, Kali etc.
Education, Training and Experience
Up to 10 years testing experience and two of the following professional qualifications; CREST , Tiger, OSCP, CEH, OSCE , CRT or equivalent , CCT or equivalent,
Senior Security Testing Leader - (Cyber Security/ Penetration Testing / IT)

IT Security Operations Analyst | circa £45,000 | Nr Guildford

Jonothan Bosworth Recruitment Specialists are currently seeking an IT Security Operations Analyst for what is a key client; a managed cloud, infrastructure and IT consultancy provider based in Surrey.

The ideal candidate will maintain the confidentiality, integrity and availability our clients’ information; primarily achieved through the identification and response to security events.

This is a fantastic job opportunity whereby you will be reporting to the IT Security Operations Manager, and there is plenty of scope for growth and further development.

THE BASICS:

Operations Analysts who can manage security operational tasks to retain our clients’ technical security, including the identification and management of external threats – as well as identify, validate and respond to security events, service requests and incidents logged in the Service Desk will be of interest.

As the lead advocate for IT Security, tasked with improving the security and performance of infrastructure / services, drafting and managing processes and procedures, you will create and operate vulnerability scans on internal and external environments. If you can devise, manage, and be responsible for the remediation of vulnerabilities identified we’d like to hear from you.

Analysts who can deliver to client expectations and ensure risks are managed whilst providing root cause and forensic analysis of security breaches in a confidential manner, will be sought after.

THE PRE-REQUESITES:

Analysts with an ability to investigate, troubleshoot and resolve security events, coupled with a good level of knowledge in IT and networking fundamentals, (for example; Operating Systems, Directory services, TCP/IP, DNS, HTTP(S) & SMTP) will be sought after.

An ability to combat network attacks; phishing, port scanning, web application attacks, DDoS & lateral movement is vital, as too is experience of working in an operational IT Services environment. Knowledge of Windows and/or Linux operating systems, and how to investigate them for signs of compromise and a foundational understanding for Cloud architecture and how an attacker can utilise these platforms is important.

If you have experience in operating and administering various security tools such as vulnerability scanners (Nessus / Tenable), SIEM Tools (Sourcefire / SolarWinds) and logging / auditing tools (SCCM / SecureWorks) we’d like to hear from you TODAY.

Other essential attributes include: a hands-on, pro-active approach and a high level of enthusiasm and attention to detail with strong analytical and interpretation and problem-solving skills.

THE CONCLUSION:

This a great job opportunity for someone with the ability to generate reports and present key security metrics and recommend operational improvements.

If you have knowledge of Government Security frameworks (PSN, DSP Toolkit, G-Cloud) and of Public / Private Cloud Services (such as: Azure/AWS) and can pass a basic security screening to Baseline Personnel Security Standard check, then please apply today.

Strong interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills and an avid interest in IT Security is vital, and any Information Security qualification such as SSCP, CISSP, CISM will be highly desirable but not a necessity.

Your typical week will consist of 37.5 hours, Monday to Friday, worked during the core hours of 08.00 : 18.00. 7.5 hours per day with one hour for lunch.

Please contact Jonothan Bosworth Recruitment Specialists for more information.

Overview

Core is a Microsoft Gold and fast track enabled partner that helps our clients improve the way they work through digital transformation. We put them back in control of their IT, and help them drive their business forward using IT.

Now in our 30th year, we are proud of our rich history of technical achievements, dating back to 2001, when we implemented the UK’s first Microsoft SharePoint system.

Role Summary

Manage, guide and develop the security needs of Cores Managed Service clients including maintenance of our internal security accreditations. Heavily focused on Microsoft Security products, the role includes zero-trust solution development, active monitoring and management, security incident handling, overall service improvement, growth planning for the security discipline and evolution of advanced capabilities using technologies such as machine learning.

Due to the clients we work with the successful candidate should be willing to undergo security vetting.

Objectives of the Roles
Provide a secure managed environment for Core and Cores customers
Provide pre-sale expertise around Security solutions.
Conduct client security assessments and workshops.
Develop High and Low Level Design documentation as follow up to the assessments
Hands-on participation in building secure client environments based on Microsoft E3 & E5 365 solutions including Azure Identity, Azure ATP, Azure Information Protection & Governance and Azure Sentinel
Duties and Responsibilities
Work closely with enterprise architects, other functional-area architects, engineering, and security specialists to ensure adequate security solutions and controls are in place throughout all IT systems and platforms to mitigate identified risks sufficiently, and to meet business objectives and regulatory requirements;
Assess and understand Core’s current security posture and future architecture, providing recommendations for improvement and risk reduction
Develop the business, information, and technical artefacts that constitute the enterprise information security architecture and solutions
Serve as a security expert in application development, database design, network and/or platform (operating system) efforts, helping project teams comply with enterprise and IT security policies, industry regulations, and best practices
Contribute to the alignment of security governance with ISO27001 and contribute to the development and maintenance of the information security strategy in accordance with the standard
Researches, designs, and advocates modern technologies, architectures, and security products that will support security requirements for the enterprise and its customers, business partners, and vendors
Analyses business impact and exposure, based on emerging security threats, vulnerabilities and risks
Communicates security risks and solutions to business partners and IT staff
Design security configuration guideline for information technology devices and systems, as well as mechanisms for assessing compliance with the guidelines
Design and build controls to address security risks and events as identified
Embrace a culture of continuous service improvement and service excellence
Stay up to date on security industry trends
Performance Criteria

A. The candidate as a senior member of the team will express role model behaviour exemplifying our CORE Values and should proactively look to assist and mentor cross-functional team members in achieving objectives to support Core’s development strategy.

B. Working with the development forum and through collaborate/technical adoption programmes you will provide insight into technical development and evolution of security related Microsoft technologies and how this can be translated into value-driven outcomes for clients and solutions. Specifically, this role will be cross-discipline, operating through all Microsoft offerings, from cradle to grave. You will be a confident speaker and able to articulate complex concepts to mixed audiences through the delivery of security workshops, presentations and similar customer-facing event activities.

C. Possess a comprehensive understanding, along with design and implementation proficiency of security artefacts within Microsoft cloud and on-premise related technologies. This would include Azure, Microsoft 365, Dynamics 365 and Azure DevOps.

D. Support the commercial teams through pre-sales engagements as the subject matter expert; working on creating tender responses, customer proposals including producing bill of materials, statement of works and HLD/LLD/DLD artefacts.

E. As a member of the professional services team, you will collaborate with peers and prospective clients on roadmap development, timely creation of workshop content materials, proof of concept deployments and pilot programmes for security related solutions ahead of full-scale deployments; in addition to supporting the delivery of client solution projects either individually or part of a wider team as needed.

F. Continual professional development is critical to this role and is supported by Core; as such you will be expected to acquire or upgrade Microsoft and industry certifications to current qualifications as required by Core or the applicable vendor/authority.
