Operational – Website/web services as well as traditional IT networking, operations, management, and security experience.
Knowledge of the underlying infrastructure requirements such as Networking, Storage, and Hardware Optimization.
Business fluent English is required for customer interactions, internal communication, and collaboration with the worldwide teams.

Are you passionate about building applications with NoSQL databases? Do you enjoy helping customers select and use the right data technology for their application requirements? Do you want to be part of a team who helps build the future of databases at Amazon Web Services (AWS)? Come join us!

We are looking for Database Specialist Solution Architects (SA) with a balance of great communication skills with deep technical expertise giving them the ability to impress AWS customers at any level, from executive to developer. You will be hands-on collaborating with our customers and partners in building and migrating their Database platforms and applications to the cloud.

You will work with some of the largest enterprises, to help them architect scalable NoSQL solutions, dive deep into customer problems and work with AWS service teams to create solutions that solve customer needs.

If you are someone who enjoys innovating, likes solving problems and working on the cutting edge of technology, we would love to have you on the team.

Roles and Responsibilities

Be the recognized authority and subject matter expert for Amazon NoSQL databases across AWS.
Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help customers learn about and use Amazon NoSQL databases.
Develop empathetic relationships that allows you to understand and articulate customer needs and opportunities and provide definitive guidance for customers in choosing the right database services and approaches.
Be a trusted advisor, representing the voice of the customer to internal teams, proactively defining and prioritizing service features and successful outcomes for our customers.
Enable and nurture AWS field teams, internal community, share best practices and insights with customers and partners.
Thought leaders - produce compelling audience-specific messages and tools, reference architectures, demos, public speaking, blogs, and other artifacts.

One or more of the following qualifications are desired but not required:

Academic background Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent professional experience.
Experience communicating effectively across internal and external organizations, for complex mission-critical solutions
Experience of data migration techniques and process planning including transaction processing, security, logging and monitoring. Experience of advanced deployment architectures such as availability, resiliency and fault tolerance.
Deep understanding of AWS services related to databases highly desirable, particularly Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon DocumentDB, Amazon Elasticsearch, Amazon Aurora, AWS Lambda, Amazon EC2 Container Service.
Familiarity with modern programming languages (Python, JavaScript, Go, .Net, Java, Clojure, Node.js).

Location
Blackpool, Leeds, London, Manchester, Newcastle-upon-Tyne, Sheffield
About the job
Summary
The Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) is responsible for welfare, pensions and child maintenance policy. As the UK’s biggest public service department, we operate on a scale that is almost unmatched anywhere in Europe and most people in Britain come into contact with us at some point in their lives.

DWP Estates Directorate are accountable for the delivery of all aspects of real estate services and the work we do is critical in ensuring the vital work that the Department undertakes is enabled effectively. The DWP commercial estate is the largest within Government and our diverse national property portfolio reflects this scale. It is a unique mix ranging from modern corporate centres, multi-occupied Service Centres, to its frontline high street services.

We are responsible for the Department’s 800+ workplaces, that provide workplaces for 85,000 employees and a UK wide presence for all those that visit us. Ultimately, the Department relies on us to provide safe and secure buildings that are fit for purpose and meet the needs of the business. The work you will be undertaking is therefore crucial in us meeting the needs of all those who use our services.

This role supports the Compliance Manager in the development and approval of the DWP Estates Directorate physical security requirements and policies. The role will own the overall estates business requirements for Physical Security. The role will be the DWP estates policy lead for Physical Security policies and processes including ensuring implementation through suppliers of new, approved Business Continuity and Security process and policies across the DWP Estate. It will enforce regulations in all aspects across the business as well as provide guidance on compliance matters, preserving the Authorities integrity by making sure it stays on a lawful and ethical course
Job description
• Develop, implement and maintain the DWP Estates business requirements for physical security, collaborating with Operations and Security and Resilience stakeholders to ensure delivery of professional excellence.
• Identify DWP requirements for specialist security technical input, in particular physical security system advice required from the Security Technical Advisor e.g. supporting with the Security Transformation Programme.
• Working in partnership with DWP Security to coordinate the Estates involvement in the National Security Review, reviewing the relevant security within buildings, both in terms of physical security and the security of data where appropriate and in relation to DWP.
• Ownership and approval of Estates Security policy and procedures, understanding own level of responsibility and empower others to make decisions where appropriate.
• Work in partnership with colleagues across Policy and Compliance, in particular the Risk Manager, to inform and mitigate risk or security issues on a proactive basis, collaborating to share information, resources and support.
• Foster a culture of One Team across the supplier network, working in partnership in particular with the Integrator, to ensure a collaborative and effective environment.
• Contribute to projects as required and necessary, engaging early to assess and understand risks and where resolution responsibility lies; coordinate with the supplier partners and wider Estates team to ensure the appropriate response.
• Represent DWP Estates on required projects relating to security.
• Evaluate the efficiency of controls and improve them continuously, encouraging ideas for change from a wide range of sources whilst taking managed risks by fully considering the varied impacts changes could have on the diverse range of end users.
• Implement all Business Continuity and Security process and policies across the DWP Estate, communicating with clear purpose and respectfully, taking into consideration the diversity of interests.
• Engage with the Departmental Security Office to coordinate national threat levels, and encourage joined up team work with the wider Estates function and supplier partners on evaluating an appropriate response.
• Manage the communication cascade chain of an event to ensure immediate threat escalation, whether national or localised threat, sharing information as appropriate to maximise understanding and impact.
• Work closely with Operational Excellence to ensure the Business Operating System is appropriate, updated and meets the needs for Security Policy and Compliance Management.

Responsibilities
Essential Skills, Knowledge & Experience

• Demonstrable knowledge and experience of Real Estate & FM Industry standards, policies and regulation
• Proven experience in a similar business relations and Compliance role, in particular the area of security business requirements, Business Continuity and Security policies and procedures
• Proven security or risk event management in the cascade and coordination across a large portfolio
• Proven track record of formulating and implementing security and compliance management strategies and operating practices
• Works effectively and in partnership with supplier partners and subject matter experts to ensure best and appropriate course of action
• Experience of working with key stakeholders and customers
• Methodical and diligent with outstanding planning abilities
• An analytical mind with the ability to take a broad overview of the complexities and procedures and regulations

Leadership attributes and behaviours

• Show a positive approach to keeping the whole team’s efforts focussed whilst aligning activities to contribute to wider organisation priorities.
• Works with others to identify areas for improvement and simplify processes to use fewer resources.
• Identify capability gaps, and continuously seek and act on feedback to improve own and teams’ performance.
• Uses sound judgement, evidence and knowledge to arrive at accurate, expert and professional decisions and advice.
• Encourage joined up teamwork within own team and across other groups, including supplier partners, sharing information appropriately and building professional relationships.
• Takes ownership for results by working to agreed goals and activities and dealing with challenges in a responsive and constructive way.
• Display confidence when making difficult decisions, whilst understanding own level of responsibility and empowering others to make decisions as appropriate.
• Communicates with clarity, integrity and enthusiasm.
• Plans, organises and manages times and activities effectively to deliver high quality performance.

Qualifications/professional memberships

Desirable

• Working towards IWFM (Levels 4-5), or preference if held
• Diploma in Security (BTEC) or similar preferred
Behaviours
We'll assess you against these behaviours during the selection process:
Seeing the Big Picture
Making Effective Decisions
Working Together
Managing a Quality Service
Benefits
• Learning and development tailored to your role
• An environment with flexible working options
• A culture encouraging inclusion and diversity
• A Civil Service pension
Things you need to know
Security
Successful candidates must pass a disclosure and barring security check.
People working with government assets must complete basic personnel security standard checks.
Selection process details
This vacancy is using Success Profiles, and will assess your Behaviours, Strengths and Experience.
STAGE 1 - APPLICATION & SIFT

As part of the application process you will be asked to provide a Personal Statement against the essential criteria as outlined above. You will also be asked to provide a short CV.

Your CV should be fairly short and just evidence very brief details of your work history and experience.
Please do not submit a speculative application where you do not meet at least 50% of the essential criteria as these applications will be unsuccessful. Do not include competency examples within your application as these will not be assessed in the sift and will only be used at interview stage.

Further details around what this will entail are listed on the application form.

There will be an initial sift of applications based on the Personal Statement only, so please ensure you evidence how you meet the Essential Skills, Knowledge & Experience requirement contained in the vacancy in this section. This will form a short list for interview.

STAGE 2 - INTERVIEW

All candidates who are successful at the sift stage will undertake a single virtual video interview.

The interview will follow a blended approach which will help us assess candidates Behaviours and Strengths.

The sift will take place w/c 26 October and interview dates will be w/c 16 November. Due to the current situation with COVID19 the interviews are scheduled to take place virtually.

Further information:

If you are experiencing accessibility problems with any attachments on this advert, please contact the email address in the 'Contact point for applicants' section.

A reserve list may be held for a period of 6 months from which further appointments can be made.

If successful and transferring from another Government Department a criminal record check may be carried out.

New entrants are expected to join on the minimum of the pay band.

Any move to DWP will mean you will no longer be able to carry on claiming childcare vouchers. You will however have access to the governments Tax Free Childcare scheme.

Reasonable adjustment
If a person with disabilities is put at a substantial disadvantage compared to a non-disabled person, we have a duty to make reasonable changes to our processes.

If you need a change to be made so that you can make your application, you should:

Contact Government Recruitment Service via DWPRecruitment.grs@cabinetoffice.gov.uk as soon as possible before the closing date to discuss your needs.

Complete the “Assistance required” section in the “Additional requirements” page of your application form to tell us what changes or help you might need further on in the recruitment process. For instance, you may need wheelchair access at interview, or if you’re deaf, a Language Service Professional.

Applicants who are successful at interview will be, as part of pre-employment screening subject to a check on the Internal Fraud Database (IFD). This check will provide information about employees who have been dismissed for fraud or dishonesty offences. This check also applies to employees who resign or otherwise leave before being dismissed for fraud or dishonesty had their employment continued. Any applicant’s details held on the IFD will be refused employment.

A candidate is not eligible to apply for a role within the Civil Service if the application is made within a 5 year period following a dismissal for carrying out internal fraud against government.

In order to process applications without delay, we will be sending a Criminal Record Check to Disclosure and Barring Service on your behalf. However, we recognise in exceptional circumstance some candidates will want to send their completed forms direct. If you will be doing this, please advise Government Recruitment Service of your intention by emailing Pre-EmploymentChecks.grs@cabinetoffice.gov.uk stating the job reference number in the subject heading.

Before applying for this vacancy, current employees of DWP should check whether a successful application would result in changes to their terms & conditions of employment, e.g. mobility, pay, allowances. Civil Servants that would transfer into DWP from other government organisations, following successful application, will assume DWP's terms & conditions of employment current on the day they are posted, unless DWP has stated otherwise in writing.

Feedback will only be provided if you attend an interview or assessment.
Nationality requirements
Open to UK, Commonwealth and European Economic Area (EEA) and certain non EEA nationals. Further information on whether you are able to apply is available here.
Working for the Civil Service
The Civil Service Code sets out the standards of behaviour expected of civil servants.

We recruit by merit on the basis of fair and open competition, as outlined in the Civil Service Commission's recruitment principles.
The Civil Service embraces diversity and promotes equal opportunities. As such, we run a Disability Confident Scheme (DCS) for candidates with disabilities who meet the minimum selection criteria.
Apply and further information
Once this job has closed, the job advert will no longer be available.
You may want to save a copy for your records.
Contact point for applicants
Job contact :
Name : Matt Pepper
Email : matt.pepper@dwp.gov.uk

Recruitment team :
Email : dwprecruitment.grs@cabinetoffice.gov.uk
Further information
If you feel your application has not been treated in accordance with these principles and you wish to make a complaint, you should in the first instance contact DWP by email: HR.BUSINESSASSURANCE@DWP.GOV.UK. If you are not satisfied with the response you receive from the Department, you can contact the Civil Service Commission here to visit Civil Service Commission.

Job Title: Front of House Security Officer (Operation Support Team)...
Job Description:
Are you a Front of House Security Officer with proven customer service experience working with clients and public? Do you have other commitments and are interested in non-guaranteed hours across London sites? Apply now and join us!
We can offer
Site related hourly rate between £10.55 – £12.20 per hour & structured training.
Please take time to read about our benefits package at vacancies.dardansecurity.co.uk.
We need from you
Experience working as a Front of House Security Officer in a customer / public facing role
Demonstrable skills in providing great Customer Care
A warm, outgoing, and friendly personality
Confidence and Professionalism
Flexible to work variable shift pattern which may include nights and weekends
Frontline SIA Door Supervisor licence, CCTV licence would be an advantage
Excellent presentation and strong teamwork approach
A supportive approach to work with a positive “can do” attitude
We want you to be a success
In the first few weeks you will be scheduled for training, build crucial relationships with your team, focus on developing your knowledge of the site procedures, geography and policies, learning from your colleagues about what is expected when carrying out your duties.
To be a successful as a Security Officer, you will dedicate time to updating your knowledge and champion health & safety at all times, reporting any key concerns to ensure that your welfare and others is protected. Our most revered Officers are an active presence on site and promote the same professionalism we would expect from day officers in customer facing roles.

We are Dardan
We are UK based, privately owned specialist security solutions and consultancy provider with over 40 years’ experience. A career with us means joining the top 5% of all SIA security providers within the UK, an NSI accredited (Gold Scheme) provider of mobile patrol services, static Site guarding, key holding and response services listed as Infologue’s “One to Watch”. We seek to be the leading provider of security services and have an extensive portfolio across Aviation, Critical National Infrastructure, Oil and Gas, Education, Healthcare, Retail, Blue Chip and Corporate #proudtobeDardan
Due to the nature of the Company’s business your role will be site based. It is a condition of your employment that the Company reserves the right to vary your working hours, duties and location of duties to meet the need of the business at any time.
Dardan Security are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.

Company Background:
Our client are a rapidly growing innovative organisation, focussed on bringing next generation cyber security technologies to the UK market. They have a focus across several industry sectors, including finance, pharma, legal, private health supply chain and NHS. They are now are seeking a self-motivated, enthusiastic BDM to join our team and contribute to the ongoing growth and development of our client base.
Job Purpose:
Leading efforts to establish and retain business growth opportunities. Primarily obtaining new clients and fostering business relationships to increase revenue from sales.
Job Duties:
Finding new clients and promoting sales to them
Identifying key accounts
Fostering familiar relationships with clients and prospects
Following up on client leads
Understand the needs of your customers and be able to respond effectively with a plan of how to meet these
Being knowledgeable about products and services offered by the business
Achieving and maintaining partners’ product/sales certifications
Selling products and services in person and over the phone
Raising the company profile by attending expositions and seminars
Suggesting new projects such as product development to tap into new markets
Being aware of market trends and competitors
Complying with regulations and laws of business development
Maintaining a positive attitude that inspires clients to work with the business
Keep abreast of trends and changes in the business world.
Skills
You’ll need to have:
Tenacity and drive to seek new business and meet or exceed targets
An excellent telephone manner for making initial contact and for ongoing communication with customers and business associates
Excellent written and verbal communication skills – needed for communicating with a wide range of people, both internally and externally
Good IT skills, including the use CRM and sales technology stacks, including LinkedIn and Sales Navigator
A professional manner and presentable appearance for meeting customers/clients
Initiative and good decision-making skills
The ability to motivate yourself and set your own goals
Good networking skills
Initiative and the confidence to start things from scratch
Education/Experience

For this important hire, a degree education and a minimum of 3 years’ experience selling cyber security solutions is highly desirable. Minimum requirements is 3 years’ experience in relevant field.

Job Title: Security Sales Specialist - DDoS Protection, Mitigation and Threat Analytics (Overlay)
Job Description:
Location
London, United Kingdom
Sector:
Sales & Marketing
Job type:
Permanent
Consultant:
Ani Lputian
Job ref:
13237
Email:
ani.lputian@thenorthstarr.com
Security Sales Specialist - DDoS Protection, Mitigation and Threat Analytics (Overlay)
Up to 90,000 basic with Double OTE and Uncapped Commission
Home based / Slough HQ
The Company
Our client is a leading global vendor of DDoS solutions and are currently expanding their direct Enterprise sales team due to dynamic growth. They provide various DDoS solutions including Traffic Intelligence, Network Visibility, Network Protection and Advanced Threat Detection. They are looking for dynamic, entrepreneurial and security focused senior sales people to join and grow with their direct sales team.
The Role
This role is predominantly focused on an overlay hunting approach involving identifying and growing security solutions within their existing Enterprise Accounts. Along-side this, the successful candidate will be expected to participate in the following:
Mapping and measuring own pipeline to hit and exceed targets
Focusing on the Enterprise space; Banking and Government space
Prospecting and winning enterprise new logo accounts
Managing and growing existing revenues within new accounts
Collaborating with marketing and inside sales teams to support your senior sales activities
Focusing on delivering true solutions sales around security and managed services
Delivering against monthly and quarterly targets and deadlines
Experience Required
10+ years sales experience, with 5+ years of new business
Strong sales track-record with an ability to engage and negotiate at C-level
IT sector sales experience either in Global Connectivity, Software or Security with a focus on solution sales within networks and security
Knowledge and passion for DDoS solutions
Excellent communication skills both written, verbal and in presentation
Ability to work autonomously and independently
What's in it for You?
This is a one off opportunity to join a dynamic and leading vendor within the security space and make an instant impact on the Enterprise team which is small enough to add value to but with ambitious growth plans for the coming year. There is excellent earning potential, strong network of internal support around you, and a product that is the best on the market.
What Next?
If you're interested in applying for this specialist senior sales role please share your CV with ani.lputian@thenorthstarr.com or call 020 3800 0983 for more information

Global Relay is looking for a motivated and diligent Network Specialist - L2 to join our growing IT Infrastructure team in the London office. The Network Specialist - L2 is responsible for assisting in engineering, long term strategies, planning, integration, and deployments pertaining to the IT Network. They will work closely with all members of the IT Operations team to continuously design, evolve, build, and ensure the integration, manageability, and security of highly available systems and applications. Working closely with other units, they will ensure that the design of Global Relay’s IT Networks integrate with other technologies such as storage, virtualization, containerization, and any and all systems and services.
Your Job:
Participate in the development and engineering of long term strategies for the IT Network
Utilize ‘Systems Thinking’ to understand interdependencies both within the IT Network and Infrastructure, and throughout Global Relay’s interests
Work closely with Operations and Development teams to identify, troubleshoot, diagnose, and correct system related issues as they arise
Participate in formulating and implementing innovative techniques for achieving and maintaining a high level of client satisfaction in conjunction with organizational effectiveness
Collaborate with Operations and Development teams to identify opportunities for improved service, efficiency, security, and resiliency
Participate in strategic planning initiatives as well as selection, installation, operationalizing, and ongoing support of infrastructure enhancements
Participate and support change management activities
Provide support to business users and key stakeholders as needed
Participate in the creation of documentation including: Runbooks, how-to user guides & technical how-to support guides, and Method of Procedures (MoP)
Support and evolve the monitoring and reviewing of system dashboards and critical alerts to ensure system issues are identified, escalated, and addressed as quickly as possible
Identify, evaluate and make recommendations on opportunities for the implementation of automation
Provide support for all Systems Administration, escalated incidents or problem related items
Utilize acquired knowledge to balance user requirements, available resources, organizational goals and objectives while striving to maintain top quality client service
About You:
Minimum of 5+ years’ experience in a Network Specialist capacity
Experience with complex enterprise network architecture planning, design, and implementation
Experience with troubleshooting & resolving complex technical problems, management reporting, and documentation (how-to, processes and procedures, MoP)
Proven ability to self-manage and balance assigned work meeting deliverables as scheduled
Solid knowledge and experience in deploying and managing Linux
Experience provisioning, maintaining, and supporting enterprise networks, firewalls, and related dependencies
Experience with OpenSource software and/or service management tools and applications (OpenStack, OpenShift, Zabbix, JIRA, Confluence, Jenkins, etc.)
Experience with implementing and leveraging automation in the delivery of system administration responsibilities
Solid knowledge of network protocols including TCP/IP, UDP, HTTP, FTP, ARP, ICMP, MPLS, BGP etc.
Demonstrated ability to work both collaboratively in a team environment as well as independently in an effective and organized manner in a complex and challenging environment
Adaptability to work with multiple teams on projects with varying degrees of flexibility/rigidity at different points in the development cycle
Solid experience working in an environment with formally structured IT Operational processes, such as work request ticket management, incident management, change management, problem management, etc.
Ability to take on internal operational initiatives as the owner and coordinator for projects or large scale items
ITSM Framework certifications such as ITIL, Sigma, SIAM or Methodology certifications such as Agile, Scrum, DevOps are considered a definite asset

Global Relay is the leading provider of cloud-based archiving, information governance, surveillance, and eDiscovery solutions to the global finance sector. We help financial services firms preserve and supervise their communications data for regulatory compliance, risk mitigation, and litigation readiness. We deliver our services to over 20,000 customers in 90 countries, including 22 of the top 25 global banks. Our market-leading archiving service supports email, instant messaging, text, market data chat, social media, enterprise social networking, voice, trade data, websites, and more. Recently, we also launched a compliant messaging platform specifically for the finance industry.
We’ve won major awards for our growth, management, and culture – including the Deloitte Fast 50 Leadership Award, Canada’s 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures, and the Deloitte-sponsored Canada’s Best Managed Companies awards. Our Global Operations & Development Center is located in Vancouver, BC, Canada. In addition, we have offices in seven other cities across the world, including major financial centers like New York, Chicago, and London.
We’ve recently expanded our London operations to better serve our UK and EU customers. Our brand-new, four-story EMEA headquarters on Cannon Street (near St. Paul’s Cathedral) features state-of-the-art amenities, a spectacular view of the city, and a conference centre for customer events.
We provide fantastic opportunities to individuals passionate about business and technology. These opportunities include working alongside members of our leadership team. Receiving mentorship from seasoned technology and business professionals. And doing business with the world’s largest, most influential banks and enterprise organizations.
To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.

Are you a database specialist with deep experience in relational databases? Do you enjoy helping customers select and use the right data technology for their application requirements? Do you want to be part of a team who helps build the future of databases at Amazon Web Services (AWS)? Come join us!

We are looking for Database Specialist Solution Architects (SA) with a balance of great communication skills with deep technical expertise giving them the ability to impress AWS customers at any level, from executive to developer. You will be hands-on collaborating with our customers and partners in building and migrating their Database platforms and applications to the cloud.

In this role, your creativity will link technology to tangible solutions, work with some of the largest enterprises, help them architect scalable database solutions, dive deep into customer problems and work with AWS service teams to create solutions that solve customer needs.

If you are someone who enjoys innovating, likes solving problems and working on the cutting edge of technology, we would love to have you on the team.

Roles and Responsibilities
· Design Customer Solutions, collaborate with AWS field sales, pre­sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use Amazon Relational Database services.
· Devise Strategy ­ and Engage with Solution Architects, Account Managers Professional Services and Partners to define a Database Engagement strategy for AWS operational territories and key accounts.
· Be a trusted advisor, representing the voice of the customer to internal teams, proactively defining and prioritizing service features and successful outcomes for our customers
· Thought leaders - produce compelling audience-specific messages and tools, reference architectures, demos, public speaking, blogs, and other artifacts.
· Enable and nurture AWS field teams, internal community, share best practices and insights with customers and partners.
· Identify key use cases and associated reference architectures for AWS market segments and industry verticals.




Basic Qualifications

· Proven design and implementation experience with Schema Design, Query Tuning and Optimization, Data Migration and Integration.
· Operational Website/web services as well as traditional IT networking, operations, management, and security experience.
· Knowledge of the underlying infrastructure requirements such as Networking, Storage, and Hardware Optimization.
· Business fluent English is required for customer interactions, internal communication, and collaboration with the worldwide teams.



Preferred Qualifications

One or more of the following qualifications are desired but not required:
· Academic background Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent professional experience.
· Experience communicating effectively across internal and external organizations, for complex mission-critical solutions.
· Ability to evaluate and plan migrations to Amazon Aurora, Amazon PostgreSQL, Amazon RDS.
· Understanding of application, server, and network security is highly desired.

Job Title: Specialist Solution Architect: NoSQL Databases - ElastiCache
Job Description:
Are you passionate about building applications with NoSQL databases? Do you enjoy helping customers select and use the right data technology for their application requirements? Do you want to be part of a team who helps build the future of databases at Amazon Web Services (AWS)? Come join us!

We are looking for Database Specialist Solution Architects (SA) with a balance of great communication skills with deep technical expertise giving them the ability to impress AWS customers at any level, from executive to developer. You will be hands-on collaborating with our customers and partners in building and migrating their Database platforms and applications to the cloud.

You will work with some of the largest enterprises, to help them architect scalable NoSQL solutions, dive deep into customer problems and work with AWS service teams to create solutions that solve customer needs.

If you are someone who enjoys innovating, likes solving problems and working on the cutting edge of technology, we would love to have you on the team.


Roles and Responsibilities

· Be the recognized authority and subject matter expert for Amazon NoSQL databases across AWS.
· Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre­-sales, training and support teams to help customers learn about and use Amazon NoSQL databases.
· Develop empathetic relationships that allows you to understand and articulate customer needs and opportunities and provide definitive guidance for customers in choosing the right database services and approaches.
· Be a trusted advisor, representing the voice of the customer to internal teams, proactively defining and prioritizing service features and successful outcomes for our customers.
· Enable and nurture AWS field teams, internal community, share best practices and insights with customers and partners.
· Thought leaders - produce compelling audience-specific messages and tools, reference architectures, demos, public speaking, blogs, and other artifacts.

Basic Qualifications

· Proven design and implementation experience with NoSQL technologies such as MongoDB, Cassandra, Hadoop (HBase, Redis) and on different stages of the lifecycle (Data model design, Query Tuning and Optimization, operational management and troubleshooting)
· Operational Website/web services as well as traditional IT networking, operations, management, and security experience.
· Knowledge of the underlying infrastructure requirements such as Networking, Storage, and Hardware Optimization.
· Business fluent English is required for customer interactions, internal communication, and collaboration with the worldwide teams.



Preferred Qualifications

One or more of the following qualifications are desired but not required:

· Academic background Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent professional experience.
· Experience communicating effectively across internal and external organizations, for complex mission-critical solutions
· Experience of data migration techniques and process planning including transaction processing, security, logging and monitoring. Experience of advanced deployment architectures such as availability, resiliency and fault tolerance.
· Deep understanding of AWS services related to databases highly desirable, particularly Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon DocumentDB, Amazon Elasticsearch, Amazon Aurora, AWS Lambda, Amazon EC2 Container Service.
· Familiarity with modern programming languages (Python, JavaScript, Go, .Net, Java, Clojure, Node.js).

IT Security consultant with penetration testing experience is needed for a contract role in Swindon, Wiltshire starting November 2020 and running until March 2021 with extension possibility. Single stage interviews are taking place in the next two weeks.

As ITsec consultant and Pen Tester you will:
Define the end to end Penetration Testing Service and all supporting processes that are needed with the input of the IT Security Manager (Vulnerability Management) and IT Security Operations Team Lead
Document the processes and make recommendations for process improvements.
Define and document the Penetration Testing Security Standard
Co-ordinate and manage Penetration Testing requests from the relevant IT and Business Stakeholders and gather and document all requirements for the requested security assessment
Engage with the Third Party Penetration Testing Provider to discuss the Penetration Testing requirements and schedule the testing
Assist the IT Security Manager (Vulnerability Management) in the management and co-ordination of the remediation activities relating to the open findings from a Penetration Test and ensure they are communicated and remediated in a timely manner
Maintain the IT Security risk register and provide input to the IT Security Operations Team Lead for any internal and external audits relating to Penetration Test as and when required

You will have:
CompTIA Security+ (additional security certs are a bonus)
Strong experience in IT Security particularly Penetration Testing
Experience of Vulnerability Management and/or Penetration Testing processes and dealing with related findings.
Good understanding of vulnerability frameworks and advisories (NVD , CVE)
Experience of CIS Benchmarks Policies
Knowledge of Active Directory and Group Policies
Knowledge of OWASP
Good knowledge of attack vectors particularly MITRE Attack Framework
Ability to work in Swindon, UK and travel to Europe once per month

The candidate must have the rights to work in the location stated in the job advert.

Please note, Quanta part of QCS Staffing does not sponsor Visa applications.

To view Quanta's privacy policy, please visit our website
Location: Swindon, Wiltshire, South West England, England

Job Title: Business Development Manager - Aerospace, Defence and Security Information
Job Description:
Business Development Manager - Aerospace, Defence and Security Information
London
50-80k Base, 100-160k OTE + Executive Benefits
Our client, with over 1000 researchers and analysts, is a premium information company and arguably the global leader specialising in analysis, consulting and research. This BI Giant delivers advanced analytics, indicators and forecasts in a single platform, which helps clients make better, more informed decisions worldwide. Due to growth, they now have an exciting opening for an experienced Business Development Manager to sell into the Aerospace, Defence and/or Security sector.
As a Business Development Manager, you will:
Target a specific sector, with a focus on generating analysis, consulting and research revenue throughout EMEA
Develop prospects into pipeline business through cold calling, networking and leveraging contacts
Manage the full sales cycle from lead development through close
Map out and approach stakeholders, delivering compelling demonstrations of our clients’ class-leading BI platform
Work with varying order values, short sales cycles and a large international territory
Be internally based, deliver consistent high activity levels and focus on new revenue generation
Prepare and deliver compelling proposals
The ideal sales candidate will:
Be educated to degree level
Be intelligent, inquisitive and possess a minimum of 5-6+ years’ previous consultative, new business sales experience gained in information or market intelligence
Have sold into and have in-depth knowledge of the Defence and/or Security sectors
Possess business acumen, motivation and a dynamic yet professional approach to new business sales
Have first-class communication and presentation skills and the ability to liaise with c-level contacts across a large geographical territory
Demonstrate a consultative and strategic mindset
The successful sales candidate can expect:
A negotiable base salary circa 50-80k
An uncapped first year OTE of 100-160k
Commission accelerators for over target performance
Genuine career progression
Opportunities to travel
Generous benefits

Job Title: Front of House Security Officer (Operation Support Team) – London
Job Description:
Do you have what it takes to be an Security Officer with Amulet? We have an exciting opportunity for an passionate Female Security Officer to join our dynamic and hard-working team on a permanent basis at Wandsworth. This role is perfect for anyone who is looking to stay within the industry or looking to start a new career in Security.
JOB DESCRIPTION: Amulet is looking to recruit a Female Security Officer to join our team at Wandsworth. Due to the nature of the role requiring the preservation of decency and privacy, this role is restricted to female applicants. This is a genuine occupational qualification (GOQ). The Sex Discrimination Act 1975, section 7(2). Taking pride in providing a proactive and professional security service, you will be dealing with students on a day to day basis and supporting your team with the full range of security duties. In addition you may be required to assist and search, and administrator first aid where required to female students.
SKILLS & EXPERIENCE: You are able to communicate clearly and effectively, attaining a good standard of verbal and written English. You are capable of dealing with a variety of situations and are very customer service-focused. You have good organisational and record-keeping skills. You have a proven track record of teamwork. You are well-presented at all times.
JOB REQUIREMENTS: You must be able to provide a checkable 5-year employment history for vetting purposes. Possession of a First Aid at Work Certificate is desirable.
LICENCE REQUIREMENTS: You must have a current SIA Licence.
JOB TYPE: Permanent, Full-Time
WORKING PATTERN: Variable shifts, 5 days per week, including evenings and weekends.
SALARY/BENEFITS: £9 per hour + 28 days paid holiday (accrued & pro-rata); full company uniform; training; enrolment in NEST pension scheme. Employee recognition scheme; Refer a Friend Scheme; Wagestream and ongoing learning and development.
START DATE: Immediate
APPLY: Please email CV to Regional Manager Catherine Hill
INTERVIEW REQUIREMENTS: Eligibility documents needed at interview: Passport or Full Birth Certificate; Utility Bill showing current address and dated within 3 months; Proof of National Insurance (Payslips cannot be used) such as NI card, P45, P60, benefits or HMRC letter.
ABOUT AMULET: Amulet are a specialist, intelligence-led, consultancy-level business delivering multi-faceted security solutions. We provide a complete suite of front of house, manned, mobile, event, covert and technical security services across numerous sectors throughout the UK. We offer a new and exciting approach to the provision of security solutions within a traditional marketplace. We are recognised as an ACS Star Performer, leading the way in delivering fresh ideas and approaches that are backed up by a depth of industry knowledge and experience. As part of the Churchill Services Group, Amulet benefit from 40 years’ experience in delivering forward-thinking, industry-defining solutions. Amulet’s customers have the backing of one of the UK’s fastest growing companies as recognised by The Sunday Times Fast Track (2017).
As part of the Churchill Services Group, Amulet benefit from 40 years’ experience in delivering forward thinking, industry defining solutions.
Our commitment to Equality. Diversity and Inclusion, we are proud to be an inclusive, equal opportunity employer and seek to attract, develop and retain the best people from the widest possible talent pool. We’re committed to ensuring that all candidates are treated fairly, and with respect and dignity throughout the recruitment process.

Schedule:
Monday to Friday

security: 1 year (Preferred)

The Global People Data & Analytics Specialist will help to deliver the Dentsu Aegis Network (DAN) people analytics strategy by driving insight for our business through analytics and report creation, supporting on key projects such as focused POCs and project manage our data warehouse solution (with our technology team).
This role will give you the opportunity to design and create the data environment that will be critical to the reporting and statistical analysis that will be done by you and the wider team. It will also allow you to work with senior people on some key business insight projects. The role reports into the Global Director People Data & Analytics and will be part of a team that look after global requirements, including the regional hubs which will also require support.
The role will require you to work collaboratively across the business and functions globally starting with your colleagues within the Global People Analytics team as well as different stakeholders such as IT, HR, Finance, Global Client, and the Data Protection Officer.
Job Title:
Global People Data Specialist
Job Description:
Role Responsibility
Manipulate and build models to support People analytics projects and insight generation
Create and design global reporting using technology such as Tableau and/or Power BI
Build strong knowledge of the DAN business, its technology and data sources
Work closely with the Chief Data Officer and Legal to ensure security and compliance is at the forefront of any build, analysis and data shared
Being an active member of the Global People Analytics team and community helping and supporting regional markets with local needs
Project manage the design and build of the cloud based warehouse consolidating key data for use in People Analytics projects and reporting
Driving the improvement and rigor of people data which will include ensuring security and governance
Working closely with the HR Information Systems (HRIS) team, Finance, IT and other data providers to support improved data collaboration, awareness and operational effectiveness
Ensuring the accuracy, integrity and consistency of people data in our core HR Systems (Workday and Glint) as a key part of driving influence through data-driven recommendations
Support the preparation, analysis and presentation of people metrics for review by the Global Data and Analytics Director and other key HR and business stakeholders
Helping to identify the latest trends and tools in data and analytics in the market to develop innovative and scalable solutions for DAN
Candidate Experience
Proven analytics and data manipulation skills
Has a passion for data and analytics
Experience using Tableau and/or Power BI
Willing to learn and challenge themselves
Ability to deliver insight from data by exploring (through R/SPSS/etc), visualising (through Tableau/PowerBI/Qlik/etc) and story telling
Delivering a project with multiple stakeholders. This may be around Workforce planning, MDM or data warehousing
Desirable:
Understands data wrangling tools such as Knime, Alteryx or similar technologies
SQL skills
Experience using HRIS systems such as Workday
Previous HR knowledge or experience
Have built and maintained databases supporting data from multiple sources
Have statistical experience
Awareness and experience of applying governance and rigor to data – understanding of GDPR
Experience using tools such as SSRS, SQL Server, Logic Apps, Data Factory, Azure SQL DB
Have data warehouse / BI architect experience in setting up and running and maintaining data warehouses
Experience of Microsoft Azure technology
What you’ll get from us
Dentsu Aegis Network is a fantastic place to work with many great benefits on offer including 25 days’ annual holiday, Pension, Cycle to Work Scheme, and get your Birthday day off!
Not only is it an incredibly fun place to work but as part of a multinational organisation there are many opportunities to advance your career within the wider business once you have proven yourself.
About Dentsu Aegis Network (DAN)
DAN is headquartered in London and operates in 145 countries worldwide with more than 45,000 dedicated specialists. Dentsu Aegis Network is Innovating the Way Brands Are Built for its clients through its best-in-class expertise and capabilities in media, digital and creative communications services.
Our values and behaviours:
Agile – Anticipate business needs, continuous process improvement, be flexible whilst maintain high standards
Pioneering – Being constantly curious, be bold in challenging the status quo, support a culture of openness
Ambitious – Strive for excellence, drive hard to achieve, learn from experiences
Responsible – Uphold the highest levels of integrity, lead by example, be courageous in raining concerns
Collaborative – Operate as one finance team locally and globally by sharing best practice and following standard practices and processes

65k Base, 130k OTE + Excellent Benefits
London
Our international client is a leading provider of cyber security and more specifically, privileged access management. Through their global footprint, they deliver scalable solutions into numerous vertical markets and are trusted advisors to a high number of Fortune 500 and Global 2000 companies. Hold responsibility for building, growing and leading a high-performance sales team

Support the sales function through delivering 121’s, forecasting, coaching and achievable KPI’s
Drive and motivate the team to reach and exceed both activity and revenue targets

About our Trust


Chelsea and Westminster Hospital NHS Foundation Trust provide services from two main hospitals, Chelsea and Westminster Hospital and West Middlesex University Hospital, and a number of clinics across London and the South-East.

We have over 6,000 members of staff that are PROUD to Care for nearly one million people. Both hospitals provide full clinical services, including full maternity, emergency and children’s, in addition to a range of community-based services across London, such as award-winning sexual health and HIV clinics.

We’re one of the safest and best performing Trusts in the country. We’re also one of the top trusts to work for – our staff say they’re engaged, motivated, and would recommend us as a place to work and receive treatment.

In 2020, The Trust was rated by the Care Quality Commission as ‘Outstanding’ in the well-led and use of resources domains and ‘Good’ in the safe, effective, caring and responsive domains. The Trust as a whole was ‘Good’, but the Chelsea site was ‘Outstanding’.

Our facilities are some of the best in the country. We have been investing around £10 million a year in our estate. We are currently spending c. £25 million on expanding our adult and neonatal critical care facilities at Chelsea and Westminster and redevelopment of our children’s unit at West Middlesex – in partnership with our charity, CW+ and generous donors.

About the role

Diabetes Specialist Dietitian

Maternity leave cover – 9 months (with possible extension to 1 year)

£45,780 - £51,393 per annum incl. HCAS

Chelsea and Westminster Hospital

We are looking for an experienced band 7 Dietitian to join our Diabetes and Endocrine team, to provide excellent inpatient and outpatient diabetes care. The post holder will provide clinical expertise both in inpatient and outpatient care, and will join a dynamic team based at Chelsea & Westminster Hospital (and when required West Middlesex University Hospital).

As a growing service meeting the needs of an expanding local population, the service provides a number of routine and specialist services, including; providing multidisciplinary clinic support, dietitian and nurse-led clinics, ante-natal and pre-conception clinic, insulin pump clinic, transition clinic, virtual clinic, CGMS, emergency reviews and managing routine and urgent ward referrals. We are also a DAFNE centre.

Applicants should possess an in-depth clinical knowledge of diabetes, which should be supported by recent experience in caring for people with diabetes. In addition, excellent communication and clinical skills, time management skills and a commitment to evidence based practice.

Our mission is to break down the barriers of today to release the potential of tomorrow. Join us today and release yours.

Why this role matters
BT Security is a branch of BT Global.
We help BT fulfil its global regulatory obligations, supported by our close relationship with customers. We develop innovative teams and create cutting-edge solutions to technical problems.

The role is to lead within a small technical design and assurance team of professionals responsible for driving forward new external customer network solutions, generating new ideas, influencing and delivering innovative solutions to customer problems from inception through to operational service.

Your role is also subject to you gaining and keeping the necessary level of Security Clearance needed to undertake your work.
What you'll be doing
The post holder will:
Be an experienced and respected professional with expert technical knowledge in optical transmission systems and BTs 21C transmission network solutions and strategy. They will have a detailed understanding of the technologies, systems and wider business context, working closely with the appropriate vendors, customers and BT technical teams.
Be responsible for systems engineering to define and drive the technical network solutions to meet customer requirements through technical ownership for aspects of large projects and leadership of small/medium projects. They will deal with all relevant issues, often without the guidance of the manager and will be jointly responsible with the delivery teams for realisation of these projects, by providing direction and a solutions assurance role.
Be responsible for strategic planning of our network platforms, defining technology roadmaps and defining overall technical framework and policies which guide the implementation of our network.
Have exposure to technical and business leaders within BT Security and the customer base and be responsible for agreeing detailed definition of technical strategy. They will maintain industry technical knowledge and appreciation of global technology trends, together with strong vendor contacts to ensure the network is based on industry best practice.
Assist the Product team in the design of and delivery of customer/BT proposals or ITTs.
Manage the important ongoing customer liaison and relationships throughout the product/solution lifecycle.
Deliver all network solutions and projects within an agreed budget and timescale.
Ensure all new networks are supportable and seamlessly integrated into the existing BT Security Service Operations teams. Provide sufficient training and budget for the in-life support period.
Be responsible for mentoring and sharing knowledge with others, and will be expected to coach other team members so as to raise their own technical expertise level.
The position will initially be based in the UK, where the individual will be trained and briefed in all aspects of the role. Once trained, the individual will move onto a three year International Assignment, based in mainland Europe. The exact start date, country specific details and assignment terms and conditions, will be given at interview.
We'll also need to see these on your CV
Specialist technical domain knowledge of solutions and strategy of BT’s core transmission networks.
Cisco and DWDM- Technical and in-depth working history of design, installation and support.
Detailed history of leading projects with challenging time scales and senior customer oversight.
Managerial Experience within the Telecoms Industry.
Must have strong communication and client interfacing skills, with demonstrated ability to articulate complex technical concepts in a manner understandable and useful to a business and executive audience.
Exceptional written and verbal communication (including strong technical writing skills),as well as presentation, facilitation, coaching and mentoring skills.
Ability to manage and coordinate multiple concurrent projects, perform under pressure and meet deadlines.
Ability to work with stakeholders to clearly capture requirements
Good relationship management skills with a dedicated and positive attitude.
Innovative approach to technical solutions and service quality.
Willingness to take ownership and show initiative to achieve results.
ITIL Foundation V3 qualified. Ideally ITIL Service Operations and ITIL Service Transition.
Must hold and retain Developed Vetting clearance (or have the ability to gain it as a minimum) and maintaining your security clearance is a requirement of your role.
Why choose us?
We’ve always been an organisation with purpose; to use the power of communications to make a better world. You can trace this back to our beginning as pioneers of the world’s first telecommunications company. At our heart we’re a technology company with research and innovation in our bones and a desire to be personal, simple, and brilliant for our customers - those are the values we live by whilst also creating an inclusive working environment where people from all backgrounds can succeed.

Our pursuit of progress over the past 180 years has established BT as a strong, successful brand, with huge scale capable of achieving great things. From supporting emergency services, hospitals, banks and keeping economies around the world online, safe and secure, to delivering large scale technology infrastructure like the creation of BT Sport.

Today in this fast changing, always on, digital world our purpose remains true. Yet the market conditions, regulation and competition we face are tougher than ever before. So if you have the drive, optimism and resilience to help propel us forward we’ll offer unrivalled personal development, a wealth of opportunities to learn, experience new things and pursue new careers. If that’s you and what you’re looking for, we’d love you to be part of our future.

We value different perspectives, skills and experiences. We’re creating an inclusive working culture where people from all backgrounds can succeed. That’s why we welcome applications from all parts of the community.

Energy Networks Technical Specialist

Apply Now

Become part of the team


Energy markets are transforming rapidly, and we need consultants who can help our clients understand these changes and build business plans that balance the aspirations of customers, regulators and shareholders.

Our successful Energy and Utilities practice is looking for talented utilities specialists to help support our existing client base and our impressive growth strategy.

We are looking for consultants with an engineering background who can work across the breadth of our sector. However, our immediate need is for consultants with expertise in energy price controls and the RIIO framework, and excellent technical understanding of the UK’s electricity network.

We are recruiting in London, Cambridge, Manchester and Edinburgh.

What we're looking for


As a senior member of the team you will help develop and deliver business opportunities for new and existing clients through your own and PA’s extensive network of clients.

Our ideal candidate will have practical experience of UK electricity networks across a number of the following areas:
The rationale for focusing on customer engagement, innovation, outcomes or outputs, incentives and risk/reward measures,
Regulation and the design and use of incentives mechanisms,
Developing impact assessments and business cases that deal with the risks and uncertainties that companies face,
The evolution of energy networks including decarbonisation, electrification of heat and transport, and the Distribution System Operator (DSO),
Network design and operation including an understanding of the constraints currently faced in the energy transition and applicable national standards and policy,
Specialist technical areas such as protection & control systems, losses, power quality and generation,
Unit costs, efficiency opportunities and the Totex model,
Innovation and the benefits between innovative practices vs traditional reinforcement,
Programme delivery and operational network management (day-to-day and exceptional events such as storm response),
Asset management experience including an understanding of industry best practice and line of sight from regulatory/strategic objective to asset cost performance and risk,
Asset investment planning and decision-making including business case development and linkages to regulatory submissions supported by a strong understanding of network performance and risk,
Asset health, utilisation, risk and resilience.
We would also expect you to have:
Strong leadership skills, demonstrating the capacity to lead substantial multidisciplinary projects,
Excellent communication skills both verbal and written
Excellent relationship building and influencing skills,
An excellent academic record, with a degree in electrical engineering (or other relevant discipline).
The ability to operate successfully in a commercial environment and flourish in an entrepreneurial setting
Deep experience of working with clients to shape solutions and the drive to effectively manage a project to a successful conclusion,
Business development and business leadership skills.

Personal qualities

We are looking for people who are:
Energetic, passionate, determined, positive and goal-focused with a commitment to delivering excellence in any and all circumstances,
Passionate about developing themselves technically, professionally and behaviourally,
Collaborative team players with strong interpersonal skills, capable of building outstanding relationships with their colleagues and clients,
Emotionally intelligent with the ability to flex their style to suit different stakeholders,
Able to engage clients using a range of influencing skills.
Location
While you will be primarily based in our London head office, you should expect to travel and work on client sites in the UK with the option to work overseas. Where your work commitments allow it, you may be able to work from home.
Benefits


• Private medical insurance
• Travel allowance
• 25 days annual leave with the opportunity to buy 5 additional days
• Company pension scheme
• Annual performance-based bonus
• Life and Income protection insurance
• Tax efficient benefits (cycle to work, give as you earn)
• Additional optional benefits (Dental, critical illness, spouse/partner life assurance)

About us


We believe in the power of ingenuity to build a positive human future in a technology-driven world.

As strategies, technologies and innovation collide, we create opportunity from complexity.

Our diverse teams of experts combine innovative thinking and breakthrough use of technologies to progress further, faster. Our clients adapt and transform, and together we achieve enduring results.

An innovation and transformation consultancy, we are over 3,200 specialists in consumer, defence and security, energy and utilities, financial services, government, health and life sciences, manufacturing, and transport. Our people are strategists, innovators, designers, consultants, digital experts, scientists, engineers and technologists. We operate globally from offices across the UK, US, Europe, and the Nordics.

PA. Bringing Ingenuity to Life.

Inclusion & Diversity


We believe that diversity makes us a stronger firm and look to employ people with different ideas, styles and skillsets. This diversity stimulates a rich, creative environment – one in which our people develop, and our clients enjoy enduring results. We’re committed to recruiting, promoting and rewarding our people solely based on their ability to contribute to PA’s goals, without regard to their sex, race, disability, religion, national origin, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age or marital status.

We welcome international applications, but we are unable to offer sponsorship for work permits, so you will need to have the full right to live and work in the UK. Unfortunately, your application will be automatically rejected if you do not have these rights.

Should you need any adjustments to the recruitment process, at either application or interview, please contact us on recruitmentenquiries@paconsulting.com

Band 6 - Local Security Management Specialist

flexible and/or full time hours considered

An opportunity has arisen for a forward thinking individual to join the Local Security Management Team, with in the Risk Management Department. The successful post holder will be responsible for providing specialist advice, support and will liaise with both internal and external stakeholders, for example staff who are the victims of assault and the police. The post holder will also work collaboratively with other teams and services within the Trust to provide a coordinated approach to the security management service that we deliver in order to support staff and manage the Trusts Security Framework.

Work base: The role is based at the Trust headquarters in Runwell, Essex; but you must be able to travel to any of the Trusts units to undertake the role should this be required. The Trust geography spans Bedfordshire, Essex and Suffolk areas.

As part of the interview process the candidates will be expected to prepare a management report (maximum 4 sides of A4) and share at the interview (please also email copy across). The report must be in a style appropriate for consideration by the leadership team of the Trust. Candidates will be required to present a verbal summary of the written report to the interview panel as if they were presenting it to a committee. Candidates should assume that they have 8 minutes presentation time with 5 minutes allowed for discussion and questions.

The outline brief for the report is as follows : As you will be aware that from the 1stApril 2017 NHS Project no longer governs the LSMS agenda; using your knowledge, skills and experience advise what the implications for EPUT are and what the priorities are in the short, medium and long term.

The interviews will be held via Microsoft Teams only

Closing date for applications will be 19th November

Interviews to be held on 4th December.

EPUT are looking for motivated staff who shares our Trust values of Open, Compassionate and Empowering. In return, EPUT can offer you a range of benefits and development including;
Season Ticket Loans
NHS discounts for staff
Excellent Training facilities and opportunities
Buying and Selling annual leave scheme
The opportunity to work bank shifts and expand knowledge and experience in other areas
Salary Sacrifice schemes including lease cars and Cycle to Work
