Job Title: Senior Security Engineer – Antimalware (Sheffield or London)
Job Description:
Senior Security Engineer – Antimalware (London or Sheffield)
Big Bank Funding. FinTech Thinking.
Our technology teams in the UK work closely with HSBC’s global businesses to help design and build digital services that allow our millions of customers around the world, to bank quickly, simply and securely. We also run and manage our IT infrastructure, data centres and core banking systems that power the world’s leading international bank.
Our multi-disciplined teams include: DevOps engineers, IT architects, front and back end developers, infrastructure specialists, cyber experts, as well as project and programme managers.
We work in small, agile DevOps teams with colleagues around the world from our offices at the Bluefin Building in Southwark, our global headquarters in Canary Wharf, and multiple other locations around the UK including Sheffield, Leeds, Barnsley and Birmingham.
Following extensive investment across our Technology and Digital domains and with plans for continued expansion throughout 2020 and beyond, we are currently seeking a number of experienced Security Engineers to join HSBC Technology.
Brief overview
The Senior Security Engineer (Antimalware) will be a member of the Global Cybersecurity Technology team. This team is responsible for identifying, developing and deploying global cybersecurity controls across the estate leveraging the firm’s assets, network and data to identify threats. This role will partner heavily with IT Infrastructure Delivery (ITID) and support the end-to-end secure deployment of security technologies across the firm as well as leading and attracting talent to build a world class team.
What you will be doing;
The role, focusing on Antimalware Engineering, will be accountable for the following:
Reviewing, analyzing and documenting the current baseline and developing the target technology posture.
Performing gap analysis of the current baseline against the target architecture.
Evaluating, developing and applying appropriate tools to capture, analyze and model various viewpoints of the domain architecture.
Defining metrics and methodologies to measure domain performance of applying new technologies.
Reviewing, designing and re-engineering domain processes with new technologies and solutions to improve domain performance.
Providing centralized, global cybersecurity services to the organization and reducing associated costs
Operating a first line of defense to ensure compliance with IT requirements
Providing thought leadership, consultation and subject matter expertise to the organization on Cybersecurity/Antimalware issues
Implementing and maintaining an effective engagement model across all regions, global businesses, and global functions.
Researching, engaging, and managing third party vendors where relevant to support functional objectives.
Working with security start-ups, as well as more established companies, to support design partnerships and shape product/service offerings to meet the requirements of the bank.
Providing thought leadership to the function and broader Cybersecurity organization, driving transformational change and capability uplift across the bank.
Collaborating with various layers of management across Cybersecurity and other IT teams to develop solutions that protect the organization.
Design and drive the implementation of service offerings, capability uplifts, and process improvements to protect the bank for a continuously changing threat landscape.

Qualifications
What you will bring to the role;
Extensive experience in information security, preferably focused on endpoint security and antimalware controls and solutions
Demonstrable experience as both an individual contributor and lead implementing and managing endpoint/antimalware security solutions
Experience working cross-functionally to achieve desired outcomes and goals, including working with subject matter experts and leads for other domains/controls to implement security solutions that effectively reduce risk
Experience working with business partners to understand and evaluate cybersecurity requirements and ensuring security solutions best meet those requirements while reducing risk for the organisation
Detailed understanding of current security risks, vulnerabilities, and mitigations for common desktop and server operating systems, as well as knowledge of security best practices and common controls/security products
Broad understanding of common network, application, and cloud security controls
Detailed knowledge of networking, operating system, and application development fundamentals, particularly with regard to security of and threats to associated technologies, solutions, and products
Extensive experience with securing endpoints, and supporting, and integrating security products in large networks/environments
Demonstrated ability to perform complex troubleshooting and problem analysis as well as mitigation in large environments and at scale
Extensive experience in evaluating and selecting security products given business/technology needs and goals, including requirements gathering, testing, and working with multiple vendors
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with demonstrated experience in interacting with technical leaders and various layers of management
Demonstrated experience in mentoring and offering guidance to team members
Demonstrated ability automating common information security tasks in scripting environments/languagues such as Python, Perl, or similar.
Ability to build connections and work collaboratively within and across teams and boundaries
Willingness to continuously learn and share knowledge with other
This role will be London or Sheffield based but some travel may be required .

Come Power a Business that Defines How to Power the World
As a business operating in markets all around the world, we believe diversity brings benefits for our customers, our business and our people. This is why HSBC UK is committed to being an inclusive employer and encourages applications from all suitably qualified applicants irrespective of background, circumstances, age, disability, gender identity, ethnicity, religion or belief and sexual orientation.
We want everyone to be able to fulfil their potential which is why we provide a range of flexible working arrangements and family friendly policies.
As an HSBC employee in the UK, you will have access to tailored professional development opportunities and a competitive pay and benefits package. This includes private healthcare for all UK-based employees, enhanced maternity and adoption pay and support when you return to work, and a contributory pension scheme with a generous employer contribution.
Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website.

Location
Blackpool, Leeds, London, Manchester, Newcastle-upon-Tyne, Sheffield
About the job
Summary
The Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) is responsible for welfare, pensions and child maintenance policy. As the UK’s biggest public service department, we operate on a scale that is almost unmatched anywhere in Europe and most people in Britain come into contact with us at some point in their lives.

DWP Estates Directorate are accountable for the delivery of all aspects of real estate services and the work we do is critical in ensuring the vital work that the Department undertakes is enabled effectively. The DWP commercial estate is the largest within Government and our diverse national property portfolio reflects this scale. It is a unique mix ranging from modern corporate centres, multi-occupied Service Centres, to its frontline high street services.

We are responsible for the Department’s 800+ workplaces, that provide workplaces for 85,000 employees and a UK wide presence for all those that visit us. Ultimately, the Department relies on us to provide safe and secure buildings that are fit for purpose and meet the needs of the business. The work you will be undertaking is therefore crucial in us meeting the needs of all those who use our services.

This role supports the Compliance Manager in the development and approval of the DWP Estates Directorate physical security requirements and policies. The role will own the overall estates business requirements for Data & Digital Security. The role will be the DWP estates policy lead for Data & Digital Security policies and processes including ensuring implementation through suppliers of new, approved Business Continuity and Security process and policies across the DWP Estate. It will enforce regulations in all aspects across the business as well as provide guidance on compliance matters, preserving the Authorities integrity by making sure it stays on a lawful and ethical course
Job description
Key accountabilities

• Develop, implement and maintain the DWP Estates business requirements for data and digital security, collaborating with Operations, Digital and Security and Resilience stakeholders to ensure delivery of professional excellence.
• Identify DWP requirements for specialist security technical input, in particular digital security system advice required from any Digital stakeholder e.g. systems access or system requirements for a new supplier.
• Working in partnership with DWP Security and DWP Digital to coordinate the Estates involvement in the National Security Review, reviewing the relevant security of data where appropriate and in relation to DWP Estate.
• Ownership and approval of Estates Security policy and procedures, understanding own level of responsibility and empower others to make decisions where appropriate.
• Work in partnership with colleagues across Policy and Compliance, in particular the Risk Manager, to inform and mitigate risk or security issues on a proactive basis, collaborating to share information, resources and support.
• Foster a culture of One Team across the supplier network, working in partnership in particular with the Integrator, to ensure a collaborative and effective environment.
• Contribute to projects as required and necessary, engaging early to assess and understand risks and where resolution responsibility lies; coordinate with the supplier partners and wider Estates team to ensure the appropriate response.
• Represent DWP Estates on required projects relating to security.
• Evaluate the efficiency of controls and improve them continuously, encouraging ideas for change from a wide range of sources whilst taking managed risks by fully considering the varied impacts changes could have on the diverse range of end users.
• Implement all Business Continuity and Security process and policies across the DWP Estate, communicating with clear purpose and respectfully, taking into consideration the diversity of interests.
• Engage with the Departmental Security Office to coordinate national threat levels, and encourage joined up team work with the wider Estates function and supplier partners on evaluating an appropriate response.
• Manage the communication cascade chain of an event to ensure immediate threat escalation, whether national or localised threat, sharing information as appropriate to maximise understanding and impact.
• Work closely with Operational Excellence to ensure the Business Operating System is appropriate, updated and meets the needs for Security Policy and Compliance Management.

Responsibilities
Essential Skills, Knowledge & Experience

• Demonstrable knowledge and experience of data & digital security standards, policies and regulation.
• Proven experience in a similar business relations and Compliance role, in particular the area of security business requirements, Business Continuity and Security policies and procedures
• Proven security or risk event management in the cascade and coordination across a large portfolio
• Proven track record of formulating and implementing security and compliance management strategies and operating practices
• Works effectively and in partnership with supplier partners and subject matter experts to ensure best and appropriate course of action
• Experience of working with key stakeholders and customers
• Methodical and diligent with outstanding planning abilities
• An analytical mind with the ability to take a broad overview of the complexities and procedures and regulations

Leadership attributes and behaviours

• Show a positive approach to keeping the whole team’s efforts focussed whilst aligning activities to contribute to wider organisation priorities.
• Works with others to identify areas for improvement and simplify processes to use fewer resources.
• Identify capability gaps, and continuously seek and act on feedback to improve own and teams’ performance.
• Uses sound judgement, evidence and knowledge to arrive at accurate, expert and professional decisions and advice.
• Encourage joined up teamwork within own team and across other groups, including supplier partners, sharing information appropriately and building professional relationships.
• Takes ownership for results by working to agreed goals and activities and dealing with challenges in a responsive and constructive way.
• Display confidence when making difficult decisions, whilst understanding own level of responsibility and empowering others to make decisions as appropriate.
• Communicates with clarity, integrity and enthusiasm.
• Plans, organises and manages times and activities effectively to deliver high quality performance.

Qualifications/professional memberships

Desirable

• Working towards IWFM (Levels 4-5), or preference if held
• Diploma in Security (BTEC) or similar preferred
Behaviours
We'll assess you against these behaviours during the selection process:
Seeing the Big Picture
Making Effective Decisions
Working Together
Managing a Quality Service
Benefits
• Learning and development tailored to your role
• An environment with flexible working options
• A culture encouraging inclusion and diversity
• A Civil Service pension
Things you need to know
Security
Successful candidates must pass a disclosure and barring security check.
People working with government assets must complete basic personnel security standard checks.
Selection process details
This vacancy is using Success Profiles, and will assess your Behaviours, Strengths and Experience.
STAGE 1 - APPLICATION & SIFT

As part of the application process you will be asked to provide a Personal Statement against the essential criteria as outlined above. You will also be asked to provide a short CV.

Your CV should be fairly short and just evidence very brief details of your work history and experience.

Please do not submit a speculative application where you do not meet at least 50% of the essential criteria as these applications will be unsuccessful. Do not include competency examples within your application as these will not be assessed in the sift and will only be used at interview stage.

Further details around what this will entail are listed on the application form.

There will be an initial sift of applications based on the Personal Statement only, so please ensure you evidence how you meet the Essential Skills, Knowledge & Experience requirement contained in the vacancy in this section. This will form a short list for interview.

STAGE 2 - INTERVIEW

All candidates who are successful at the sift stage will undertake a single virtual video interview.

The interview will follow a blended approach which will help us assess candidates Behaviours and Strengths.

The sift will take place w/c 26 October and interview dates will be w/c 16 November. Due to the current situation with COVID19 the interviews are scheduled to take place virtually.

Further information:

If you are experiencing accessibility problems with any attachments on this advert, please contact the email address in the 'Contact point for applicants' section.

A reserve list may be held for a period of 6 months from which further appointments can be made.

New entrants are expected to join on the minimum of the pay band.

If successful and transferring from another Government Department a criminal record check may be carried out.

Any move to DWP will mean you will no longer be able to carry on claiming childcare vouchers. You will however have access to the governments Tax Free Childcare scheme.

Reasonable adjustment
If a person with disabilities is put at a substantial disadvantage compared to a non-disabled person, we have a duty to make reasonable changes to our processes.

If you need a change to be made so that you can make your application, you should:

Contact Government Recruitment Service via DWPRecruitment.grs@cabinetoffice.gov.uk as soon as possible before the closing date to discuss your needs.

Complete the “Assistance required” section in the “Additional requirements” page of your application form to tell us what changes or help you might need further on in the recruitment process. For instance, you may need wheelchair access at interview, or if you’re deaf, a Language Service Professional.

Applicants who are successful at interview will be, as part of pre-employment screening subject to a check on the Internal Fraud Database (IFD). This check will provide information about employees who have been dismissed for fraud or dishonesty offences. This check also applies to employees who resign or otherwise leave before being dismissed for fraud or dishonesty had their employment continued. Any applicant’s details held on the IFD will be refused employment.

A candidate is not eligible to apply for a role within the Civil Service if the application is made within a 5 year period following a dismissal for carrying out internal fraud against government.

In order to process applications without delay, we will be sending a Criminal Record Check to Disclosure and Barring Service on your behalf. However, we recognise in exceptional circumstance some candidates will want to send their completed forms direct. If you will be doing this, please advise Government Recruitment Service of your intention by emailing Pre-EmploymentChecks.grs@cabinetoffice.gov.uk stating the job reference number in the subject heading.

Before applying for this vacancy, current employees of DWP should check whether a successful application would result in changes to their terms & conditions of employment, e.g. mobility, pay, allowances. Civil Servants that would transfer into DWP from other government organisations, following successful application, will assume DWP's terms & conditions of employment current on the day they are posted, unless DWP has stated otherwise in writing.

Feedback will only be provided if you attend an interview or assessment.
Nationality requirements
Open to UK, Commonwealth and European Economic Area (EEA) and certain non EEA nationals. Further information on whether you are able to apply is available here.
Working for the Civil Service
The Civil Service Code sets out the standards of behaviour expected of civil servants.

We recruit by merit on the basis of fair and open competition, as outlined in the Civil Service Commission's recruitment principles.
The Civil Service embraces diversity and promotes equal opportunities. As such, we run a Disability Confident Scheme (DCS) for candidates with disabilities who meet the minimum selection criteria.
Apply and further information
Once this job has closed, the job advert will no longer be available.
You may want to save a copy for your records.
Contact point for applicants
Job contact :
Name : Matt Pepper
Email : matt.pepper@dwp.gov.uk

Recruitment team :

Further information
If you feel your application has not been treated in accordance with these principles and you wish to make a complaint, you should in the first instance contact DWP by email: HR.BUSINESSASSURANCE@DWP.GOV.UK. If you are not satisfied with the response you receive from the Department, you can contact the Civil Service Commission here to visit Civil Service Commission.

The world of technology is in a hugely interesting period of development and modernization, with endless room for innovation and digital progress. It will be a challenging and rewarding journey and we’re keen to hear from individuals wanting to join us!

Company Description
Our Mission

At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:

Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.

We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.

Job Description
Your Career
As our authority in Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud (GCP, and other public cloud environments. You are the “go to” resource for customer interactions that exceed standard Systems Engineering support requirements (we always expect a baseline expertise in all areas from our SE’s but augment them with SME in the advanced or new technology areas.
The Public Cloud Systems Engineering role is a technical role that directly supports sales delivery of quota. You will be measured by your expertise and your ability to lead to customer successes. There is also a requirement for close interaction with Product Management teams, Consulting Engineering teams to ensure that we continue to out-innovate our competition.

Your Impact
Present to customers at all levels in the hierarchy from engineering team members to CIO the solution, benefits, usp’s, etc.
Lead conversations about industry trends and emerging changes to the security landscape to prepare for customer planning
Discuss, with credibility, competitive offers in the marketplace and position ours as the best alternative
Lead and support customer demonstrations that showcase our unique value
Interact locally and remotely with customers in an equally persuasive manner
Help customers adopt Palo Alto Networks cloud offerings
Be the technical voice of Sales for all things related to security and compliance in Public Cloud (Alicloud, AWS, Azure, and GCP)
Be an evangelist to further bring Security, DevOps, and SecOps together (DevSecOps)
Provide technical demos to prospective customers
Write code/scripts as needed or be able to learn if you don’t
Run Proof-of-Value (POVs) to ensure the customers’ requirements are exceeded
Work with Product Management, Consulting Engineering, Technical Marketing, and R&D to build requirements and product features for our large customers and provide feedback from customers
Provide design consultation and standard methodology mentorship for rollout, implementation, and policy conversion during the pre-sales process for strategic opportunities
Take ownership of advanced proof of concept (PoC) testing in strategic accounts
Provide demos for strategic prospects and current accounts in all facets of Palo Alto Networks virtual offerings and integration in existing data center environments
Assist in the training of new Palo Alto Networks SEs in their designated region in installs, customer presentations, and internally-focused deal preparation activities
Provide advanced 'Partner SE' training for updates in the Palo Alto Networks product suite
Help develop relationships with new Born-in-Cloud (BiC) partners who will be critical to win over new top tier customers
Support relationship expansion with top existing partners for Public Cloud

Qualifications
Your Experience
8+ years of experience as a system engineer, solutions architect, or systems integrator
Working knowledge of AWS and/or Microsoft Azure, GCP, other cloud providers, and cloud security models, firewalls, and other security technologies both from a technology and a business driver standpoint
Demonstrable experience in securing cloud environments and cloud systems, including topics around certification and compliance
Experience in DevOps will be an added advantage
Programming experience in a higher-level language such as NodeJS, Ruby, Chef, Puppet, YAML, JSON or Python will be advantageous
Good understanding and expertise of tools such as Ansible, Terraform, CI/CD (Jenkins, GitHub, etc.)
Deep understanding of API based security & compliance standards
Good understanding of Unix/Linux and Windows operating systems and scripting
Demonstrable experience with AWS and/or Microsoft Azure or GCP installation, configuration, and administration of security features and services
Experience with cloud networking models and connectivity, network security, virtualization, and cloud computing
Experience working with customers, positioning, demonstrating, configuring, and fixing network infrastructure security products
Strong communication and presentation skills
Strong problem finding and solving skills, ability to analyze complex multivariate problems and use a systematic approach to gain quick resolution, even under duress
Worked with Channel partners and understand a channel centric go to market approach
Experience from companies in the enterprise networking security space
Experience understanding exploits, malware, ransomware, and etc.: their creation and activation

Additional Information
The Team

As part of our Systems Engineering team, you’ll support the sales team with technical expertise and guidance when establishing trust with key clients. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. As a member of our systems engineer team, you are driven by a solutions-focused sales environment and find fulfillment in working with clients to resolve incredible complex cyberthreats.

Our Commitment

We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.

Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.

The Firm

Stevens & Bolton – making a positive difference
Stevens & Bolton is a UK law firm with around 150 lawyers, approximately a third of them partners, many of whom chose to join us from City law firms. They are people who listen. People who develop a real understanding of your needs, concerns and priorities. People who care deeply about the outcome.
We’ve made excellence the hallmark of our firm: in the clear advice we give, in the enduring relationships we build and in our proactive and highly responsive service.
Our clients are major international organisations, UK FTSE companies, owner managed businesses, entrepreneurs and individuals. Whoever you are, you’ll get unambiguous recommendations based on expertise and insight. Clear advice that tackles your issues with realism and is delivered in language you understand.
With everyone under one roof, actively supporting one another, we work together to ensure you achieve your aims and to give you outstanding value. Always making a positive difference.


The Role

We are looking for great lawyers to join our renowned technology practice. This is a fantastic opportunity to work in a highly professional and dynamic group currently consisting of 14 lawyers. It is your perfect chance to work outside (but close to) London with a work life balance (and avoid the dreaded commute!), whilst advising and assisting on a wide variety of high quality technology projects.
We also recognise that lawyers value the ability to work flexibly - we have agile working policies to facilitate flexible working and whilst this is a full time role, we are happy to consider a minimum of 4 days per week.
What will you be doing?
All members of the team advise on IT contracts, as well as dedicating a significant proportion of their time to commercial law advice and data protection/cyber security matters. There is a particular sector focus on tech businesses, insurance/financial services and life sciences.
So, you can expect to get involved in a fantastic range of work, with an impressive client list that includes well-known brands, multinationals, FTSE 100 corporates as well as owner managed businesses and entrepreneurs. The team (and the wider firm) has a significant focus on international work and much of what we do has a cross border dimension.
Representative recent matters include:
Advising a technology business on its distribution and licensing arrangements in relation to fraud detection software
Advising a global life insurance business on its platform and app-related product distribution arrangements
Providing all required commercial and regulatory advice to a next generation Swedish telecommunications company, providing services across the UK
Advising the central procurement function of one of the world’s largest drinks companies on its commercial arrangements
Advising on the implementation of EU falsified medicines law in the UK, including technology outsourcing agreements and advice on Brexit related implications
Advising on the data protection aspects of international franchise agreements for a well-known retailer of menswear


Qualifications and Experience

We are looking for strong team players with good inter-personal skills, good academics and high quality experience – typically with a major City or leading national/regional practice – who have a commercial approach and excellent technical, communication and negotiation skills.
The range of the work undertaken means we can accommodate a variety of experiences and aspirations: you might be a technology lawyer looking to continue this type of work, a commercial lawyer who wishes to develop specialist legal or sector expertise, or a specialist regulatory lawyer looking to broaden your practice to a wider variety of sectors or work types.

Department Overview
The IT Support Engineer is responsible for maintaining the availability and delivery of the Infrastructure within the IT function. This is delivered as part of a 24/7/365 support model underpinning the delivery of all associated services and service levels in line with contractual performance levels.

Job Description


Please Note this role is a 12 Month FTC with the option to Work From Home.
Support the operation of IT Infrastructure from the VMWare virtualisation layer up through the Windows operating system and associated applications and tools
ensuring they are patched in line with support and security requirements
ensuring they are monitored and managed to meet required performance and capacity levels
ensuring they are resilient and available to underpin the business defined uptime SLAs
as a 3rd line specialist, support the diagnosis and resolution of complex technical issues escalated via 2nd line support or directly through analysis of the system performance and behaviour
Develop existing and new services to meet business requirements
Propose and develop continuous improvement plans for existing services

At Motorola Solutions, we create technologies our customers refer to as their lifeline. Location
Blackpool, Leeds, London, Manchester, Newcastle-upon-Tyne, Sheffield
About the job
Summary
The Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) is responsible for welfare, pensions and child maintenance policy. As the UK’s biggest public service department, we operate on a scale that is almost unmatched anywhere in Europe and most people in Britain come into contact with us at some point in their lives.

DWP Estates Directorate are accountable for the delivery of all aspects of real estate services and the work we do is critical in ensuring the vital work that the Department undertakes is enabled effectively. The DWP commercial estate is the largest within Government and our diverse national property portfolio reflects this scale. It is s a unique mix ranging from modern corporate centres, multi-occupied Service Centres, to its frontline high street services.

We are responsible for the Department’s 800+ workplaces, that provide workplaces for 85,000 employees and a UK wide presence for all those that visit us. Ultimately, the Department relies on us to provide safe and secure buildings that are fit for purpose and meet the needs of the business. The work you will be undertaking is therefore crucial in us meeting the needs of all those who use our services.

The senior management role plays a significant part in delivery of services to our customers on a day to day basis. As a security and supply chain specialist, you will lead on BAU services supplied to buildings, liaising with the supply chain to ensure best practice and innovation as well as security transformation delivery across the Estate. There is an expectation that you will lead a team, working with our Integrator and supply chain leads to deliver a One team approach to delivering requirements
Job description
Key accountabilities

• Lead, develop, implement and maintain the DWP estates Service Delivery business requirements for physical security in the Estate, collaborating with the business, operations, security, compliance and resilience stakeholders to ensure delivery of professional services
• Lead on developing relationships with DWP Service Delivery supply chain leads to ensure best practice and service from our supply chain
• Lead on the Compliance process with the Physical Security Team and G4S to ensure all Security Team Risk Assessment requirements are appropriate to need and costed and supplied accordingly
• Manage the relationship for Service Delivery with DWP commercial teams regarding supply chain contract changes and improvements
• Work with supply chain to encourage change and innovation
• Work in partnership with DWP Service Delivery Security teams to coordinate the Estates involvement in the National Security Review, reviewing and ensuring the relevant security within buildings, both in terms of physical security and access control systems where appropriate and in relation to DWP
• Take the lead for DWP in managing security and supply chain projects (Security Transformation) as required and necessary, engaging early to assess the project outputs, manage the risks and where resolution responsibility lies; manage the PMO, the supplier partners and wider Estates teams to ensure the required outputs
• Represent DWP Estates on required Service Delivery projects relating to Operational security, that are government wide
• Evaluate the efficiency of Performance Monitoring System, SLA’s and KPI controls and improve them continuously across the supply chain encouraging ideas for change from a wide range of sources
• Ensure appropriate governance escalating and reporting structures are in place across the supply chain
• Manage stakeholder engagement /comms on all supply chain areas of responsibility
• Manage a culture of One Team across the supplier network, working in partnership in particular with the Integrator, to ensure a collaborative and effective environment
• Identify DWP requirements for Operational specialist security technical input, in particular security system advice required from the Security Technical Advisor

Responsibilities
Essential Skills, Knowledge & Experience

• Proven senior management experience in a similar business relations role
• Demonstrable knowledge and experience with security requirements, Integrator and supplier engagement across a large and complex portfolio
• Proven security knowledge of security systems, security risk assessment and manned guarding
• Proven track record of formulating and implementing security strategies and operating practices
• Managing effective partnerships with all supplier partners and subject matter experts to ensure best and appropriate course of action
• Proven senior management responsibility for contract mobilisation
• Senior management experience of working with key stakeholders and customers
• Knowledge of the FM industries standards. policies and regulation within the Civil Service
• Extensive knowledge of managing risk at a senior level
• An analytical mind with the ability to take a broad overview of the complexities and procedures and regulations
• Extensive, proven change management experience with a large complex estate

Leadership attributes and behaviours

• Works collaboratively by sharing information appropriately and building supportive, trusting and professional relationships with a wide range of people within and outside the Civil Service
• Remain alert to emerging issues and trends which might impact your work area, identifying risks and resolving issues efficiently
• Clearly explain the reasons for and manages change with colleagues and how to implement them, supporting individuals with different needs to adapt to change
• Uses sound judgement, evidence and knowledge to arrive at accurate, expert and professional decisions and advice, displaying confidence when making difficult decisions
• Continuously develops their knowledge and skills through a strong focus on personal development, reflecting on work, continuously seek and act on feedback to improve performance
• Manages the team to take ownership for results by working to agreed goals and activities and dealing with challenges in a responsive and constructive way
• Is open to change and regularly seeks out opportunities to work in ‘smarter’, more focused ways and deliver a better service for stakeholders
• Communicates with clarity, integrity and enthusiasm encouraging others to do the same
• Plans, organises and manages times and activities effectively to deliver high quality performance

Qualifications/professional memberships

Desirable

• Working towards IWFM (Levels 5-6), with a preference already held or
• Working towards Diploma in Security (BTEC) or similar preferred
• H&S qualification ( IOSH or NEBOSH preferred)
Behaviours
We'll assess you against these behaviours during the selection process:
Leadership
Communicating and Influencing
Working Together
Delivering at Pace
Benefits
• Learning and development tailored to your role
• An environment with flexible working options
• A culture encouraging inclusion and diversity
• A Civil Service pension
Things you need to know
Security
Successful candidates must pass a disclosure and barring security check.
People working with government assets must complete basic personnel security standard checks.
Selection process details
This vacancy is using Success Profiles, and will assess your Behaviours, Strengths and Experience.
STAGE 1 - APPLICATION & SIFT

As part of the application process you will be asked to provide a Personal Statement against the essential criteria as outlined above. You will also be asked to provide a short CV.

Your CV should be fairly short and just evidence very brief details of your work history and experience.
Please do not submit a speculative application where you do not meet at least 50% of the essential criteria as these applications will be unsuccessful. Do not include competency examples within your application as these will not be assessed in the sift and will only be used at interview stage.

Further details around what this will entail are listed on the application form.

There will be an initial sift of applications based on the Personal Statement only, so please ensure you evidence how you meet the Essential Skills, Knowledge & Experience requirement contained in the vacancy in this section. This will form a short list for interview.

STAGE 2 - INTERVIEW

All candidates who are successful at the sift stage will undertake a single virtual video interview.

The interview will follow a blended approach which will help us assess candidates Behaviours and Strengths.

The sift will take place w/c 19 October and interview dates will be w/c 2 November. Due to the current situation with COVID19 the interviews are scheduled to take place virtually.

Further Information:
If successful and transferring from another Government Department a criminal record check may be carried out.

New entrants are expected to join on the minimum of the pay band.

Any move to DWP will mean you will no longer be able to carry on claiming childcare vouchers. You will however have access to the governments Tax Free Childcare scheme.

A reserve list may be held for a period of 6 months from which further appointments can be made.

In order to process applications without delay, we will be sending a Criminal Record Check to Disclosure and Barring Service on your behalf. However, we recognise in exceptional circumstance some candidates will want to send their completed forms direct. If you will be doing this, please advise Government Recruitment Service of your intention by emailing Pre-EmploymentChecks.grs@cabinetoffice.gov.uk stating the job reference number in the subject heading.

Applicants who are successful at interview will be, as part of pre-employment screening subject to a check on the Internal Fraud Database (IFD). This check will provide information about employees who have been dismissed for fraud or dishonesty offences. This check also applies to employees who resign or otherwise leave before being dismissed for fraud or dishonesty had their employment continued. Any applicant’s details held on the IFD will be refused employment.

A candidate is not eligible to apply for a role within the Civil Service if the application is made within a 5 year period following a dismissal for carrying out internal fraud against government.

Before applying for this vacancy, current employees of DWP should check whether a successful application would result in changes to their terms & conditions of employment, e.g. mobility, pay, allowances. Civil Servants that would transfer into DWP from other government organisations, following successful application, will assume DWP's terms & conditions of employment current on the day they are posted, unless DWP has stated otherwise in writing.

Reasonable adjustment:
If a person with disabilities is put at a substantial disadvantage compared to a non-disabled person, we have a duty to make reasonable changes to our processes.

If you need a change to be made so that you can make your application, you should:
Contact Government Recruitment Service via dwprecruitment.grs@cabinetoffice.gov.uk as soon as possible before the closing date to discuss your needs.
Complete the “Assistance required” section in the “Additional requirements” page of your application form to tell us what changes or help you might need further on in the recruitment process. For instance, you may need wheelchair access at interview, or if you’re deaf, a Language Service Professional.
If you are experiencing accessibility problems with any attachments on this advert, please contact the email address in the 'Contact point for applicants' section.

Feedback will only be provided if you attend an interview or assessment.
Nationality requirements
Open to UK, Commonwealth and European Economic Area (EEA) and certain non EEA nationals. Further information on whether you are able to apply is available here.
Working for the Civil Service
The Civil Service Code sets out the standards of behaviour expected of civil servants.

We recruit by merit on the basis of fair and open competition, as outlined in the Civil Service Commission's recruitment principles.
The Civil Service embraces diversity and promotes equal opportunities. As such, we run a Disability Confident Scheme (DCS) for candidates with disabilities who meet the minimum selection criteria.

Job Title: Senior Executive (Manager) - Cyber - Transaction Strategy and Execution (IT) - EY Parthenon - London
Job Description:
Senior Executive (Manager) (IT) (Cyber) Transaction Strategy and Execution – EY Parthenon

EY-Parthenon’s Transaction Strategy and Execution (TSE) team is the leading Strategy and Operations business in the EMEA region, providing advice to corporate and private equity firms who intend to acquire, divest or restructure businesses. The team comprises advisors with specialist commercial, operations, IT and deal / transaction experience from industry, advisory and audit backgrounds.

The opportunity

Due to increased traction in the market and deal flow we are now looking to expand our Cybersecurity Transactions team. You will be exclusively focussed on supporting transactions from a Cybersecurity perspective pre deal and post deal working primarily with Private Equity and Corporate clients executing deal mandates.


What we are looking for


We are looking for an energetic professional with an in-depth understanding of a wide range of cybersecurity technical and operational aspects who will have a focus on M&A (pre-deal due diligence and post-deal integrations/separations/carve out). You’ll be a trusted business consultant to our clients and use your deep knowledge of multiple Cyber security technologies to work closely to their needs. Your proven project management and stakeholder management experience will be key to the role. If you’re ready to take on a wide range of responsibilities and are committed to seeking out new ways to make a difference, this role is for you.
Your key responsibilities

As a Cyber Senior Executive within Transaction, Strategy and Execution, you will be a vital member of the Cyber team advising clients across all industries and sectors. You will work in a transaction environment operating under tight M&A timeframes and demands, supporting key decision makers in developing and executing strategies for transactions. You will also assist in aspects of business origination, including pitches and presentations, and attending meetings with clients to generate new business opportunities.
Skills and attributes for success
Have a broad knowledge range across information security and cyber defence
Have a strong desire to work in a M&A environment operating across the transaction lifecycle
Develop experience in a range of different type of engagements, including pre-deal (e.g operational cyber due-diligence, carve-out planning), post-deal (e.g integration planning, tracking) and restructuring (e.g. rapid cost reduction)
Be familiar with working in a large-scale consulting environment or industry role where you can demonstrate the ability to perform and summarise Cyber analysis into management insights and recommended actions at pace
Lead work-streams comprising of clients and colleagues from our transactions and advisory practices
Lead meetings with senior client stakeholders to advise, shape and drive the strategy and planning for pre-deal diligence, integration, carve-out/separation and operational restructuring.
Ability to work on high-profile projects, challenging requirements and in a fast-paced environment
Act as a role model and support development of junior team members, coupled with recruitment and training responsibilities
Be flexible to support on broader IT & Operational transaction work not necessarily related to cyber security
Take ownership for Quality and Risk Management (Q&RM) to ensure client work is delivered consistently and in compliance with EY’s quality standards
Manage internal practice development including development of tools, accelerators, methodologies and market propositions

To qualify for the role you must have
A technical background in Computer Science, Network engineering with a BSc or Masters in a technical subject in the field (Cybersecurity, Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar). A PhD or MBA is a plus but relevant experience will be considered.
Strong written and verbal communication skills and experience of producing and reviewing high calibre reports, papers, presentations and thought leadership.
A track record of successful project delivery in corporate businesses where you are responsible for managing project team members and vendors
Have a broad range of IT experience including, infrastructure, applications, databases and networks
Have deep knowledge of Cyber Security risks, controls and governance within corporate environments and how these support and can enhance business operations


Ideally, you’ll also have
Demonstrable evidence of personal development in cyber security, such as maintaining a blog, writing articles, contributing to open source projects, undertaking a personal project etc.
Knowledge of data protection regulations including EU GDPR/UK DPA as well as industry standards and frameworks such as OWASP, PCI, ISO27001, NIST and SANS Critical controls.
Experience in supporting sales and business development processes for professional services projects in a large-scale consulting environment
Experience in providing Cyber Security advice within multiple transactions, spanning a broad range of industry sectors, providing deal-relevant points of view and recommendations to clients leveraging your Cyber and IT experience.
Client facing consulting or contractor experience
About EY Parthenon

EY-Parthenon teams work with clients to navigate complexity by helping them to reimagine their eco-systems, reshape their portfolios and reinvent themselves for a better future. With global connectivity and scale, EY-Parthenon teams focus on Strategy Realized — helping CEOs design and deliver strategies to better manage challenges while maximizing opportunities as they look to transform their businesses. From idea to implementation, EY-Parthenon teams help organizations to build a better working world by fostering long-term value. EY-Parthenon is a brand under which a number of EY member firms across the globe provide strategy consulting services. For more information, please visit ey.com/parthenon.
What working at EY offers


We offer a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working and career development, and with FlexEY you can select benefits that suit your needs, covering holidays, health and well-being, insurance, savings and a wide range of discounts, offers and promotions. Plus, we offer:
Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you


Who we are

EY is committed to being an inclusive employer and we are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. We strive to achieve the right balance for our people, enabling us to deliver excellent client service whilst allowing you to build your career without sacrificing your personal priorities. While our client-facing professionals can be required to travel regularly, and at times be based at client sites, our flexible working arrangements can help you to achieve a lifestyle balance.
Please note: Prior to finalizing your application, you will be asked to provide personal information across several dimensions of diversity and inclusiveness. The information you provide is kept entirely confidential and will not be used to evaluate your candidacy. We collect this data to help us analyse our recruitment process holistically and implement actions that promote diversity and inclusiveness. While optional, we encourage you to provide this information to hold us accountable towards our goal of building a better working world. We ask because it matters!

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Join us in building a better working world.

Microsoft Cloud Engineer / Infrastructure Specialist. Contract 4 months £300 per day. Outside of IR35.
Duties: Perform technical administration, technical implementation of infrastructure projects, low level design, maintenance functions and documentation creation for Microsoft infrastructure services.
Design, administration and continual improvement of Microsoft services including; Azure, Active Directory, Office 365, Intune, Windows operating systems (server and desktop), Hyper-V, Microsoft Dynamics and System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM).
The role will also contribute into the Continual Service Improvement of services.
Technical governance to ensure operation and continual improvement of IT services.
Responsible for enacting work to bring Microsoft infrastructure to a high level or resilience, flexibility and efficient operation, and then maintain that status.
Technical consultation to the IT Programme and projects.
Administrate and continually improve the Microsoft infrastructure services including; Azure, Active Directory, Office 365, Intune, Windows operating systems, Hyper-V, Microsoft Dynamics and SCCM. Including;
oNetworking for the above services. Such as management and administration of ExpressRoute, Azure Networking/Routing, DMZ configuration and best practices, Windows Server networking roles and fundamentals of firewall management.
oOperation of infrastructure services to organisation security standards, maintaining personal security awareness and contributing to security improvement.
Provide expert advice regarding the development and improvement of the Microsoft infrastructure services
MCSA: Windows Server (2012 or 2016) and ITIL Foundation in IT Service Management is essential.

People Source specialise in technology recruitment across niche markets including Information Technology, Digital TV, Digital Marketing, Project and Programme Management, SAP, Digital and Consumer Electronics, Air Traffic Management, Management Consultancy, Business Intelligence, Manufacturing, Telecoms, Public Sector, Healthcare, Finance and Oil & Gas.

Job Description

Do you know how to stop a sophisticated cyber threat? So do we.

Digital disruption is opening up more opportunities for businesses to connect with their customers. That's what we'd love you to do for us.

ABOUT YOU

As a certified Cloud Security Architect you offer clients the kind of security that will help them sleep well at night. You’re a creative problem solver, always thinking ahead and spotting risks. Like a digital detective, you uncover and prevent cyber threats to protect businesses from risks they may not even know they face. You’re as happy to work independently as you are supporting junior colleagues. Working in a true consultancy role, you need to be happy and flexible to travel.

ABOUT THE JOB

As a Cloud Security Architect with previous consulting background, you’ll be:

- defending information, critical infrastructure applications and key business processes against cyber threats.

- examine and tackle complex problems in project work, while supporting new business initiatives and solutions.

- work closely with hardworking and skilled leadership and colleagues across the our business and from client locations.

YOUR SKILLS

- You know all about security operations, networking, application services, databases and storage solutions, and love working with Microsoft applications. You have deep technical know-how and experience in designing and implementing Cloud Security solutions, Microsoft Azure Security technologies, including the broader areas of Microsoft Windows security and Microsoft Enterprise, Mobility and Security suite.

- The role will involve delivering throughout the project lifecycle and you are comfortable with performing advisory engagements, which involves taking the client on a journey from their current mode of operation to their future method of working.

- You are specialist in performing discovery and analysis of a client’s current and target state. You are able to design broad security solutions that protect, detect and respond to threats. You are building and integrating the security solutions within the client’s environment, writing and executing test scripts. You are ensuring the successful deployment and go live of the solutions and transitioning them to support providers.

Note: We are not able to accept applications from those requiring Visa/Work permit sponsorship. Applicants must already be eligible to live and work in UK.

SOME OF THE BENEFITS WE OFFER:

- Private Medical Cover, Income Protection Policy, Extended benefits, Bonus, 80 hours per annum studying towards Microsoft Certifications, generous pension and much more!

- Avanade University – real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally

- Dedicated career advisor to encourage your progression

- Engaged and helpful coworkers genuinely interested in you

ABOUT AVANADE

Avanade leads in providing innovative digital services, business solutions and design-led experiences for its clients, delivered through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. Our professionals combine technology, business and industry expertise to build and deploy solutions to realize results for clients and their customers. Avanade has 36,000 digitally connected people across 24 countries, bringing clients the best thinking through a collaborative culture that honors diversity and reflects the communities in which we operate. Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at http://www.avanade.com/

Avanade® is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We evaluate applicants without regard to race, colour, age, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, veteran, military or marital status, genetic information or any other protected status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Job Title: Cloud Applications and Infrastructure Specialist (SaaS Ops)
Job Description:
Cloud Applications and Infrastructure Specialist
(SaaS Ops)
UK


WHO WE ARE

FinancialForce delivers the #1 professional services automation (PSA) and the only customer-centric ERP solution. We accelerate business value with comprehensive best practices and the most intelligent analytics—all on the leading business cloud platform from Salesforce.

FinancialForce knows that each individual brings something special to the team, exemplifying a diverse and inclusive work environment. We embrace your authenticity and encourage our employees to “Bring Yourself” to work every day!

THE ROLE

Focussed on excellent customer service for your colleagues at FinancialForce, you will design, build and maintain the internal SaaS/IaaS infrastructure used to support the global IT Operations service delivery. You will be able to architect IT systems to meet business goals, 100% in the cloud. You will run projects that drive IT improvement, new service delivery and continuously improve the security baseline of the FinancialForce internal infrastructure. You will use metrics to understand the health of the infrastructure, predict potential problems and support compliance goals. You will have a strong technical mindset with logical problem solving and a methodical approach to resolving IT challenges.

WHAT YOU WILL DO IN THIS ROLE
Design, build and operate the internal IT cloud infrastructure
Configure SaaS applications, with a focus on automation, scale, interoperability and security
Plan IT projects and execute on tasks as assigned by the Senior IT Manager, focused on improving the cloud infrastructure or computer usability and security
Support and deliver the IT security compliance objectives for FinancialForce
Use Splunk to monitor and maintain the health of the IT cloud infrastructure
Share knowledge and best practice with members of the IT team
Maintain Cloud application user directories
Document procedural and operational instructions on Wiki’s.
Maintain excellent communication with all end users and within the IT team
Point of escalation for technical issues with the cloud infrastructure
Work with vendor support desks as needed.
Deliver service excellence
WHAT YOU NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL IN THIS ROLE
Experienced in supporting SaaS applications and IT infrastructure in a medium to large enterprise environment.
Experience of configuring and supporting an MDM solution, preferably Vmware WorkSpace One, to manage both macOS and Windows laptops
Experience with using SAML/SSO/Oauth to provide a seamless authentication experience, across a wide range of SaaS applications.
Experienced in planning and executing on projects, on time and to specification
Have a good understanding of best of breed SaaS applications such as GSuite, Docusign, Lucidchart, Zoom and Slack.
Proficient in recognising, analysing, and effectively solving problems in a timely and organised manner, using industry best practices and procedures
Excellent knowledge of macOS and Windows
Experience with bash and powershell scripting
Intermediate knowledge of TCP/IP networking, and related network services (i.e. DNS, SMTP, DHCP, etc)
Intermediate knowledge with scripting languages for macOS and Windows OS
WHAT ELSE WOULD BE GREAT
Experience with an Incident Management solution such as Zendesk or Service Cloud
Experience in supporting and building AWS Infrastructure
Experience in supporting and building Google Cloud Infrastructure
Experience in supporting and building Microsoft Azure/O365 Infrastructure
Experience in using a SIEM solution, ideally Splunk
Knowledge of Node.js for writing REST API integrations
Knowledge of IaaS technology, preferably AWS
Knowledge of Salesforce
Knowledge of ISO27001 or SOC2 (Type II) certifications
We are committed to equality of opportunity for all; applications from individuals are encouraged regardless of age, disability, gender, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships.

Job Title: Senior Consultant - Cyber Security - Identity and Access Management
Job Description:
Senior Consultant, Cybersecurity -Identity and Access Management

Want to be part of a market leading Cyber practice?

Cybersecurity is one of the most important risks facing businesses today. As the reliance on technology grows, the risks increase also. Our clients are overwhelmingly turning to EY for help and guidance on how to protect their assets, minimise business disruption and improve security as they continue to exploit technology and the Internet of things (IoT).

Identity and Access Management (IAM) is a fundamental capability of Cybersecurity. The effective management of digital identities can reduce cyber risk, improve productivity and enhance the way businesses interact with their customers.

The opportunity

At EY, we have large-scale plans to expand our already market leading Cybersecurity practice and anticipate continued growth throughout the next five years. We need excellent people to join us and be part of our exciting growth start.

Being part of a dynamic, growing organisation offers an exciting career path full of opportunity. EY’s UK Cyber practice is part of a global cyber team of over 1600 professionals focused on delivering cutting edge information security assessment, security transformation programmes, cyber threat management, IAM, data protection and privacy, and resilience

services. We are part of a wider consulting organisation that collectively comprises a $7.5b and growing global consulting practice with 50,000 professionals. With an overall global Consulting market of $150b, there’s tremendous potential for growth, and we’re tapping into that potential.
Your key responsibilities

As an IAM specialist in our UK Cybersecurity practice, you will be working within the IAM and wider Cybersecurity domains. You will have exposure to delivering IAM improvement through strategy and review work and will have worked in teams to deliver IAM implementations or run operational services. We don’t expect you to have formal experience of market facing business development activity, but you will be expected to identify opportunities where IAM people, processes or technology require improvement to strengthen security.

You will have responsibility for:
Working across a portfolio of IAM related cyber engagements with our clients, reporting to a Manager responsible for the day to day completion of IAM improvement work
Working with team members, you will design and/or build solutions within large transformations
Performing reviews, assessments and building strategies for organisations looking to invest in IAM
Where possible, you will identify opportunities for EY to assist our clients further and escalate these potential areas to the engagement manager
Establishing and building a network of contacts across EY and peer networks within our clients
Assisting the engagement manager with the planning and delivery phases of engagements
Contributing to the creation of proposals and marketing material
Ensuring your work is delivered on time and on budget
Contributing to the development of the existing Cybersecurity team by sharing knowledge, setting an example, and helping team members to develop
Travel may be required 25% - 50% of the time
Skills and attributes for success

A background within security and technology with experience in the following areas is required:
Project management
Exposure across one or more of the following: Identity Governance; Access Management; Privileged Access Management; Consumer Identity
Working with one or more of the following IAM technologies: SailPoint; CyberArk; Azure; ForgeRock; Oracle; CA; IBM; Saviynt
Business analysis experience such as requirements gathering and modelling use cases
Business development experience supporting new business offerings
Security strategy, assessment, and design and implementation
Governance frameworks over processes, controls, organisation and infrastructure
To qualify for the role you must have
2+ years of experience working within IAM and Cybersecurity
Strong academic record, to degree level in a relevant field, or equivalent industry experience
Project and programme experience
Willingness to travel 25% - 50% of the time
Ideally, you’ll also have

A Big 4 background or comparable management consulting experience is helpful, although EY will provide ongoing training and support to develop your consulting skills. We welcome applicants with industry experience and skills delivering transformation workstreams or security remediation work.

What we look for

Highly motivated and a good communicator, you will need to convey technical content in business language with senior management. You’ll also need to be a team player who is not only looking to enhance your own career but recognises the value in developing others and strengthening the team.

Core consulting skills - Client management on remediation programmes, driving innovation and continuous improvement

Technical skills - IAM technical insight and practical knowledge

Versatility - Proven ability to adapt and learn in an innovative environment
Who we are

EY is committed to being an inclusive employer and we are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. We strive to achieve the right balance for our people, enabling us to deliver excellent client service whilst allowing you to build your career without sacrificing your personal priorities. While our client-facing professionals can be required to travel regularly, and at times be based at client sites, our flexible working arrangements can help you to achieve a lifestyle balance.

What working at EY offers

We offer a competitive remuneration package. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working and career development, and with FlexEY you can select benefits that suit your needs, covering holidays, health and well-being, insurance, savings and a wide range of discounts, offers and promotions. Plus we offer:
Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you
EY is committed to being an inclusive employer and we are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. We strive to achieve the right balance for our people, enabling us to deliver excellent client service whilst allowing you to build your career without sacrificing your personal priorities. While our client-facing professionals can be required to travel regularly, and at times be based at client sites, our flexible working arrangements can help you to achieve a lifestyle balance.
About EY

As a global leader in assurance, consulting, tax, and strategy and transaction services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Join us in building a better working world.
Apply now.

Please note: Prior to finalizing your application, you will be asked to provide personal information across several dimensions of diversity and inclusiveness. The information you provide is kept entirely confidential and will not be used to evaluate your candidacy. We collect this data to help us analyse our recruitment process holistically and implement actions that promote diversity and inclusiveness. While optional, we encourage you to provide this information to hold us accountable towards our goal of building a better working world. We ask because it matters!

As the IT Service Transition Manager, you will have technical input over the entirety of the business IT infrastructure, pursuing development requirements and continuous system improvements. You will be part of a global defence company managing a complex Windows based infrastructure across multiple sites.
Due to the industry sector we can only accept applications from British national and single passport holders who qualify for Security Clearance.

Requirements of the Service Transition Manager:

Stay updated as to new infrastructure requirements and progress, ensuring minimum standards are met.
Predict infrastructure improvement requirements and manage the release process.
Ensure risk is managed effectively, in order to reduce the impact on the business.
Pattern analysis for business activity, defining the service demand.
Knowledge of inputting into the strategy for IT Infrastructure development projects.

Practical knowledge of the IT Service Transition lifecycle processes.
Transition Planning and Support expertise.
Knowledge of Service Validation and Testing.
Release and Deployment Management knowledge.
Service Asset and Configuration Management.
Change Evaluation knowledge.
Additionally, you should have knowledge of IT Technical Aspects, such as; Desktop, Directory Services and Databases, as well as, IT Service Lifecycle Stages, such as; Design and Operations.

To confirm your interest in the position of IT Service Technical Lead, please contact Mary at Informatiq Consulting and start the next stage in your career today!

We are searching for a Platform Security Engineer / DevSecOps.
Please note that this position requires a proven DevOps Engineer, who has extensive experience within Security (DevSecOps)
This 10-month contract will see you working in a team as a sort of incubator within a large company. The company has tens of thousands of employees, however, you will be sitting in this small DevOps team at the forefront of the technological change. 18 months ago the company established this team to revolutionize the way they use technology and as a result they are using the most cutting edge technology available.
They are now entering 'phase two' of their objective, with the main focus being building a global PaaS to be rolled out across the whole company, of which covers three continents. This phase requires you to join the team to lead the security hardening.
Some of the tools you will be working with are as follows: Docker, Kubernetes, AWS, Terraform, Vault, Consul, Keycolak, Fabric8, Jenkins, Git, NGINX, Go, Java/NodeJS, Python, Hubot/CoffeeScript, Openstack… Whilst it is expected that there will be some learning on the job, the client have expressed a desire for a candidate to have a firm grasp and working knowledge on the majority of the tools listed.
This project is one of the largest and highest profile Kubernetes projects in the UK today, it is a great company to get in with who value their Engineers - shown through their flexibility and rates they are willing to pay for the right Engineer.
This is a DevOps role (having emphasis on continuous integration, Docker as container technology and Kubernetes for orchestrated/deployment), having a primary focus on Security.
Some responsibilities will include:
- Being responsible for supporting the security of the client's use of cloud technologies - this will include IaaS, Paas, Saas, automation and orchestration (experience in do so is of paramount importance)
Assessing current security implementations, this includes designing and implementing controls to drastically reduce risk to the client and importantly, it's customers.
Establishing and instilling industry leading standards and practices in security engineering.
Building strong and lasting relationships with DevOps and developer teams and providing security leadership.
This is a fantastic opportunity to work in a team with a start-up feel whilst having the security of working for a large and established company - being at the forefront of DevSecOps. Apply now to find out the full details.
Please note that no terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age, and we confirm that we will gladly accept applications from individuals of any age for this role. UK National Field Based (ideally between London & Manchester)
We provide technical support via phone or email to internal functions (engineers, technicians, and product support personnel) by diagnosing, fixing, repairing and debugging sophisticated electro/mechanical equipment, computer systems, sophisticated software, or networked and/or wireless systems where first-line product support has failed to isolate or fix problems in malfunctioning equipment or software. We repair and/or updates products at the office site (not field).
The applications specialist provides outstanding technical hardware & software support for Beckman Coulter’s customers using our current and upcoming Workflow IT Solutions (WITS) product lines. Key responsibilities
Take ownership of customer issues within the WITS product line(s) and follow problems through to resolution, including updating our CRM (ServiceMax) escalation module for wider organization transparency.
Perform on-site and in-house based training on CIMT and Automation products where required.
Design, present and deliver CIMT software (applications) solutions to meet customer needs and quality expectations. This will include project meetings, scope phase, programming and testing through to go-live support.
Responsible for fully detailing, testing and validating (IQ/OQ) the solution prior to go live and supporting the customer with validation (if required).
Assist in the escalation and escalation management of WITS systems issues including presenting with European colleagues (Business Units and R&D) to fully minimize the customer resolution time.
With coaching, become the face and accountable lead for WITS projects working closely with the Project Managers.
You will assist Call Technical Specialists (CTS) in timely responses of customer queries and be accountable for the timely delivery of product MODS and working with CTS to own the deployment. The right person will attend customer Managed Service reviews where required/advised and build positive relationships with key IT partners within hospitals. Requirements for the position
Knowledge and understanding of laboratory practices, including a background knowledge of clinical chemistry/immunoassay or haematology combined with a sound understanding of quality expectations to BMS level.
The ability to provide remote and on-site customer support for respective WITS product line(s) across the UK and Northern Europe region where required.
Provide Software Applications and preferably, technical support, across the UK and Northern Europe region when required.
Solid understanding of general IT aspects (Networking, Security, HL7, ASTM) and Server/Client relationship concepts.
Experience in the Medical Diagnostics industry, Laboratory BMS experience preferable.
Experience of laboratory IT & ideally Automated solutions.
Relevant degree level qualification or relevant work experience.
You will want to improve customer service experience and build engaged customers by way of developing credible innovative solutions. Strong organisational skills are required for this role as will the flexibility to travel regularly across the UK and abroad when require
(ideally located between London & Manchester)
