Job Title: Head of Security Engineering and Cyber Security
Job Description:
About the team:
Following the merger of Charter Court Financial Services and OneSavings Bank, the IT and InfoSec functions were centralised as Group functions for the new organisation. The newly formed Group IT function is comprised of around 200 IT professionals and Information Security specialists, principally based in Kent, Wolverhampton and a significant capability based in Bangalore, India.
The Information Security team is led by a Group CISO and a mandate to ensure the IT systems and Data Assets as well as the Group and customer interests are protected and managed in accordance with Regulatory and Industry best practices. The new CISO organisation is seeking to recruit a Head of Security Engineering and Cyber Security in a newly created role that will play an important part in defining and delivering our security solutions and services.
About Us:
OneSavings Bank Plc acquired Charter Court Financial Services Group Plc (CCFS) and its subsidiary businesses on 4 October 2019. They have three complementary brands: Charter Savings Bank; Precise Mortgages; Exact Mortgage Experts.
Together, the Group and its subsidiaries form the UK’s leading specialist mortgage lender, purpose built to meet increasing customer demand for specialist mortgages, attractive savings products, exceptional value and great service.
What you will be doing:
As Head of Security Engineering and Cyber Security, you will report to the Group CISO and leverage your technical and operational experience in building security capabilities and delivering security services to provide effective countermeasures to cyber threats and Information Security risks. You will be responsible for the management of the Security Engineering and Architecture team as well as the Cyber Operations. As a key member of the team you will play an important part in presenting strategic and tactical considerations to inform the InfoSec Strategy and Roadmap to address current and emerging cyber threats.

This is a growing and exciting function where it will be possible to influence the direction for the security services and build a high performing team. You will have the opportunity to communicate key messages to the business and build effective relationships with senior stakeholders.
The team are based across our UK sites and will require regular travel between offices as well as occasional travel to India in future (Government guidelines permitting).
Reporting to the Group CISO, you will:
Build and lead a team of Security Engineers, Architects and Security Analysts across our UK and India offices.
Build a team of dedicated cyber specialists and manage cyber operations to analyse threat intelligence and provide 24x7 monitoring and detection capabilities
Inform the strategic roadmap for Group Information Security
Engage with Exec stakeholders and committees as an advisor on all matters of information and cyber security
Set the direction for the team, driving achievement of functional and individual objectives
In return for your commitment:
We offer a base salary dependent on experience and a corporate benefits package including:
Discretionary annual bonus opportunity
Generous annual leave plus bank holidays
Pension, life assurance, access to private medical insurance and medical cash plan
Additional access to Season Ticket Loan Scheme, Cycle Purchase Scheme, Holiday Purchase/ Sell Scheme, Employee Perk portals and Save as you earn scheme.
Could you be the one?:
To be successful in the role, you would ideally possess:

Extensive experience managing a security function in a corporate IT based environment, ideally in Financial Services
Substantial experience in Security Engineering and Cyber Security Operations
Experience building new teams and developing strategic roadmaps
Excellent communication skills to build relationships across sites and effectively manage messages around security
What to do next:
If this sounds like you, please send us your CV! For internal applications, please ensure you complete the necessary application form prior to submitting your application via the internal careers page.
CLOSE DATE for internal applications will be Friday 27 November 2020.

Alternatively, if you wish to have an informal, confidential chat about this role, please contact us on recruitment@osb.co.uk.

If shortlisted from your initial application, we operate a personalised recruitment process. Interviews are a two way street, so we aim for them to be relevant and conversational, and get the best out of you!

As a combined group, we are dedicated to diversity in the workplace and we are committed to a policy of treating all our employees and job applicants equally. No employee or potential employee will receive less favourable treatment because of any protected characteristic. We provide a fully inclusive and accessible recruitment process and pro-actively offer and make reasonable adjustments as and when required.

We recognise that flexible working opportunities can be of benefit to both employees and the organisation, improving work-life balance and enabling the business to attract and retain skilled and valued employees. Please speak to us about how this could work for you.
All applicants must have rights to work in the UK and be willing to undertake the relevant pre-employment screening checks should your application be successful.
Unfortunately, due to the high number of applications currently being received, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Working within the Procurement Operations Team, it is the post-holder’s responsibility to ensure procurements are let in accordance with the Public Contract Regulations 2015, with CCS standard operating procedures.

Full time (36.5 hours per week) Permanent Position

We are seeking a Senior HR Systems Specialist to join our HR Department, primarily to manage and deliver a high-quality and efficient management information (MI) service for staff-related data.

It’s an exciting and challenging time to join us as we continue to develop our new HR system, SuccessFactors (SF) Employee Central, as well as implement other SF modules and SAP Payroll. You will play an important part in the development of our strategy to maximise the use and value of MI as we continue this significant University-wide change programme.

Drawing on your extensive experience in the development of reports and working with complex data structures, you will gather and interpret detailed MI requirements from internal and external sources and meet these needs effectively from our suite of HR systems using the most appropriate tools and format. Your work will be documented in a report catalogue and you will engage actively with your customers to gather their feedback and sign-off, consulting with them at appropriate stages of development.

As the person responsible for our annual return of staff-related data to the Higher Education Statistics Agency (HESA), you will maintain a current understanding of HESA requirements and ensure that the data capture, extraction and returns processes are optimised to support the University’s strategic objectives. Other aspects of your work will also have a statutory and/or strategic impact, including meeting reporting needs for the Research Excellence Framework, external charter marks/accreditations, equality monitoring and Freedom of Information Requests.

You will work closely with colleagues in IT Services to enable them to build the schema for the University’s data warehouse in line with our requirements and to ensure that there are appropriate security models in place. All of your activity will be underpinned by compliance with the General Data Protection Regulation.

At a demanding time within the HR Systems team, your ability to use your initiative and plan your workload effectively will enable you to hit the ground running.
Job Description
JOB PURPOSE

• To support and enable the University to optimise its strategic usage of staff-related data through the management and delivery of a high-quality and efficient management information service.

• To facilitate the effective management of HR processes and service delivery through the provision and development of a suite of operational reports.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

• To enable the University to meet its statutory obligations in relation to the provision of staff-related data.
Person Specification

The Person Specification focuses on the knowledge, skills, experience and qualifications required to undertake the role effectively. This is measured by (a) Application Form, (b) Test/Exercise, (c) Interview, (d) Presentation.
Essential Criteria 1
Degree in a relevant subject or equivalent experience (A)
Essential Criteria 2
Extensive experience in development of MI reports, including working with complex data structures (A)(C)
Essential Criteria 3
Experience of data analysis to identify trends and provide a summary of the key findings (A)(C)
Essential Criteria 4
High level, specialist knowledge of HR systems and HR business processes (A)(C)
Essential Criteria 5
High level analytical, problem solving, design and implementation skills (A)(B)(C)
Essential Criteria 6
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to allow effective and clear discussions around requirement and delivery, including with a non-technical audience (A)(B)(C)
Essential Criteria 7
Ability to work on own initiative with minimal supervision and to plan workload effectively to ensure targets are delivered on time (A)(C)
Essential Criteria 8
Ability to deal with complex technical issues in a timely, accurate and effective way (A)(B)(C)
Essential Criteria 9
Ability to manipulate data using a variety of tools including excel (A)(B)(C)
Desirable Criteria 1
Experience in application support or development environment (A)(C)
Desirable Criteria 2
Experience of reporting in SuccessFactors (A)(C)
Desirable Criteria 3
Experience of report writing in Cognos (A)(C)
Desirable Criteria 4
Experience of Higher Education, or HESA (A)(C)

By joining the American Red Cross you will touch millions of lives every year and experience the greatness of the human spirit at its best. Are you ready to be part of the world's largest humanitarian network?


Job Description:

The Services to the Armed Forces (SAF) mission is to provide care and comfort to the members of the United States Armed Forces and their families. It is the impetus for the establishment of the American Red Cross (ARC). SAF at the Red Cross is a mixture of both tradition and innovation. ARC continues to provide traditional support to military families; serve in military and veterans hospitals, and conduct emergency communication. But, we also continually adapt our traditional services and create new programs to meet the needs of today’s military member, veterans and their families.

The American Red Cross is currently looking for a full-time Regional Program Specialist to support the Services to the Armed Forces program at Mildenhall RAF (UK). This position is classified as “mobile”, which requires strict medical and security clearances, as well as the condition of worldwide deployment, as needed.

The SAF Regional Program Specialist supports the delivery of American Red Cross programs and services to meet the needs of United States military members, veterans and their families located on and around Mildenhall, in accordance with Red Cross policies and procedures. This is accomplished through working with volunteers and other Red Cross departments to support strong visibility for SAF programs within the community.

Responsibilities:

1. Relationship Management Support and Community Outreach: Supports building relationships with military leadership, key organizations and community leaders. Cultivates relationships and partnerships with external constituents in the local community, including government organizations, corporate partners, civic organizations and other community charitable and nonprofit agencies with the purpose of furthering the mission of the Red Cross. Outreach includes command meetings, education briefings, presentations or information sessions.
Volunteer Management Support: Supports a volunteer program to meet the workforce model and to enable delivery of SAF programs and services. Assists in the supervision of volunteer staff. Works closely with Regional Volunteer Services to develop and implement strategic regional SAF volunteer program. Helps ensure volunteer staff ratio reflects the diversity of the population being served.
Service Delivery: Ensures the delivery of SAF core services to all clients within their jurisdiction. Supports the other lines of ARC service to ensure the delivery of Preparedness, Health and Safety Services training, disaster preparedness and response, and Red Cross Blood Services. Services may include use of case management system, presenting briefings, collection of data, providing needed materials, and outreach within the community.
Reporting & Admin Support: Monitors and reports on the outcomes and results of programs and services to ensure organizational accountability and makes recommendations for continuous improvement to ensure metrics are consistently met.

Minimum Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor’s degree in business or public administration, human resources management, community organization, social or health sciences, or related field; or relevant equivalent experience is preferred. Associate’s degree with 5 years of experience or other combination of education and experience which provides an equivalent background is acceptable.
Experience: A minimum of three years related experience is required. Viable candidates must have a valid driver's license.

Skills and Abilities: Requires strong computer skills. Public speaking skills and the ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing are required. Must have strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work well in an individual or team environment. The ability to balance multiple priorities is essential. Experience with American Red Cross programs and services is desired. Familiarity with military culture, regulations and protocol is strongly desired.

Mobile position requirements:
• U.S. citizenship is required. Must be able to obtain a secret security clearance and a no-fee U.S. passport.
• Mobility is a condition of employment and an essential function of this position.
• Must accept work assignments to deployment locations in or near conflict areas, where the American Red Cross is providing services to members of the military.
• Must meet strict medical and physical requirements, including immunizations required by the U.S. military.
• May be required to wear uniforms, and live and work in harsh and stressful environment within conflict areas.

Apply now! Joining our team will provide you with the opportunity to make a difference every day.


The American Red Cross is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.



The American Red Cross is a diverse nonprofit organization offering its employee’s professional development and growth opportunities, a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a collaborative team spirit environment. To be considered for this position, please visit www.redcross.org/jobs to apply.

Why You'll Love Cisco


We change the World; you will become passionate about your employer and the brand you represent. Everything is converging on the Internet, making networked connections more meaningful than ever before in our lives. Our employees' groundbreaking ideas impact everything. Here, that means we take creative ideas from the drawing board to dynamic solutions that have real-world impact. You'll collaborate with Cisco leaders, partner with mentors, and develop incredible relationships with colleagues who share your interest in connecting the unconnected. You'll be part a team that cares about its customers, enjoys having fun, and you'll take part in changing the lives of those in our local communities. Come prepared to be encouraged and inspired.

What You’ll Do


As a Contact Center Cloud Sales Specialist, you’ll play a vital role in the success of the Cisco Field Sales and Collaboration Technology Group by helping our customers deliver better business outcomes and great customer experience. The primary responsibilities will include (but are not limited to):
Establish your sales strategy and exceed the regional sales goal.
Work with your extended team and Cisco partners to establish selling strategy to beat the competition through better targeting, positioning, and thought leadership for Cisco’s Contact Centre portfolio.
Establish and maintain customer relationships with Line of Business managers, Executives, HR, Marketing, IT, Sales and Procurement.
Own and forecast the opportunities for selling the full suite of our CCaaS solution including WFO/WFM, Analytics and AI.
Provide subject matter expertise in support of account teams particularly around positioning, pricing and overcoming objections.
Educate and support Cisco Account Managers and Partners on opportunity qualification and positioning of the solution.
Provide leadership to the Account Managers for account planning and execution to assist with deal closure
Partner closely with Engineers/Architects to align the technology architecture to the customer's desired business outcome and ensure customer success by aligning resources to assist the customer in realizing the full value of their technology investment.
Share detailed execution plans and progress with field leadership and account teams.
Improve Cisco's solution portfolio over time. As you meet with customers you will suggest improvements that ensure our customers continue to love what you sell.
Who You Are


You are an individual who is passionate about amazing customer experiences! This role will be instrumental in driving our strategic vision for Cisco Contact Center portfolio. You will be responsible for revenue growth with new and existing customers. Successful people in this role can articulate a compelling value proposition, provide sales support and serve as a subject matter expert for Cisco contact center platforms. We look for individuals who have a proven track record of overachieving and who like to WIN!
Proven experience understanding customer needs and being able to articulate solutions
Proven track record of growing your territory through increasing your pipeline with current customers and net new logos
Experience of selling complex software solutions into multiple vertical markets
Experience of selling either customer experience, contact center, CRM, digital transformation or similar technology stack
Cloud or SaaS based software sales preferred
Experience of being part of numerous complex and consultative sales engagements
Experience of working alongside or through partner organizations. Ability to influence indirectly through this partner community as well as directly with the customer and prospect base
A team player and a leader of virtual teams, able to orchestrate and win complex sales cycles
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Who You’ll Work With


Direct alignment with the Account Teams as well as many Business Unit resources and partners. You will be embracing unprecedented innovation and tremendous opportunity for growth. You will succeed because we listen to our customers and anticipate their needs as the market shifts and technology transitions accelerate. Our customers are versatile, agile and adopt technology fast to compete passionately and grow their business. The collaboration team provides you with unlimited opportunities to succeed at Cisco. Our culture will support and empower you.

We Are Cisco


#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.

We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!

But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)

Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.

So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

Job Description:
Join our Team – Site Security Manager, Data Centre- Slough

We are looking for flexible Individuals who can work on their own initiative and be part of a team. Our Security Officers are the face of Ward Security and therefore if you have an SIA license, have experience managing Security Officers and are passionate about security and safety, then please read on for our current Security Manager opportunity.

What is the role?

Security Manager – Frontline SIA required – no applications will be considered unless you hold a valid SIA License and have access to your own vehicle. All roles are subject vetting to a 5 year checkable history.

Where is it based?

In our West Region, Slough.

What is the Package?

Uniform, SIA Licensing savings scheme, 5.6 weeks annual leave Cycle to Work Salary Sacrifice, Pension and Life Assurance

Working in partnership with Perkbox offering all employees a range of benefits ranging from retailer discounts, cinema tickets, wellness and gym membership and many other fantastic benefits for you to enjoy. *available after 6 months service

Who we are:

Ward Security provides a security services solutions to all UK businesses. Security services include: CCTV security systems, property management, guard dog security, key holding services, security guard patrol services, response alarm systems and more.

With over 800 employees operating nationally we seek the best talent to uphold our vision to be the most trusted Security Partner in the UK.

Ward Security recruit, train and reward the very best staff, complemented by the latest technology and communications to ensure the highest levels of security and Client service.

We will need your current CV and you can upload this on your online application form and send this to HR.Queries@ward-security.co.uk quoting the Job Reference.

Read about us @ www.ward-security.co.uk

What is the main purpose of the role?
Directly manage the supervision of personnel, ensuring that the Company’s obligations are adhered to at all times in a timely and professional manner.
Ensure all personnel on site under your remit, are rostered appropriately to ensure that the contractual obligations are met.
Be the first port of call for all security issues and staff issues on site, and escalate as necessary.
Ensure that all relevant information is collated and recorded for future reference.
Liaise with all security officers ensuring that all information is made available in order for the operation of the Company to work in an effective manner.
Provide documentation and reports in support of the day-to-day operational activities.
Respond and take action in event of evacuations and emergencies ensuring that your team take appropriate action.
Ensure that staff and clients of the Company assist the Compliance Director to ensure agreement with policies and regulations adhere to Health & Safety policies and regulations.
Participate in, and ensure the continuation of specialist training to key members of staff within the remit of your authority.
Ensure that all members of your team work in an appropriate and effective manner, whilst giving further training in specific areas where required.
Complete performance appraisals when necessary, and liaise directly with Regional Operations Manager to ensure that in periods of sickness and absence, that the site remains fully manned at all times.
What experience, skills and attributes do I need?
Able to construct a legible report.
Good interpersonal skills with an ability to communicate clearly with people at all levels projecting a confident and professional manner.
Experience within a similar position is preferred
A 5-year checkable work history to include Supervisory employment.
To be able to observe and accurately record incidents as they occur.
Be able to prioritise workloads and be flexible in the approach to varied tasks.
Physically fit for the environment of the workplace.
To be of smart appearance at all times whilst representing the company image.
To be punctual in attendance.
Able to work with minimal supervision.
Ward Security are an Equal Opportunities Employer.

Ward Security is pleased to announce that it has become a Recognised Service Provider working alongside the Living Wage Foundation. The achievements means Ward Security and all its subsidiaries meet the standards set by Citizens UK and Centre for Civil Society for good practice by providers of personnel under contract.

Ward Security is an approved HABC Training Centre to deliver security recognised training qualifications in:
Level 2 Working as a Security Officer in the Private Security Industry
Level 2 Working as a Door Supervisor in the Private Security Industry
Level 2 Award for Working as a CCTV Operator (Public Space Surveillance) in the Private Security Industry
Location: Slough, Berkshire, South East England, England
